loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rowena is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rowena has a broom-making business in the Philippines. Rowena requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks and other items

Rowena has been in this business for six years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo sticks and other items.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 52 years old lady married and a mother of four children, two are currently attending school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training and especially enterprise development.

She is involved in mixed farming; she keeps dairy and does crop farming. She has applied Kiva loan to purchase animal feeds and fertilizers to increase crop and dairy production.  With increased stock, she will be able to satisfy her customer's needs hence increase her sales and income.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and animal feeds to boost her crop and dairy production to satisfy her customers needs

loans.name: Deysi Emeli

texts.es: Deysi de 36 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 2 hijas, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 10 años,  vende sus productos durante todo el año a los comerciantes que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas y así poder iniciar con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos económicos ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Deysi is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two daughters. She has earned a living cultivating corn and sorghum for 10 years. She sells her products all year round to traders near to where she lives. With the income from her sales she manages to pay some of her household expenses. She is asking for a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest controls and herbicides so she can start her crops to have a better economic income, as this is her only source of work.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, pest controls and herbicides.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 39 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Yolanda works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like dried fish, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Yolanda has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as soap, coffee, canned goods, dried fish, beverages, and other groceries. 

In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like dried fish, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in candies, cold drinks, basic grains, milk products, etc.

loans.name: Villa Pumacahua Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Villa Pumacahua” está conformada por 07 socios responsables. Este es el caso de Marcos de 59 años de edad, soltero. Marcos actualmente trabaja como guardián en una casa de campo. En esta oportunidad solicita el crédito para poner un negocio de venta de zapatos para que así pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. El grupo “Villa Pumacahua” agradece a los inversionistas de Kiva por la ayuda brindada. Marcos se encuentra parado en la parte posterior, es el primero del lado derecho y viste chompa de color celeste.
texts.en:
The "Villa Pumacahua" Communal Bank is comprised of 7 supportive partners. This is the case of Marcos who is 59 years old and single. Marcos currently works as a caretaker at a summer house. At this opportunity he requests a loan to start a business of selling shoes, in order to improve his quality of life. 

The "Villa Pumacahua" group is grateful to Kiva investors for the help given. Marcos is standing at the back and is on the right in a light blue sweater.

loans.use: to start a business of selling shoes

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose  al negocio de venta de golosinas, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua vendiendo galletas,dulces,gaseosas y chocolates, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar galletas, dulces entre otros.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nicasia continues to make a living from selling snacks. She has made a living for years from this business, which is going well for her thanks to the determination that she applies each day to her business. She continues to sell cookies, sweets, sodas, and chocolates, this being the way that she brings her family out ahead.

She is requesting the loan to purchase cookies and sweets, among others.

She is thankful to those who form a part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments in the established time-frame.

loans.use: to purchase cookies and sweets, among others.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, tomatoes and onions. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. 

She will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and onions. 

She hopes that in the future she will buy land. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes, tomatoes and onions

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has seven children. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a food stall. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of products. 

She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. 

Her business goal is to start a meat selling business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will give her kids a quality education. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is thankful that she was granted a 8,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expense. 

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use as her working capital to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles and frozen foods, which she sells at retail. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings. 

Her income from her store is a stable source to sustain her family's basic needs and for the education of her children. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Lydia dreams of having a bigger general store and aims to give her children the best education possible to allow them better opportunities in life. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Ante la necesidad de apoyar a su cónyuge con los gastos familiares y considerando sus conocimientos en pedagogía,  Mariluz  decidió  hace 6 años emprender  su  idea de negocio desde su propia casa donde inició su actividad de refuerzo escolar aprovechando la necesidad planteada por los padres de los niños que residen en el sector y que requerían apoyo para refuerzos educativos, acompañamiento en tareas escolares o afianzamiento de conocimientos; los padres requieren que sus hijos mejoren académicamente y un lugar donde sus hijos puedan estar en las horas en que ellos trabajan. Actualmente Mariluz tiene una gran demanda para sus servicios, pero requiere adquirir escritorios y sillas recursos financieros que planea conseguir con el primer credikiva que está tramitando con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Ella manifiesta que su meta es generar los recursos suficientes para brindar una buena educación a sus tres hijos de 15, 14 y 21 años que a futuro desea convertir en profesionales.
texts.en:
Faced with the need to help her spouse with the family expenses, and considering her knowledge of teaching, Mariluz decided to pursue her idea for a business from her own home. 

Six years ago she began offering tutoring services in response to the need expressed by the parents of children in her neighborhood. Children needed educational support, help with homework or strengthening their knowledge. Parents were seeking a place where their children could improve academically and be during the hours that they work. 

Currently Mariluz has great demand for her services, but she needs to buy desks and chairs with financial resources she obtains through her first Kiva loan, channeling through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. 

She says her goal is to generate sufficient recourses to offer a good education to her three children, ages 15, 14 and 21. She hopes for them to make them into professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy desks and chairs.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 66 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Adelaida is borrowing 29,500 Philippines Pesos (PHP) through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Adelaida has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 73 years old, married with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma. Luz has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Luz requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

Ma. Luz has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda is 45 years old and has four children. Gilda is married and has two children who are in school.

Gilda is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gilda requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gilda has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma. Luz is 52 years old and married with 4 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Luz runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, soft drinks and other personal care products. 

In the future, Ma. Luz would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Osovale

texts.en:
Osovale is 43 years old and married with five children. She runs a small business selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for two years. 

Osovale has requested a loan to buy a bag of flour, yeast, baking powder, cooking oil, and other items. She joined SPBD in June this year, 2015, to gain access to capital. 

With her earnings, Osovale will save for unexpected emergencies and to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a bag of flour, yeast, baking powder, cooking oil, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in corn, beans, cheese, pork rinds, rice flour, butter, blackberries, pumpkins, etc.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana is 48 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Diana is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Diana has been farming rice for 15 years and also earns additional income from retailing frozen food.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Mariana Group

texts.en:
Friendship Bridge works primarily with indigenous populations in rural areas in Guatemala where the rate of poverty is the highest. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of the organization combines microcredit with basic education on everyday topics including nutrition, health and self-esteem as well as women’s rights, violence against women and teenage pregnancy. The ladies learn to more effectively manage their loans with information about budgeting, marketing, pricing, accounting and sales. Friendship Bridge Facilitators meet with each Trust Bank monthly and in the indigenous language of the ladies, teach through the use of role playing, pictures and diagrams.

Juana is a 45-year-old member of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Mariana,” located in the rural area of Santa María Visitación in the highlands, about three hours from the capitol. There are seven women in the group located in the village, Mariana. Juana is the president of the trust bank, a role that she takes seriously and proudly. 

The trust bank received their first loan funded by KIVA investors one year ago. They are just about to successfully pay back the entire loan! They are requesting a new loan that they hope will be funded by KIVA investors. Juana will use her loan in her animal husbandry business, as well as in her new business which is the making of candles. She plans to purchase 50 chickens, as well as food to fatten them up, and as she added a new business to her life, now she needs to buy wax and other supplies to make more candles. 

The women in the Trust Bank appreciate the generosity of KIVA investors in funding their much-needed loans. In receiving these loans and managing them effectively, the ladies increase productivity and sales and generate higher income and an improved standard of living for their families. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase 50 chickens, as well as food to fatten them up, also to purchase wax and other supplies to make more candles

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Ellen.  She is married and has one child aged 29. She has two additional dependents, who live with her and are her sales assistants.  In 1997, Ellen established her drinks and fish business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband in their family's affairs. Her business is located on the outskirts of the town and her main customers are locals.

Working 6 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Ellen requires a loan in order to buy cartons of fish for resale. She hopes that this loan will support her through its proper use.   

In the future, Ellen still wants to erect a guest house from her business. 

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons of fish for resale

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es: Luz es una madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 10 años de edad que asisten a la escuela, ella trabaja en una finca ordeñando las vacas, cometa que su patrón le permite tener animales en esta finca y ella cría chanchos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para incrementar su negocio, Luz aspira que su negocio mejore y sea lo suficientemente rentable para sacar adelante a su hijos y pagar puntualmente su crédito.
texts.en:
Luz is a single mother. She has 2 children, who are 8 and 10 years old and who attend school. She works on a farm milking the cows. She says that her boss allows her to have animals on this farm, so she raises pigs. 

The loan is going to be invested in buying pigs to grow her business. Luz hopes that her business improves and becomes profitable enough for her to take her children forward and to pay back her loan on time.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetic products for her beauty parlour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in fabrics, threads in various colors, elastic, buttons, zippers, fasteners, and needles. This loan will allow her to keep on with her business and supporting her children.

loans.name: Hershey Mae

texts.en:
She is Hershey Mae, 21, and resident of Silang Cavite, Philippines. She has a life partner named Jerome, who works as a service crew. She has a small business to augment their income to meet their personal and household needs.

Hershey Mae is a dealer of different kinds of processed meat.  She earns by buying several packs of process meat at wholesale price and selling them at retail price. Her food items include marinated pork, marinated beef, hot dog, bacon etc.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, and the local community. She is happy with the return on her investment. She earns a minimum of PHP 900 in sales every day.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19000 loan which she will use the loan to buy several packs of various kinds of processed meat to meet the increased demand of her food items, especially now that school year has started in the Phils. She is also thanking God and you in advance for your great help.

Hershey Mae hopes to be able to grow her business and aims to live a happy and prosperous life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy various kinds of processed meat to sell

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elena is 56 years old now.

Elena has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Elena requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fabric, and other materials needed.

Elena has been in this business for 31 years. In the future, Elena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and other materials needed

loans.name: Bernalyn

texts.en:
Bernalyn is married with four children and a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc.
  
Bernalyn support the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

She took an Educational loan for her son Rodrigo, 19 years old and is 3rd of 4 children in the family, who is studying Bachelor of Science in Marine Technology and is currently in the 1st of this 4 year course.

Bernalyn is borrowing to pay the tuition fees of her son Rodrigo for the First Semester of the school year 2015-2016.

Rodrigo plans when she graduates to help her parents earn an income to send her brother and sister in college.

loans.use: to pay her son's tuition fees for a B.Sc. in Marine Technology

loans.name: Wend Daabo De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr BARRE PROSPER est responsable du groupe WEND DAABO DE BINGO. Marié, il est père de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 25ans et le moins âgé a 09ans. Les 06 vont à l'école.

Mr fait le maraichage depuis plus de 40ans. Il s'approvisionne dans le marché de son village.

Mr veut s'acheter 01 boite de semence de tomate, 01boite d'oignon, 03sachet de chou, 02sacs d'engrais et 02rouleaux de grillage.

Il veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne  pouvoir stocker les semences et les revendre en gros et devenir un grand jardinier
texts.en: Barre Prosper is the representative of the Wend Daabo de Bingo Group. He is married and has six children. The eldest child is 25 years old and the youngest is 9 years old. All six of his children currently attend school. Barre Prosper has been growing vegetables for over 40 years. He buys his supplies at the local market in his village. He plans to use his loan to purchase one box of tomato seeds, one box of onions, three bags of cabbages, two bags of fertilizer and two rolls of wire mesh. Barre Prosper wants to use the profits he earns to strengthen his business. In the future, he would like to become a seed stockist and sell seeds wholesale, as well as become a successful gardener.

loans.use: to purchase one box of tomato seeds, one box of onions, three bags of cabbages, two bags of fertilizer and two rolls of wire mesh

loans.name: Yakutkhan

texts.ru: Якутхан, 60 лет, замужем, есть 4 дочери и 3 сыновей. У Якутхан высшее образование, сейчас она на пенсии, также 25 лет назад она решила начать свой бизнес, которым и занимается до сих пор. Якутхан занимается сельским хозяйством, у нее есть 9 коров, 37 овец. На 1,0 Га арендованной и 1,0 Га собственной земли выращивает органическую кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Якутхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян для выращивания органических продуктов. Якутхан планирует и дальше расширять ее бизнес.
texts.en: Yakutkhan is 60 years old and married with four daughters and three sons. She has a high school education and is a pensioner. Twenty-five years ago she decided to start her own business which she still runs today. Yakutkhan is a farmer with nine cows and 37 sheep. On her one hectare rented plot as well as her own one hectare plot she grows organic corn and wheat to sell. In order to grow her business, Yakutkhan turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to purchase seeds for organic vegetables. Yakutkhan plans to grow her business even further.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing organic corn and wheat

loans.name: Tegawende Group

texts.fr:
Mr NOAGA est responsable du groupe   TEGAWENDE. Il est marié et père de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 30 ans et le moins âgé a 08 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et il a 07 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’élevage depuis 10 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans  les  marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte acheter 04 moutons, 05 chèvres et 20 poules.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour réinvestir dans son activité et aider sa famille. Il ambitionne être un grand eleveur.
texts.en:
Noaga is the leader of the Tegawende group. He is married and the father of seven children. The eldest child is 30 years old and the youngest is eight years old. Two of the children are in school. Noaga takes care of seven people.

He has worked raising livestock for 10 years. He procures his livestock from the surrounding markets.

With this loan, he plans to buy four sheep, five goats, and 20 chickens. He wants to use his earnings from the loan to reinvest in his business and to help his family.

He dreams of becoming a large livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy four sheep, five goats, and 20 chickens

loans.name: Teedbeogo De Bingo Group

texts.fr:
Mr WANENOGO EDMOND est responsable du groupe TEEDBEOGO DE BINGO. Marié, il est père de 09enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins a 010mois. 03 vont à l’école.
Mr fait l’élevage depuis plus de 20ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Il veut s’acheter  02 moutons, 03 chèvres.
Avec ses bénéfices, il veut renforcer son activité. Mr ambitionne devenir un grand éleveur.
texts.en:
Wanenogo Edmond is the leader of the Teedbeogo De Bingo group. Married, he is the father of nine children. His eldest child is 21 years old and his youngest is 10 months old. Three of the children go to school.

Wanenogo Edmond has been a livestock farmer for more than 20 years. He procures his livestock from the surrounding markets.

He is going to buy two sheep and three goats [with this loan]. 

With his earnings, he wants to strengthen his business. 

Wanenogo Edmond dreams of becoming a large livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy two sheep and three goats

loans.name: Bonswend Songre Koulgorin Group

texts.fr:
Mme LAMOUSSA est responsable du groupe BONSWEND SONGRE KOULGORIN. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 05 vont à l’école.
Mme vend du dolo (bière de mil) et des céréales depuis plus de 25ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Elle veut s’acheter 20 sac de mil germé et un sac de noix de karité.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut aider à l'épanouissement des enfants. Elle ambitionne devenir une grande commerçante de céréales (grossiste).
texts.en:
Lamoussa is the leader of the Bonswend Songre Koulgorin group. Married, she is the mother of five children. Her eldest child is 20 years old and the youngest is six years old. All of the children go to school.

Lamoussa has sold dolo (millet beer) and cereals for more than 25 years. She procures her goods from the surrounding markets. 

With this loan, she is going to buy 20 sacs of sprouted millet and one sac of shea nuts. With her earnings, she wants to help her children develop.

She dreams of becoming a large cereal wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacs of sprouted millet and one sac of shea nuts

loans.name: Barrina Umoja Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the in the photo is Laures,  a member of Barrina Umoja women Group. Laures is sixty eight years old married and blessed with five children, he joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.
Laures does maize, beans and poultry farming.  Having gone through HiH EA enterprise and financial training, he has been able to commercialize his business to earn profit.

He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and chicken feeds.  This will increase the quality of his yields thus earn him more income. With increased income Laures will be able to take care of his family basic needs, education and medical care.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, seeds and chicken feeds and increase the quality of farm yields leading to more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Barrina Umoja Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the in the photo is Mary. She is forty nine years old, married and blessed with four children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.

Mary does maize, beans and poultry farming.  Having gone through HiH EA enterprise and financial training, she has been able to commercialize her business and earn profit.

She is takiing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer and seeds that will increase her yield thus earn  more income. With increased income Mary will be able to cater for family basic needs, education and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will increase yield thus earn more income.

loans.name: Morning Star Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Florence, a member of Morning star women group in Nakuru Kenya. She is thirty two years old, married and blessed with three children. Florence joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.Florence does maize, beans and millet farming. 

HiH EA enterprise training has enabled her manage her enterprise well, thus earning more profit.  She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of her yields thus maximize profit.  Income from this enterprise will help her meet family basic needs, education and medical care.
She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of crop yields thus maximize profit.

loans.name: Myrzagul

texts.ru: Мырзагул, 32 года, замужем, 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дополнительного дохода с 2005 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Мырзагул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 1,0 Га земли, где она выращивает подсолнечник для реализации. Также есть 3 коровы. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 14,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мырзагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Мырзагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Myrzagul is 32 years old and married with two children. She has a high school education and has been farming and raising livestock since 2005 as a source of extra income. Thanks to her diligent work Myrzagul now has one hectare of land where she grows sunflowers to sell. She also has three cows. Her monthly income from the business is 14,000 KGS. With the goal of further developing her business, Myrzagul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 80,000 KGS to purchase cattle and increase her herd.  She plans to use profits from the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase a lawn mower, vitamins and chicken feed.

loans.name: Saltanat

texts.ru: Салтанат, 24 года, замужем, мать 2 детей. У нее высшее образование. В поисках дополнительного дохода для своей семьи Салтанат занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2009 году, благодаря упорному труду Салтанат, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 коровы, 12 овец, 3 лошади. На земельной доле мерою 3,0 Га она выращивает люцерну, пшеницу и рис для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Салтанат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров и 5 овец. Доходы от кредита Салтанат планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Saltanat is 24 years old and married with two children. She has a university education. In order to earn extra income for her family, Saltanat has been raising livestock and farming since 2009. Thanks to her diligent work Saltanat now has four cows, 12 sheep, and three horses. On her 3 hectare plot she grows alfalfa, wheat, and rice, which she both uses and sells. In order to further develop her business, Saltanat turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase two cows and five sheep. She plans to use the income to further increase her herd.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows and 5 sheep in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Mario Antonio

texts.es: Mario de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 4 hijos, el posee una  tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 9 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas es como logra salir adelante, el quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo, pero como no cuenta con capital suficiente está solicitando un crédito para la comprar laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para que el y sus hijos puedan vivir más seguros y cómodos.
texts.en: Mario is 40 years old and lives with his four children in a house that he owns.  He owns a store located in his home, which he has run for the past nine years.  Through his sales, he is able to get ahead.  He wants to make improvements to his home by replacing the roof.  However, he does not have enough capital to do so, which is why he is seeking a loan to purchase sheet metal, purlins and pay for labor so that he and his children can live safer and more comfortably.

loans.use: purchase sheet metal, purlins, and pay for labor.

loans.name: Gabriel De Jesus

texts.es: Gabriel de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos posee 25 años de experiencia en la actividad, vende sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside y con las ganancias que obtiene logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, entre otros para continuar con sus cultivos ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Gabriel, 41, lives with his wife and 3 children in a house that they own. He works growing basic grains, and he has 25 years of experience doing so. He sells his products throughout the region where he lives.  With his earnings, he is able to get ahead.  He is seeking a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc., in order to continue with his work as it is his only source of income.

loans.use: purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, pesticides, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Jennifer

texts.en:
Ma. Jennifer is 41 years old. She is married with two dependents aged twelve and fourteen. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in Badian, Cebu and has requested a loan of Php10000 through CEVI to buy feed, soy sauce, bleaching agent, detergent, biscuits, canned goods and noodles. She have had this business for more than two years now. 

In the future, she aspires to save more money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, soy sauce, bleaching agent, detergent, biscuits, canned goods and noodles

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresa is 44 years old and has three children presently in school.

Teresa has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Teresa has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her dried fish business

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en: Romelia is still working as a secretary and she has two sons. Romelia has her own house but she is finishing the construction works step by step, which will take a lot of time. Romelia needs another loan to buy windows and doors for her house. Romelia is divorced and now her father is living with her. She hopes you can help her again. As you can see in the picture she really needs windows and doors for her house.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows for her house

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle.

He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital.

He will use the KES 100,000 loan to service and maintain the motorcycle, and buy another motorcycle.

He hopes that in the future, he will be prosperous. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to service and maintain the motorcycle, and buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is a married woman with 11 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Dolores is 60 years old now.

Dolores has a broom-making business in the Philippines. She requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc.

Dolores has been in this business for four years. In the future, Dolores would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leah is 27 years old and has one child in school.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines. Leah requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Leah has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Aireen

texts.en:
As the married mother of two children, Aireen works hard to support her family.

She has an ice candy vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising ducks. Aireen is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

Aireen has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her ice candy business.

loans.name: Ma. Crinalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Ma. Crinalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a broom-making business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Ma. Crinalyn is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc. for her broom-making business.

Ma. Crinalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials needed like bamboo stick, etc.

loans.name: Epefania

texts.en:
Epefania is 47 years old. She is married with three children. Her youngest is 17 years old.

Epefania is engaged in a general store business and a small restaurant. She is asking for a loan through CEVI to buy cases of beer, soft drinks, and cigarettes. Epefania hopes that this will positively impact her sales and help improve her customer base.

In the future, she hopes to make her business more successful.

loans.use: to buy cases of beer, soft drinks, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest. 

She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of charcoal. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Agustina

texts.en:
Agustina is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Agustina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

Agustina has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Agustina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.
La socia Hortencia continua con su negocio de  crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos, gallinas y chanchos, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues to be part of the “Virgen Concebida de Arin” communal bank.

Hortensia continues with her business of raising small animals such guinea pigs, poultry and pigs.She has been working in her business for years, and it is going well, thanks to the effort she puts into it each day. This is how she is supporting her family.

The member is requesting the loan in order to buy small animals such as guinea pigs and others. She is grateful for the loan, and promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy small animals such as guinea pigs and others.

loans.name: Yuhum

texts.en:
As the married mother of three children, Yuhum works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Yuhum is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Yuhum has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 26 years old, married with one child who is in school.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Rosemarie has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Rosemarie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional fruits to sell in her food stall.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy additional fruits to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Venus works hard to support her family.

She has a handicraft making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Venus is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy raw materials for her handicraft making business.

Venus has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her handicraft making business.

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Janice works hard to support her family.

She has a knitting business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store. Janice is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her arts business.

Janice has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her arts business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is 46 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Myrna has a direct selling Avon, Natasha and Tupperware products business in the Philippines. Myrna requested a PHP 29000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional products like lotion, body spray, body soap, lipsticks, etc. to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Myrna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like lotion, body spray, body soap, lipsticks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana owns a small farmland in Koibatek location where she lives with her family. She keeps sheep and produces cash crops at a small scale. She sells her farm produce at Kapsowar which is a local market near her home. She started farming many years ago and through the years she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

The biggest growth constraint that Susana tackling is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds and fertilizer.  

With your lending, Susana will be able access capital, from a licenced and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Alma Jeaneth

texts.es: Alma de 43 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su  hija, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 10 años tiene muchos clientes por la variedad de productos y los buenos precios, con las ventas que realiza es como ha podido salir adelante, ella  esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de granos básicos, huevos, azúcar, etc. por mayor y asi aumentar de mercadería para tener mejor ingreso económico.
texts.en: Alma, who is 43 years old, lives in her own house with her husband and her daughter. She has had a little shop located in her residence for 10 years. She has many customers because of the variety of products and the good prices. With the sales that she makes, she has been able to get ahead. She is applying for a loan for the wholesale purchase of basic grains, eggs, sugar, etc., to thus increase her merchandise in order to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, eggs, sugar, etc., wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for the benefit of her tea farm

loans.name: Ruqia

texts.en:
Ruqia is a 30 year old, married with three sons and three daughters and living in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband provides a local rural transport repair facility to the people of his society. He has been repairing tractor and trolley transports. He has his own tractor repairing kit for the last ten years.But now her husband has to repair his tractor and trolley for construction of a good supplies business. So her husband has decided to repair his tractor as soon as possible. 

But due to lack of finance finds it difficult to cover the repairing cost of his tractor. Therefore, Ruqia has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help him to cover the cost of repairing of his tractor. Ruqia is so much thankful to kiva and brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair the tractor and trolley of her husband

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal MADRES TRABAJADORAS, la socia sigue  dedicándose  al negocio de transporte, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
El socio solicita el crédito para hacer el mantenimiento de  su carro.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "Madres Trabajadores." He continues working in the transportation business. He has been working in his business for a long time, and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into it every day. He wants to be able to continue working so that in this way he can continue supporting his family.

He feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on his account.

He is applying for the loan to do maintenance on his car.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida is a married woman and has been running her beauty parlor for the past ten years. She does her job passionately. She knows the techniques of makeup and hair design. She is a well-known beautician in her town. Khalida is a responsible mother of two children and is working hard to meet their day-to-day expenses. 

She has slowly but surely improved her business through the support of BRAC Pakistan. Now she has requested a loan of 60,000 PKR to buy more beauty products including lotions, makeup kits and lightening creams. The loan would enable her to cater to a large number of customers efficiently.

loans.use: to buy beauty products for her parlor

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr: Akouavi est une femme mariée âgée de 38 ans et mère de trois enfants. Akouavi vit à Agoè pour entreprendre son activité. Akouavi vend des produits d’alimentations générales pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Akouavi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché. Akouavi demande ce crédit pour acheter des bidons d’huile et des sacs de sucre afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Akouavi is a 38-year old married woman and the mother of three. Akouavi lives and works in Agoe. She sells staple food items in order to make a living and help her family. Akouavi stocks up twice a month at the market. Akouavi is requesting this loan to buy some jugs of oil and bags of sugar so as to earn a revenue allowing her to help her husband support their family and provide a good education to their children.

loans.use: to buy three jugs of oil and two bags of sugar for resale.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Iloilo, just like other provinces in the Visayas region of the Philippines, was hard hit by Typhoon Haiyan in November 2013. Almost all businesses in those areas dwindled if not went bankrupt. Sari-saris, or small variety stores, were not exempt from that crisis. Frequent distribution of relief goods to Haiyan-affected communities almost crushed them because the commodities that people needed every day were given to them through relief organizations. It was several months after Haiyan before variety stores started to recover.

Mildred is one of those sari-sari owners. Not only did Haiyan affect her business, but her income also shrank during school breaks and vacations when her customer base diminished. Now that school has begun she needs more inventory such as cookies, chips, candies, canned goods, sachets of toiletries, juices, soft drinks, beverages, and many others.

Through Kiva's field partner CCT Credit Cooperative Mildred is now applying for a 12,000 PHP loan to restock her shop. She also plans to use part of the loan to pay for the repair of their tricycle that has been idle for quite some time.

Mildred asks for your kind support to enable her to pay for these needs. May you be God’s blessing to her as she works to develop her business into a grocery store someday.

All CCT community clients are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God. Mildred is a devoted member of CCT and prays for a harmonious relationship with her husband Richard and their children.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her sari-sari, or variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a pick-up truck and recyclable materials.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is 37 years old and married with two children. For the past eight years he has made a living by working as a taxi driver. Elnur is the only person earning an income for his family, as his wife has health problems. His salary is 100 AZN a month, but this isn’t enough to meet the family’s expenses.

Elnur is applying for a 330 AZN through Kiva's field partner Aqroinvest Credit Union because his wife is now seriously ill. As you know, medical expenses are high and drugs are expensive. Please give your support to Elnur in this time of need.

loans.use: to pay medical expenses for his wife

loans.name: Rene Everardo

texts.es: René de 46 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo posee 20 años de dedicarse a ese trabajo y gracias a las ventas que realiza es como el puede salir adelante con su familia, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder tener mejores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
René, who is 46 years old, lives in his own house with his family group. He raises corn and sorghum and has 20 years of experience doing this work. Thanks to the sales that he makes, he is getting ahead, along with his family. 

He is applying for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc., and thus be able to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pest controls, etc.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al  banco comunal “Virgen Concebida de Arin”.
La socia continua con su negocio de  crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos, gallinas y chanchos, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the communal bank "Virgen Concebida de Arin". She continues with her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, hens, and pigs. The member has had her business for many years, and she does very well as a result of the effort that she puts forth every day. With her business, she continues supporting her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, among others. The borrower is thankful for the loan, and she promises to make her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs, among others.

loans.name: Luisa Amelia

texts.es:
Luisa es una mujer emprendedora y fuerte, desde joven ha sabido ganarse el pan de cada día. Por ello, cuando tuvo la oportunidad de iniciar su negocio no lo dudo; hoy es propietaria de una pulpería, en la que también aprovecha para vender gas butano, lo cual le genera buenos dividendos pues la demanda es alta.
 Sin embargo, solicita un crédito para comprar granos básicos, golosinas, gaseosas, productos de uso personal, verduras, etc. Esto le será de ayuda porque podrá ofrecer variedad y calidad en su pulpería. Luisa planea comprar una motocicleta para ofrecer los servicios de gas butano con entrega a  domicilio y ofertar productos escolares en su pulpería.
texts.en:
Luisa is a strong and entrepreneurial woman. Since her youth, she has known how to earn the daily bread. For this reason, when she had the opportunity to begin her business, she did not hesitate. Now she is the proprietor of a grocery store, in which she also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell butane gas, which generates good dividends for her, since the demand is high.

Nevertheless, she is applying for a loan to purchase basic grains, candies, soft drinks, products for personal use, vegetables, etc. This will be of help to her because she will be able to offer variety and quality in her grocery store. Luisa plans to buy a motorcycle in order to offer butane gas services with household delivery, and she plans to offer school supplies in her grocery store.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, candies, soft drinks, products for personal use, vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, and nails to put the roof of the hall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase sand, gravel, iron and cement to build concrete columns for improving the corridor of her house

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
Ma. Dolores is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Dolores dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Lakoele

texts.fr: Lakoele est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans et mère de deux enfants. Lakoele vit à Agoè pour entreprendre son activité. Lakoele vend des produits de commerce général en parcourant le quartier pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Lakoele s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Lakoele demande ce crédit pour acheter des cartons de spaghettis afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à ses enfants.
texts.en: Lakoele is a 28-year old married woman and the mother of two. She lives and works in Agoe. Lakoele sells staple food items in order to make a living and help her family. She stocks up four times a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to stock up on boxes of pasta so as to earn a revenue allowing her to help her husband support their family and provide a good education for their children.

loans.use: to buy five boxes of pasta fo resale.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is 56 years old, married to Biliah and supports a family of four children.

He has been practicing farming for the last 24 years, earning KES 12,000 per month.

Charles has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to supply milk to gain more income gain.

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his farming activities.

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply milk to gain more income

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es: Rosa tiene 32 años de edad y habita en casa propia con sus dos hijos una niña de 6 años y un varón de 11 años de edad. Ella es madre soltera y con su esfuerzo y trabajo ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos. Rosa se dedica a prestar sus servicios de oficios domésticos dentro del municipio y los fines de semana hacen tamales para vender. Ella desea hacer el cambio de techo de su casa ya que este se encuentra deteriorado por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para compra de lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda y brindar una mayor protección a sus hijos en el próximo invierno.
texts.en:
Rosa is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her two children, a 6-year-old daughter and a 11-year-old son. She is a single mother, and with her effort and work, she has managed to get ahead with her children.

She works as a domestic worker within the municipality and makes tamales for sale on the weekends. 

She wishes to change the deteriorated ceiling of her house. She is requesting FUSAI for a loan to purchase roofing sheets, wood, and nails, in order to change the ceiling and to offer a better protection for her children in the upcoming winter.

loans.use: to purchase roofing sheets, wood, and nails to change the ceiling of her house, in order to offer better protection for her children

loans.name: Muhammed

texts.en: Muhammed is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Tajiri Village. He joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children. In the past, Muhammed suffered from poor yields that inhibited his ability to improve his farming skills. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Muhammed has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, he will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilisers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Muhammed can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 44 years old and married with five children.

Loida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like junk food, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Loida has borrowed and paid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Loida aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like junk food, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Eva Zulma

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer  de 33 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 12 años, y su negocio es la venta de comida.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, comprensiva, paciente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘12 de marzo’ considerada una de las pioneras de la ciudad y se caracteriza por acoger en casi la totalidad de sus calles y avenidas a cerca de medio millón de gremiales. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados.
Eva es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello largo negro lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua nativa es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en compañía de sus padres que trabajan, y con su hijo que asisten a la escuela por las mañanas para ayudar en el comercio por la tarde. Viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de comida; ella se encarga de preparar comida para la hora de almuerzo y cena. El almuerzo popular consiste en varios platos uno después del otro, primero sirve la entrada (plato frío puede ser medio huevo duro con zanahoria rallada), la tradicional sopa que puede ser de diferentes tipos, el se4gundo es el plato fuerte del almuerzo y generalmente es una presa de carne acompañada de verduras y arroz o fideo, al finalizar sirve el postre que consiste en una fruta puede ser naranja o un plátano, “inicie mi negocio con la ayuda de mi ex pareja, con nuestra separación me quedé sin capital de trabajo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuanta con clientes continuos, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer el negocio de insumos de cocina y otros como gaseosas, etc. Su sueño es abastecer su negocio para que funcione correctamente, ella desea realizar la compra de insumos de cocina por mayor como; verduras, carnes, aceite, pastas, refrescos, etc. Para continuar con su negocio y pagar los gastos de su hijo. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Eva solicita un préstamo para la compra de víveres de cocina para continuar con su negocio y pagar los gastos de su hijo.
texts.en:
Eva is a 33 year-old woman. She is single and has a 12 year-old son. Her business is selling food. She is a good mother, an entrepreneur, and an understanding, patient, responsible and hardworking person. She carries out her business in the “12 de Marzo” area, considered one of the pioneers of the city. This area has nearly half a million trade unions and is characterized by taking in almost all the streets and avenues. The weather is cold and dry with temperatures during the day that vary between 0-12 degrees Celsius.

Eva has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long black hair which she wears braided. She is short and has a medium physique. Eva speaks her native Aymara language with her family and speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business. She lives with her parents who work and her son who attends school in the morning so he can help with her business in the afternoon. They live in their own adobe home that has a tin roof and wooden floors. Their home has water, electricity, gas, and a sewer. 

Eva’s business is selling food. She is responsible for preparing lunch and dinner. The popular lunch consists of several courses served one after the other. The first course is an appetizer (a cold dish may be a half boiled egg with shredded carrots) or a traditional soup that can be of different types. The second course is the main course and is usually a piece of meat with vegetables and rice or noodles. The last course is dessert and consists of fruit, an orange or banana. "I started my business with the help of my former partner, after our separation I ran out of working capital ... " she says. The advantage of her business is that she counts on returning customers. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to buy cooking supplies and other supplies like soda, etc. Her dream is to buy supplies for her business so that it can run properly. She wants to buy kitchen supplies wholesale as well as vegetables, meat, oil, pasta, soft drinks, etc. so that she can continue with her business and pay for her child’s expenses. This is the first loan from this institution in the 10 years she has been in this business. For these reasons Eva is requesting a loan to buy kitchen supplies to continue her business and pay for her child’s expenses.

loans.use: to buy cooking supplies to continue her business and  pay for her son's expenses.

loans.name: Deycy Yanira

texts.es: Deycy tiene 29 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 10 y 9 años los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella presta sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace varios años, ganándose la confianza por su buen desempeño. Deycy ha iniciado la construcción de un cuarto con sus ahorros, pero esto no fue suficiente, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir un cuarto en su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Deycy is 29 years old and lives in a house that her family owns, along with her husband and 2 children. They are 10 and 9 years old and attend school. She has worked as domestic help for several years, earning trust thanks to her good work.

Deycy has started building a room with her savings, but it wasn't enough, so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a room in her house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, gravel, and iron to build a room in her house as soon as possible

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a solar system to have productive hours after sunset and to stop breathing smoke from the actual light sources she uses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical cables, a cooling box, light sockets, and light bulbs to install electricity in her home.

loans.name: Felipe

texts.en: Felipe is 21 years old, has lived with his partner for four years and they have a two-year-old son. Felipe owns a wooden formwork that he leases for construction. He started the business five years ago, because his father has been involved for more than 30 years in the construction sector. Felipe is asking for a loan to buy more formwork. He says that in the past he has taken other loans and always paid them on time. Felipe says that he enjoys watching and playing soccer and that his biggest achievement has been growing his business and building a house.

loans.use: To buy wooden formwork that he leases for construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase firewood and charcoal for re-selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy inputs for his metal carpentry business.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana tiene 30 años de edad y habita en vivienda propia con sus padres y sus dos hijos de 14 y 5 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas y bebidas frías, en un local sobre la carretera dentro del municipio y es así como ella se gana la vida para la manutención de su familia. Ana desea cambiar el techo de la cocina de su casa ya que está deteriorada por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Ana is 30 years old and lives in her own house with her parents and her two children of 14 and 5 years old. She sells tortillas and cold drinks for work, at a shop on the road in the municipality. This is she how she earns her living to support her family.

Ana wishes to change the deteriorated ceiling of her kitchen in her house. She is requesting a loan to FUSAI to purchase roofing sheets, wood and nails for changing the ceiling as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase roofing sheets, wood, and nail in order to change the ceiling of her house as soon as possible

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel es un hombre de 29 años de edad, soltero, sin hijos, y su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos para dama.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, constante, paciente, amable, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Pasankeri’ caracterizado por su paisaje hermoso, presentando diferentes colores de los estratos geológicos de la corteza terrestre. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-15 grados centígrados.
Miguel es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física mediana, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hermana menor que se dedica al mismo negocio. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la fabricación de zapatos para dama; él realiza cortes y diseños en todo tipo de material como; cuero, caucho, suela, plásticos, etc., para confeccionar calzados de mujer, “trabajé como operario en una fábrica de zapatos en Brasil, volví a mi país y con la ayuda de mi familia abrí mi propio negocio de confección de zapatos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que sus zapatos se venden constantemente, la desventaja es la falta de material de trabajo como; suelas, tela, cuero y otros, para continuar con la actividad. Su sueño es posicionar su negocio como una buena empresa, él desea realizar la compra de material para la fabricación de zapatos y con los beneficios abrir una tienda. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 15 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Miguel solicita un préstamo para la compra de material para la fabricación de zapatos y con los beneficios abrir una tienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is a 29-year-old, single man with no children. He works making women's shoes.

He is enterprising, independent, persevering, patient, kind, responsible, and very hard-working. He carries out his business in the Pasankeri area, known for its beautiful landscape featuring different colors of the geologic layers of the earth's crust. It has a cold and dry climate with daytime temperatures that vary between 0 and 15 degrees Celsius.

Miguel is tan with dark eyes, short black hair, short stature, and medium build. His mother language is Aymará, which he speaks with his family, and he speaks Spanish in everyday life and in his business. He shares his life with his younger sister, who works in the same business. They live in a house they own, which is made of brick and cement with a corrugated metal roof and wooden floor. It has potable water, electricity, and plumbing.

He works making women's shoes. He cuts and designs with every kind of material, including leather, rubber, soles, plastic, etc. to make women's shoes. "I worked as an operator in a women's shoe factory in Brazil. I returned to my country and with the help of my family, I opened my own shoe-making business," he says.

The good thing about his business is that his shoes sell all the time. The bad thing is the lack of material to work with, such as soles, fabric, leather, and others needed to continue the business.

His dream is to make his business into a good company. He wants to purchase material to make shoes, and with the earnings, open a store. This is his first sequence of loans with the institution in the 15 years he has been in the business.

For these reasons, Miguel is requesting a loan to purchase material to make shoes, and with the earnings, open a store.

loans.use: to buy material to make shoes, and with the earnings, open a store

loans.name: Tijani

texts.en: Tijani is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kwari Village. He joined Babban Gona to improve the life of his family and children. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Tijani will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income significantly. With plans to harvest 30 bags of maize this season, Tijani now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Adamu

texts.en: Adamu is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Kwari Village. He joined Babban Gona to expand his farm and grow his agricultural business. Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Adamu will have access to the best farm inputs in the market such as fertilisers, herbicides and improved seeds that will help him earn yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the Nigerian national average of 14 bags. This will see him increase his household income considerably. Thanks to Babban Gona's support, Adamu now has the opportunity to increase his yields and income and use his extra earnings to provide employment to members of his community through his farm.

loans.use: to purchase improved farm inputs that will increase farm yields.

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en:
Maricris is grateful that she was previously granted a 19,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CCT, which she used to buy general merchandise for her sari-sari, or small general store in the Philippines. Her earnings helped her to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses.

Maricris would now like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy school supplies such as pads of paper, ballpoint pens and name tags, plus hair accessories, body powder and soaps that she sells. She knows that more items in her store will yield more sales and thus increase her earnings.

Maricris dreams of having a bigger sari-sari and aims to send all her children to college to allow them better opportunities in life. She is thanking God and you in advance for a an upturn in her business, for it will surely cover their daily sustenance and fund her children's schooling. She prays for a prosperous and healthy life.

All CCT community clients like Maricris are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise for her sar-sari

loans.name: Sandra

texts.pt:
A senhora Sandra de 33 anos de idade, nasceu em Magude e é residente de Magude na casa própria, solteira, mãe de 1 filha menor de idade frequentando o ensino primário. Além da filha tem sob sua responsabilidade os seus pais que vive com eles.
Com o presente financiamento de 16.000 irá comprar milho, óleo e omo para revender.
Tem como sonhos construir uma barraca grande em sua casa, um muro de vedação e adquirir uma viatura para o uso pessoal.
Tem como desafios a insuficiência fundos, mas tem recorrido ao trabalho, negócio e ao crédito para resolver seus pendentes.
texts.en:
Sandra is 33 years old. She comes from Magude and lives there in a house that she owns. She's the single mother of an underage daughter who's in primary school. Aside from her daughter she's responsible for her parents who live with her.
With the current loan for 16,000mt she will purchase corn, cooking oil and laundry detergent for re-selling.
Her dream is to build a fence wall and a large booth at her house. She also dreams of buying a vehicle for personal use.
Her challenge is the lack of funds, but she has been turning to work, business and credit in order to settle her affairs.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cooking oil and laundry detergent for re-selling.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гулмира, 44 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее средне-специальное образование, работает социальным служащим, в качестве дополнительного дохода с 2007 года занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день у Гулмиры есть 3 коровы, 15 овец, 2 лошади. По хозяйству помогают ее дети и муж. Гулмира обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 лошадей, для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Гулмире улучшить благосостояние семьи и в дальнейшем развивать ее бизнес, чтобы накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 44, married, and a mother of 4 children.  She has a secondary school education with some vocational training, and works as a social worker.  She's been raising livestock since 2007 to earn some extra money on the side.  She currently has 3 cows, 15 sheep, and 2 horses.  Her children and husband help her with chores.  

Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 120,000 som to buy two horses to increase her livestock headcount.  The extra income due to the loan will allow Gulmira to improve her family's well-being and develop her business in the future in order to save money for a car.

loans.use: buy two horses to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Monica Maria

texts.es:
