Mónica es una joven de 23 años de edad, es una madre cabeza de familia que quiere progresar y ser una empresaria exitosa para darle todos los gustos posibles a su hijo de 2 años de edad.
Al tener un hijo tan joven y al mismo tiempo convertirse en cabeza de familia opto por  congelador de momento sus proyectos personales y poner todo su esfuerzo y juventud en post de su hijo.
Mónica se rebusca su dinero vendiendo alimentos los cuales el enseño a hacer su madre, pero quiere solicitar un préstamo para dar un paso extra, pues con el dinero que se encuentra solicitando comprara insumos para montar un restaurante en su hogar, invertirá el capital en la compra de mesas, sillas, congelador, manteles, cubiertos, platos, servilletas.
Este préstamo le ayudara a consolidar un sueño que ha tenido desde que inicio la venta de alimentos y era tener un restaurante con el que espera mejorar considerablemente la calidad de vida de su familia y asegurar el estudio de su hijo.
texts.en:
Mónica is a 23 year old young woman. She is a mother and head of the household who wants to progress and be a successful entrepreneur to give her 2 year old son everything possible. Due to having a son at such a young age and becoming the head of the household at the same time, she chose to suspend her personal projects for the moment and put all her effort and youth behind caring for her son.

Mónica earns money by selling foods that her mother showed her how to make, but she is requesting a loan to take a step further. With the loan she is requesting she will buy consumable goods to set up a restaurant in her home. She will invest the capital in the purchase of tables, chairs, a freezer, tablecloths, utensils, plates, and napkins. This loan will help her strengthen a dream that she has had since she started selling food, which was to have a restaurant with which she hopes to considerably improve her family's quality of life and ensure that her son goes to school.

loans.use: to invest in tables, chairs, a freezer, tablecloths, utensils, plates, and napkins.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Victor Manuel tiene 48 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y su hijo. El domicilio se ubica en el distrito de Bagua,Región amazonas, Selva Norte de Perú. La comunidad donde vive es una pequeña zona rural donde los habitantes se dedican mayormente a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

La actividad a la que se dedica Victor Manuel que realiza es la agricultura básicamente el cultivo de arroz. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en compra de abonos y fertilizantes para cultivo de arroz. Esta inversión le permitirá ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Victor Manuel is 48 years old and lives in his own house made of rustic material together with his wife and son. The home is located in the district of Bagua, Amazonas Region, in the Northern Jungle of Peru. The community where he lives is a small rural area where the residents make a living mostly in agriculture, trade and livestock.

Victor Manuel makes a living in agriculture, mainly rice cultivation. He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of compost and fertilizers for the cultivation of rice. This investment will allow him profits in order to improve his economic conditions and therefore invest in better living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase compost and fertilizers for rice cultivation.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is 49 years old and married with eleven children. With six children in school, Vivian works very hard to provide for them.

Vivian runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Vivian has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, noodles, eggs, candles, shampoo, soap, condiments and other groceries. 

In the future, Vivian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Marcela Patricia

texts.es: Marcela de 24 años, despertó sus instintos empresariales cuando decidió iniciar su vida comercial desde la comodidad de su vivienda con la motivación de ayudar a su cónyuge con la economía del hogar. Esta ama de casa es madre de tres hijos y descubrió la oportunidad generar ingresos al incorporarse como consultora con una empresa de venta por catálogo y adicionalmente comercializar ropa, calzado y diversos productos para el hogar, los cuales adquiere en el comercio de las ciudades de Barranquilla y Medellín.  Su clientela está conformada principalmente  por familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector donde reside en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla, actividad que ejecuta mediante visitas a sus clientes para propiciar las ventas. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en perfumes, ropa, calzado  y artículos para el hogar.  Su sueño de prosperidad es poder organizar su local comercial en su caso que le genere los ingresos suficientes para educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Marcela, 24, woke her entrepreneurial instincts when she decided to start her business life from the comfort of her home with the motivation of helping her spouse with the household expenses. This housewife is the mother of three children and found the opportunity to earn income by joining a business as a consultant doing catalog sales. In addition, she also sells clothing, footwear and various household products which she buys in the cities of Barranquilla and Medellin. Her customers are mainly relatives, friends and neighbors of the sector where he lives in a neighborhood in the city of Barranquilla. She promotes her sales by visiting her clients. Currently she is applying for a Kiva loan, her first loan from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in perfumes, clothing, shoes, and household items. Her dream of prosperity is to establish a shop to generate enough income to educate her children.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes, clothing, shoes, and household items.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
Melba is 34 years old with two children. With two children in school, Melba works very hard to provide for them.

Melba runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarette, home care products and groceries.

Melba has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, biscuits, candies, condiments, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future, Melba would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, cigarettes, home care products and groceries

loans.name: Junior Andrés

texts.es: Junior es un joven de 21 años de edad que desde muy joven comenzó a laborar como ayudante en los negocios de venta de víveres conocido en Colombia como “Tiendas de Barrio”, sin embargo su deseo de tener su propio negocio cada día era mayor y un amigo le brindo su ayuda e invirtió sus ahorros en la compra de la tienda en que trabajaba.  En sus actividades como vendedor identificó oportunidades de mejorar;  mal surtido, mala organización y la actitud frente a los clientes, factores que Junior consideró que determinarían el éxito o el fracaso de su negocio por ello bajo su administración todo cambiaria. La constancia y la perseverancia son los pilares de su trabajo, su negocio apertura todos los días a las 6 a.m. y cierra a las 10 p.m., un horario bastante amplio para que los residentes del sector puedan realizar sus comprar. En la actualidad está aplicando a un Credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en los víveres de mayor rotación como lo son las carnes, el arroz, aceites, legumbres, leche etc., inversión con la que espera  un mayor nivel de ventas que le permitan mejorar sus utilidades y alcanzar su meta de trascender en el  ámbito comercial.  Su meta se resume en posicionar su negocio mediante un excelente servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Junior is a 21-year-old young man who, at a very young age, started working as an assistant in the grocery sale business known in Colombia as neighborhood stores ["tiendas de barrio"]. However, his desire to have his own business grew each day, and with the help of a friend, he invested his savings in the purchase of the store where he worked. 

During his time as a salesman, he identified opportunities for improvement: bad stock, bad organization, and the attitude in front of customers. Junior judged these to be factors that would determine the success or failure of his business, so under his administration, everything would change.

Determination and perseverance are the pillars of his work. His business opens every day at 6am and closes at 10pm, a very extended schedule so that the area's residents can do their shopping.

Now he is applying for a CrediKiva, his first loan through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, to invest in the most commonly purchased groceries such as meat, rice, oils, beans, milk, etc. With this investment, he expects a higher level of sales, which will allow him to improve his profits and achieve his goal of becoming known in the sales sector. His goal boils down to establishing his business through excellent customer service.

loans.use: to invest in the most commonly purchased groceries such as meat, rice, oils, beans, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, personal care and products and other groceries

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
Necita is 48 years old and has seven children. Necita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Necita is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Necita requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Necita has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Necita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Amelia De Jesus

texts.es: Amelia tiene 61 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su nieto de 18 años de edad el cual le brinda todo su apoyo y compañía. Amelia presta sus servicios en una unidad de salud por lo que es muy reconocida por su amabilidad. La vivienda de Amelia es de adobe, por lo que en cada invierno el material se deteriora, además desea proteger su propiedad, por lo que ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento,  postes, arena, grava y alambre de púas para encementar las paredes y colocar un cerco en su propiedad.
texts.en:
Amelia is 61 years old and lives in her own house with her grandson of 18 years old, to whom she provides all of her support and company. Amelia offers services at a health clinic, from which she is very well-known for her kindness. 

Her house is made of adobe, and the material deteriorates every winter. She also wishes to protect her property. 

For this, she has decided to request FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, poles, sand, gravel and barbed wires, in order to cement the walls and to place a fence in her property.

loans.use: to invest in cement, poles, sand, gravel and barbed wires to cement the walls and to place a fence in her property

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, beams, metal roof plates, iron and stirrups so he can continue his construction work.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amalia is 55 years old and has one child in school.

Amalia has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Amalia has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shirts and pants to sell.

Amalia has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Amalia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Carmel

texts.en:
Carmel is 23 years old with two children. Carmel works very hard to provide for them.

Carmel runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

Carmel has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Carmel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, personal care products and other groceries

loans.name: Luz Mariela

texts.es:
Ella es Luz es una mujer de 66 años de edad, mujer cabeza de familia que tiene un negocio de venta de bolsas plásticas y que hoy pide tu ayuda para auxiliar us negocio y comprar el insumo principal para fabricar bolsas y generar el dinero necesario para mantener su casa en la que habitan ella, y dos hijos.

Ya por su avanzada edad para luz se le es muy difícil encontrar empleo y no quiere dejar ese negocio que con tanto esfuerzo y perseverancia fundó y que espera que alguno de sus hijos aprenda a realizar para continuarlo soñando que este negocio se convierta en el sustento familiar de muchas generaciones.

Luz quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de plástico que es su insumo principal, le ayudara a tener materia prima  y atender los pedidos que tiene en cola.
texts.en:
Luz is a 66 year-old woman and head of her household, who has a business of selling plastic bags. Today she asks your help to support her business and to purchase the main raw material to make bags and generate the necessary funds to maintain her home where she and her two children live.

Due to her age, it is very difficult for Luz to find employment, and she does not want to leave this business which she founded with such strength and perseverance. She hopes that one of her children will learn the business, in order to continue the dream that this business with become the family's livelihood for many generations. 

Luz wants to request a loan for the purchase of plastic, her primary input, which will help her have raw material and attend to the pending orders for her business.

loans.use: to  purchase of plastic, her primary input, which will help her have raw material and attend to the pending orders for her business.

loans.name: Fernanda

texts.pt: A Senhora Fernanda vive na casa propria tem 1 filho e cuida tambem de 1 sobrinho , somente o filho anda na escola. Ela é mãe solteira, é professora de profissão e diz não estar satisfeita com o Salario que ganha por tanto viu a necessidade de fazer pequenos negocios para aumentar a sua receita mensal. Com o crédito vai comprar capulanas no norte do país para revenda num regime ambulatório dada sua maior procura na zona sul do país. O seu maior sonho é tornar se uma empresária de sucesso para garantir a sua reforma.
texts.en: Fernanda lives in a house that she owns. She has a son and also takes care of a nephew. Only her son attends school. She's a single mother and a teacher by trade. She states that she's not satisfied with the salary she earns, so she felt the need to start small businesses in order to improve her monthly income. With the loan she will purchase traditional skirts in the northern area of the country. She'll re-sell them on a door-to-door basis because they're in high demand in the southern area. Her biggest dream is to become a successful entrepreneur so she can afford to do repairwork.

loans.use: to purchase traditional skirts.

loans.name: David

texts.en: This is David from Nakuru County. He is a farmer raising Irish potatoes, which he sells in his local market. From the sale of his produce, he has been able to school his children and take care of their daily needs, i.e. food and shelter. He dreams of having a big farm one day where he will grow more potatoes, wheat and barley. With a Kiva loan, he will be able to buy potato seedlings to cultivate in this season.

loans.use: to buy seedlings to cultivate Irish Potatoes.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 35-year-old woman and mother of four children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession. He sells vegetables e.g. potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc. Her husband is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Farzana's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling so that he can increase the size of his business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to his unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in a condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore, Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business.

loans.name: Joanna May

texts.en:
Joanna May is a 26-year-old married woman with three children (two children are in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joanna May has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Joanna May requested a 6,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Joanna May would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice has a small piece of land in Mitheru village where she lives and farms with her family. She practices small-scale production of cash crops and pig farming. She sells her farm produce at Kerugoya, which is a local market centre near her home. She started farming many years ago and through the years, she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs.

The biggest growth challenge that Alice has been facing is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests.

With your loan, Alice will be able to access capital from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and the family's income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Milena Patricia

texts.es: Milena es una emprendedora mujer de 29 años que ante la necesidad de generar una fuente de ingresos para su familia, decidió respaldar la idea del negocio planteada por su cónyuge; invertir sus ahorros en la compra de leche, útiles escolares, ropa y otros artículos para el hogar adquiridos en el vecino país de Venezuela.  Su éxito les permitió adquirir vitrinas y otros activos para organizar un punto de venta desde su casa, sin duda alguna, Milena es una mujer que con esfuerzo y completa dedicación ha alcanzado logros para el beneficio de su familia y su entusiasmo es suficiente para continuar en su negocio haciéndolo prosperar cada día más. Actualmente está gestionado su primer Credikiva, con a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en los artículos que demanda su clientela como planchas para el cabello, ropa, calzado, útiles escolares y leche en polvo, inversión con la que planea incrementar su nivel de ventas y generar mejores ingresos que le permitan a largo plazo ahorrar para tener casa propia y mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Milenia is a 29 year-old, entrepreneurial woman who, needing to generate a source of income for her family, decided to support the business idea raised by her spouse, to invest her savings in the purchase of milk, school supplies, clothing and other household items purchased in the neighboring country of Venezuela.

Her success allows them to purchase cases and other assets to organize a point of sale from their home. Without a doubt, Milenia is a woman who, with effort and complete dedication, has achieved success for the benefit of her family and her enthusiasm is enough to continue making her business thrive more every day.

Currently, she is managing her first Credikiva, with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in items demanded by her customers, such as hair straighteners, clothing, shoes, school supplies and powdered milk. With this investment, she plans on increasing her number of sales and generate increased income that will allow her to save long-term, to have her own home and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: items demanded by her customers, such as hair straighteners, clothing, shoes, school supplies and powdered milk.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
Con la esperanza de generar una mejor calidad de vida para su familia y de comprar una vivienda propia en el año 2014 el señor Víctor inicio un negocio de fabricación y reparación de calzado.
Víctor obtuvo su experiencia en trabajos anteriores y ahora que tiene buen volumen de trabajo quiere solicitar un préstamo para tener los insumos y los materiales necesarios para atender cualquier reparación e iniciar un pedido que tiene entre papeles.
Con el préstamo solicitado comprara materia prima que principalmente son suelas y pegamento.
Tu ayudara aportara al crecimiento de un empresario que lucha día a día por ver a su familia gozando de una buena vida.
texts.en: With the hope of generating a better quality of life for his family and to buy his own home in 2014 Mr. Victor  began his shoe-making and shoe repair business. Victor gained his experience in previous jobs and now that he has a good amount of work he wants to apply for a loan in order to have the necessary components and materials to attend to any repair and to initiate an order that he has. With the loan he will buy raw material, mainly soles and glue. Your help will  contribute to the growth of a businessman who fights day to day to see his family enjoying a good life.

loans.use: It will buy raw material , mainly soles and glue.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en: Susana is 56 years old and widowed. She is blessed with five children and they live happily in a rural community. She has been engaged in reselling fruits and vegetables for more than twenty years. She aspires to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. Due to capital insufficiency, she would like to access an additional of PHP10,000 to buy more stocks of bananas, cassava, squash, eggplants and more vegetables to resell. She hopes that this financial assistance will enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas, cassava, squash, eggplants and other vegetables to resell

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 56 years old and has three children. Cecilia is a married woman.

Cecilia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Cecilia has been in this business for 20 years now and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 48 years old, married and has three children to provide for. To earn for living, she operates a sari-sari store so that she can help her husband in providing for the needs of their family. 

She wants to improve their family living condition, so she has decided to take a loan to buy more goods to sell. This will also enable her to increase her store inventory to generate a greater income.

in the future, Cristina plans to save money to sustain the needs of her children.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Ma. Theresa works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from buying and selling spices. Ma. Theresa is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Ma. Theresa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Jennelyn

texts.en:
Jennelyn is 25 years old and married.

Jennelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Jennelyn has borrowed and paid 1 loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Jennelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie works hard to support her family. Ana Marie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Ana Marie requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Ana Marie has been in this business for 7 years now.

Ana Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is from the community of Ronda, Cebu. She is married with a six-year-old son. Arlene has a transportation business. It is with her van that she transports passengers to their place to make an income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy spare tires and parts needed to do repairs. Once the van is fixed, Arlene can be assured of a continuous transport service and a better return on her investment. 

In the future, she hope to have another van that she can add to her business.

loans.use: to buy spare tires and parts to do repairs.

loans.name: Mame

texts.en:
Mame is 39 years old with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Mame has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

Mame aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell at her general store.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 32 years old and married with three children.

Maricel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, home product care, and other groceries.

Maricel has borrowed and paid 2 previous loans from NWTF. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Maricel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, bread, beverages, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
As a parent of two children, Myra works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from hergeneral store. Myra is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Myra has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 46 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Cheryl works very hard to provide for them.

Cheryl runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Cheryl has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Cheryl would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like junk foods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient  space in the restaurant. 

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to renovate the restaurant. Her business goal is to have improved services with a good customer base within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate the restaurant.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail shop where she sells bread, sugar, flour, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are of all types.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. 

This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, sugar, flour, soap and other items

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 54 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elena is borrowing PHP 6,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elena has been in this business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth has a small farmland in Sinon location, Kenya, where she lives with her family. She keeps dairy cows and grows vegetables. She sells her farm produce at Kapsowar which is a local market near her home.  

The biggest challenge that Elizabeth was facing until now is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Elizabeth is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and pay for labour costs involved in the transportation and application of farm inputs.  

With your loan, Elizabeth will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and pay for labour.

loans.name: Upendo Kerwa Women Group

texts.en:
The lady holding a passbook and her baby in the photo is Pauline, a member of Upendo Kerwa Women Group. She is 26 years old, married and a mother of 2 children where one is attending primary school. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from their training programs, especially enterprise development. 
She is a farmer currently growing maize, beans and potatoes. In addition she also owns and operates a beauty salon. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase fertilizers so as to increase her crop production. This will increase her income and her ability to afford clean water and better clothing for her family.
Pauline is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers so as to increase her crop production in order to earn more income to afford clean water and better clothing for her family.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah has a piece of land on a steep contour in Kipsaiya location, Kenya, where she lives and farms with her family. She keeps dairy cows and grows food crops on a small scale. She sells her farm produce at Kapsowar, which is a local market near her home. She started farming many years ago, and she enjoys it because it provides her family with a livelihood and a source of income. 

The biggest growth constraint to Leah is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 

With your lending, Leah will be able access capital to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Renalyn

texts.en:
As a parent of three children, Renalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from buy and sell ready to wear.  Renalyn is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Renalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 2 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, a 54-year-old soft drinks dealer from Oton, Iloilo. She is married to Isidro and they have children. Isidro is not just her companion in life but also her business buddy. Together, they toil hard in order to uplift their business.

As a soft drinks or beverage dealer, Emma buys loads of bottled drinks at a wholesale price then retails it per case or per bottle. She distributes cases of drinks to sari-sari (variety) stores. She has been doing this for 20 long years, and it provided well for their everyday needs. However, the problem in this kind of business is the risk of bottle breakage that consumes a big portion of capital. Aside from this, the unreturned bottles that are considered lost also deplete her capital. 

The good thing about Emma is that she knows how to roll her everyday budget. She still dreams of putting up her own outlet or stock room. She also plans to nurture a farm as an alternative income-generating venture. She feels that this dream is coming closer to reality, especially if she can avail herself of a PHP 25,000 loan. Part of the loan will be used to buy additional cases of soft drinks, and the rest will be allotted as seed money for her farm. 

Hopefully you can extend your heartfelt generosity to her. She is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 44 years old and has seven children. Evelyn is married, and two of her children are in school.

Evelyn is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Evelyn has been farming rice for 21 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a small farm in Koibatek, Kenya, where she lives with her family. She keeps a dairy cow and grows vegetables. She sells milk and crop produce at Sanguror, which is the local market closest to her home. She started farming many years ago. Through the years, she has had many challenges including lack of access to financial services. 

Jane wants to increase her farm’s productivity. She is seeking a loan of KES 10,000 to buy improved seeds and fertilizers to grow more food crops.  
With your lending, Jane will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Rhodora

texts.en:
Rhodora is 37 years old and married with two children.

Rhodora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Rhodora has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rhodora aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Diana Carolina

texts.es:
Con un objetivo en mente que era mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, con timidez y temor por ser la primera vez que inicia una ruta como comerciante independiente, quiere Iniciar la señora Diana su venta de ropa y accesorios una actividad guiada por la necesidad.

Diana es una mujer que se dedicaba mucho al hogar no tenía hijos, buscaba trabajo pero debido a su falta de preparación escolar y al no contar con mucha experiencia decidió montar su propio negocio.

Ahora Diana solicita tu apoyo, un primer préstamo que necesita para comprar surtido de ropa juvenil y accesorios para mujer para vendérselas a familiares, amigos y tocar puerta a puerta esperando lograr una venta, ella trabajara constantemente por lograr su sueño que es mejorar las condiciones de vivienda y tener una independencia económica.
texts.en:
With one goal in mind which is to improve her housing conditions and with shyness and fear since this is the first time she will start a route as an independent seller, Diana wants to start selling clothing and accessories--a business that is guided by necessity. 

Diana is a woman who is very devoted to her home. She has no children and has been looking for work but because of her lack of schooling and not having much experience she decided to start her own business.

Diana is now asking for your help. She needs a first loan to buy an assortment of children's clothing and women's accessories that she can sell to family, friends, and door-to-door hoping to get a sale. She works constantly to achieve her dream of improving her living conditions and obtain economic independence.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of children's clothing and women's accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy insect repellent, candies, cookies, sugar, shampoo, matches and diapers

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old, widowed and has two children to provide for. As a single parent, she wants the best for her children. Teresita also wants to earn income to provide the daily needs of her children. That's why she is engaged in a rice retailing business. To increase her income, she borrowed a loan to buy more stocks to sell so that she can have more sales and generate a greater income.

Teresita plan for the future to expand her business out from her business income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
She is Marilyn, 29 years old, and married to Darrel, a tricycle driver. They are still praying for a child. As of now, Marilyn focuses her attention on nurturing her hog business. She chose this enterprise because it provides food for the community. She has been in this venture for six years, and she’s convinced that it is beneficial for her and for other people. Although the return of investment comes after several months, she is happy to provide reasonably priced food for her community in Oton, Iloilo. She is planning to expand her business by buying additional piglets and feed. She is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan for this purpose. She hopes you are willing to help her so she can increase her profit and boost her savings. She is looking forward to having a child and she is preparing early for the future. She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells mobile phones and their accessories. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area fit for the business and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of mobile phones and accessories. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is 48 years old and has two children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Filomena is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Filomena requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Filomena has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Filomena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Sanavarkan

texts.ru: Санаваркан, 47 лет, замужем, есть сын. У нее - среднее образование, на протяжении 20 лет, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Санаваркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется скот - 6 коров, 10 овец. Также есть 1,0 ГА собственной земли, где она выращивает клевер. Всю экологически чистую продукцию Санаваркан реализует. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 22,000 сом (KGS). Санаваркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита она планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sanavarkan is 47 years old, married and has a son. She has secondary education. For a period of 20 years she has worked with agriculture, as a main source of income for her family. 

Thanks to Sanavarkan's persistent work, her farm currently has six cows and ten sheep. She also has 1.0 hectares of own land, where she grows clover. Sanavarkan sells all her farm products, which are ecological. The monthly income is on average 22,000 som (KGS).

Sanavarkan turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase dairy cows in order to sell ecological milk. She plans to invest the income from the loan in further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase dairy cows to sell their ecological milk

loans.name: Evcel

texts.en:
Evcel is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evcel is 45 years old and has two children who are in school.

Evcel has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. Evcel requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Evcel has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Evcel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en: Geoffrey is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be competent. He operates a retail shop where he sells fruit. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are individuals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low stock. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of fruit. This will enable him to increase his sales and hence earn more profits. He hopes that in the future, he will have a stable income. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruit.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 34 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Emilia

texts.es:
EMILIA TIENE 52 AÑOS DE EDAD, VIVE EN CASA PROPIA, DESDE HACE MAS DE 20 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE, VIVE EN UNA COMUNIDAD, TRANQUILA, DONDE LA GENTE SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO,GANADERIA Y AGRICULTURA, EN EL DISTRITO DE CAYALTI, PROVINCIA DE CHICLAYO, REGION LAMBAYEQUE, COSTA NORTE DE PERU.

EMILIA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE AGUARDIENTE PURA DE CAÑA, EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO CUENTA CON LICENCIA, DESEMPEÑANDO ESTE NEGOCIO DESDE HACE MAS DE 5 AÑOS APROXIMADAMENTE, SE DEDICA TAMBIEN A LA CRIANZA Y C/VENTA DE CERDOS, CON MUY BUENAS REFERENCIAS DE PARTE DE SUS VECINOS Y CLIENTES. NECESITA EL PRESTAMO PARA CAPITAL DE TRABAJO (COMPRA DE AGUARDIENTE,CERDOS,ALIMENTACION PARA LOS MISMOS) Y OTROS GASTOS DIVERSOS. DE ESTA MANERA INCREMENTARÁ SUS INGRESOS Y POIDRÁ MEJORAR SU CALIDAD DE VIDA.
texts.en:
Emilia is 52 years old. For more than approximately 20 years she has lived in her own house. She lives in a quiet community where the people make a living from commerce, livestock and agriculture, in the Cayalti district in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on the North coast of Peru.

Emilia makes a living selling pure aguardiente made from cane sugar and has a licence for her home. She has run this business for approximately the last 5 years. She also makes a living raising and buying/selling pigs, and has very good references from her neighbours and customers.

She needs the loan to have working capital (to buy aguardiente, pigs and feed for the pigs) and for various other expenses. In this way she will increase her income and will be able to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy aguardiente [sugar cane liquor], pigs and feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy metal sheeting and wood to change the roof of her house to give her children more protection.

loans.name: German Mauricio

texts.es:
German, de 27 años de edad, está casado, es empleado en el área financiera de una empresa, tiene un hijo con su esposa.

German, tiene un año de trabajar en la institución, pero también se dedica a la crianza de ganado, esto lo aprendió por medio de  sus padres que también se dedican a ese negocio y su trabajo fijo está a una hora de su casa. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar ganado, para criarlo, engordarlo y luego venderlo.

Sus sueños a futuro son, que el ganado se crie en buenas condiciones y que le dé buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
German, 27, is married and works in the finance department of a company.  He and his wife have a son.

German has been working at an institution for a year but he also raises cattle which he learned about from his parents who are in the same business.  His steady job is an hour away from home.

The loan he needs is to buy cattle to raise and sell.  His dream for the future is to raise healthy livestock that will earn a good profit.

loans.use: To buy cattle to raise and sell.

loans.name: Niño Divino Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NIÑO DIVINO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Helen Jenifer ella es soltera y tiene 64 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de librería.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of the communal bank NIÑO DIVINO, which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

One of the members, Helen Jenifer, is single, 64 years old and has two children.  She sells cereal such as corn, wheat and quinoa, working from 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.  She has been in business for four years and things have gone well for her.  

Her goal is to open her own cereal store.  The loan she is requesting is to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The other members sell sweets; clothing; run a grocery store; and a book store.

Helen Jenifer is grateful to everyone participating in her goal and is committed to paying back the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Servelio Antonio

texts.es: Servelio tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia con sus padres y su hijo de 6 años de edad. Él se dedica a la agricultura de corte de caña y también a la albañilería desde hace 15 años con esos ingresos el lleva el sustento a su familia. Servelio desea hacer el cambio de techo de la vivienda ya que está dañada y se le filtran las aguas lluvias, por lo que él solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, madera y clavos para poder hacer la mejora en el techo de su vivienda y así brindarle una mayor comodidad a su familia.
texts.en:
Servelio, 28, lives in his own house with parents and his six-year-old son.  He works in agriculture cutting sugar cane and also has worked as a bricklayer for 15 years in order to support his family.

Servelio wants to change the roof of his house which is damaged by the rainwater leakage.  Therefore he is requesting a loan through FUSAI to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair it and make his family more comfortable.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to improve the roof of his house and make his family more comfortable.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia, de 52 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, porque en la familia eran varios hijos y el nivel de pobreza era bastante alto, por esa razón todos tuvieron que trabajar desde muy jóvenes; Lucia, está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tiene 6 hijos, pero solo uno de sus hijos vive con ellos.

Lucia, siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, porque no tuvo la oportunidad de encontrar un mejor trabajo; después que llega del campo se dedica a cuidar sus animales domésticos, porque tiene crianza de cerdos y gallinas, para venderlos y apoyar a su esposo en los ingresos del hogar.

Lucia, necesita dinero para comprar abono y pesticidas para preparar la tierra y sembrar 28,000 metros cuadrados y lo hace solamente con el apoyo de uno de sus hijos quien aún vive en su casa.

Ella, sueña con tener mucho terreno, para poder sembrar más granos básicos.
texts.en:
Lucia, 52, only has a first grade education because there were several children in her family and their poverty level was quite high.  So they had to start working from a very young age.  Lucia is married, her husband works in agriculture, and they have six children, although only one still lives at home.

Lucia has always worked in agriculture because she never had the opportunity to find a better occupation.  When she gets home from the fields she cares for the domestic animals, since she raises pigs and chickens to sell and help her husband with the household expenses.

She is in need of a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for 28,000 square meters of land she wants to prepare for planting.  The only help she has is that of the son still living at home.

Her dream is to have more land and grow more basic grains.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides to plant 28,000 square meters of land.

loans.name: Señor De Choquekillca Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CHOQUEKILLCA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Ollantaytambo, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lucrecia ella es viuda y tiene 44 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia vende pantalones, blusas y polos, la socia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora que por medio de ste negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos, polos, pantalones, chompas, polos y blusas.
Las socias que estan pegadas a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque no les quisieron dar permiso en su trabajo para el dia que se realizo el desembolso de credito.
	
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de cereales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are members of the "Señor de Choquekillca" loan group. This group is located in the district of Ollantaytambo, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and department of Cuzco. 

One of the members is Lucrecia. She is 44 years old, a widow, and has 3 children. She works in her business selling clothing and sells pants, blouses and polo shirts. She is an enterprising and determined woman that wants to support her family through this business. She is asking for a loan to buy shoes, polo shirts, pants, sweaters and blouses. 

The women that are attached to the group photo had their photo taken after the reunion because their jobs did not give them the day off on the day that the credit disbursement was carried out. The other members make a living selling animals, selling cereal, having a grocery store and selling food. 

Lucrecia thanks everyone who is part of this dream through Kiva and promises to make her loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy shoes, polo shirts, pants, sweaters and blouses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheets, wood, nails and wire to put a roof on her home, and thus fulfill her dream of having a decent house.

loans.name: Marpat

texts.ru: Марпат, 54 года, замужем, мать 2 детей.  По характеру Марпат спокойная, трудолюбивая, жизнерадостная. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, она занимается полеводством и животноводством. Имеет развитое хозяйство, а именно 20 овец, 3 лошади и 3 коровы, а также на земельном наделе мерою 1,36 ГА она выращивает ячмень. Марпат получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 16,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для откорма на пастбище. Доходы от кредита Марпат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и покупку мебели для дома.
texts.en: Marpat is 54 years old, married, and the mother of two children.  By nature, she is quiet, hardworking and she has a positive attitude in life.  In order to provide a source of income for her family, she is involved in agriculture and animal husbandry.  Her farm is well developed, with 20 sheep, three horses and three cows.  Marpat also grows barley on 1.36 hectares of land and makes a monthly income of about 16,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) to buy a few cows for fattening in the fields.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy a few cows for fattening in the fields and for further resale.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Ii Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVA LUZ II”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Natalia la socia sigue dedicándose a su  negocio de venta de comida, la socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido, la socia continua  preparando diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de arroz, papas, menestras, aceite entre otros.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de refrigerios, negocio de venta de zapatillas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the NUEVA LUZ II communal bank. This bank is located in Cusco district, which belongs to Cusco province and Cusco department. Natalia is a member who continues working in her food sales business. She is grateful to those who are a part of this dream through this process and promises to pay her instalments in the agreed timeframe. She continues to prepare different dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and meat stir-fry. She is a responsible and diligent person and this is how she brings up her family.

Natalia is asking for the loan to buy rice, potatoes, beans, oil and other items.

The other members work in a snack business, shoe sales, a grocery store business, and a food sales business. The members who are in the attached photos asked permission to arrive late at the meeting because of work.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes, beans, oil and other items.

loans.name: José De La Cruz

texts.es:
José, de 52 años de edad, no estudio, está soltero, pero tiene cuatro hijos de su matrimonio anterior y siempre les ayuda a sus hijos para sus gastos escolares y para la alimentación.

José, realiza trabajos agrícolas y también trabaja con ganado desde hace más de 20 años.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado.

En el futuro desea construir una vivienda de ladrillos y dejársela a sus hijos para que vivan mejor.
texts.en: José is 52 years old. He didn't go to school. He is single but has four children from a previous marriage and always helps his children with their school expenses and food. José does agriculture work and has also worked with livestock for more than 20 years. José needs the loan to buy livestock. In the future, he wishes to build a brick home and leave it to his children so that they live better.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Maria Alicia

texts.es: María tiene 54 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus  3 hijos de 26, 20 y 19 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida prestando sus servicios domésticos de forma domiciliar desde hace varios años, además su hijo le apoya económicamente  para los gastos del hogar.  María desea hacer el cambio del techo de su vivienda porque el invierno pasado presento filtraciones de aguas lluvias, por lo que ha decidido solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 54 years old and lives in her own home with her 3 children who are 26, 20, and 19 years old. She has made a living providing her domestic household services for several years. Her son also supports her economically with the household expenses. María wishes to change the roof on her home because last winter presented rain leaks, so she has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in metal sheets, wood and nails to change the roof on her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in metal sheets, wood and nails to change the roof on her home as soon as possible.

loans.name: Roque Ivan

texts.es:
Roque, de 41 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador, estudió hasta primer grado, está acompañado, su cónyuge se dedica a los oficios del hogar y tiene 3 hijos varones, los cuales estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. 

Roque, desde pequeño le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo, vivió un tiempo en los Estados Unidos, luego regresó y decidió trabajar para la gente de su cantón, actualmente es el presidente de la junta directiva de la comunidad y funcionario del proyecto de agua; también cultiva maíz y maicillo y tiene crianza de cerdos. En todas las actividades agropecuarias se involucran sus hijos.

El préstamo lo necesita para arreglar su chiquero, pues ya se acerca la época lluviosa y necesita que sus animales tengan mayor protección para éstas condiciones, también desea comprar más cerditos y alimento para ellos.

Roque, sueña con llegar a tener una próspera granja de cerdos y dejarles buenas iversiones a sus hijos, para que cuando ellos crezcan tengan de donde trabajar y así gozar de una buena calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Roque is 41 years old. He is a hard-working man. He went to school until 1st grade. He is married and his spouse makes a living with household chores. They have three sons who go to school in the community. Since he was little, he was taught how to work in the fields. He lived for a little while in the United States and later returned and decided to work for the people of his canton. 

At the moment, he is president of the board of directors and an official for the water project. He also grows corn and millet and raises pigs. He involves his children in all of the agricultural jobs. He needs the loan to fix his pigsty, since the rainy season is nearing and he needs better protection for his animals in those conditions. He also wishes to buy more pigs and food for them. Roque dreams of having a prosperous pig farm and leaving good investments for his children, so that when they get older they have somewhere to work and can enjoy a good quality life.

loans.use: to fix his pigsty and buy more pigs and food for them.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es:
Adrián es un caficultor desde hace 15 años en una comunidad al norte de Nicaragua. Actualmente vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su pequeña finca, en la que cultiva el rubro del café; aunque también siembra granos básicos para autoconsumo.

En los últimos 3 años la producción de su café ha incrementado significativamente, lo cual espera mantener para maximizar el potencial de sus recursos. Su meta es incrementar la productividad de su finca, para lo cual se ha propuesto implementar un plan de renovación de 1.4 hectáreas de café a fin de mejorar los rendimientos de las áreas de café de más edad. Para esto, solicita un financiamiento que le permita asegurar estas actividades de renovación. 

Su sueño es llegar a tener una finca modelo en rendimientos y calidad de café, para lo cual ya ha comenzado a trabajar.
texts.en:
Adrian has been a coffee grower for 15 years in a community to the north of Nicaragua. Currently he lives with his wife and his two children on his small farm on which he grows his coffee. He also grows basic grains for personal consumption.

In the last 3 years his coffee production has significantly increased which he hopes to sustain in order to maximise the potential of his resources. His aim is to increase the  productivity of his farm for which he has proposed to implement a plan of renovating 1.4 hectares of coffee plants in order to improve the output of the older areas of coffee plants. For this he is asking for funding that will allow him to carry out this renovation work.

His dream is to manage to have a farm which is a model for output and one which is a model for coffee quality. He has already started to work for this.

loans.use: to renovate 1.4 hectares of coffee plants and increase his output.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамара, 48 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают сына. У Тамары среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Тамары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу и клевер для реализации и внутрихозяйственного потребления. Доход составляет до 19,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тамара обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы для реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Тамара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Tamara is 48 years old, married, and raises a son together with her husband. Tamara has a secondary education. She rears animals and grows crops as the principal source of income for her family, having started with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Tamara's hard work, today she has four cows. She grows corn and clover on 2.0 hectares of land for sale and for use on her farm. Her income is up to 19,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her business further, Tamara has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy a dairy cow to sell organic milk. Tamara plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in further increasing her number of domestic livestock.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to sell organic milk.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas tiene 44 años de edad, madre soltera, vive con su hijo de 9 años, en una zona rural del distrito de Pimpingos que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio, es una comunidad tranquila.

Felicitas se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas, patos, pavos, entre otros, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio, tambien tiene su propio vivero de donde vende plantones y flores. Cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para la compra de una mayor cantidad de animales como gallinas, patos, cuyes, pollos, entre otros, así como para la compra de alimento balanceado para estos. Con esto Felicitas espera ofrecer un mejor producto a sus clientes lo que le va a permitir generar mayores ingresos y por ende incrementará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felicitas is 44 years old, is a single mother and lives with her 9 year old in a rural area in the Pimpingos district which is located in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region on the north coast of Peru. The people of this district mainly earn a living in agriculture, livestock breeding and business. It is a quiet community.
Felicitas earns a living raising and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, ducks, turkeys, among others. Her business is located in her home and she also has her own seed bed from which she sells saplings and flowers. She has 10 years of experience in this business and has good personal and work references in the area. The loan that she is asking for will be used to buy more animals such as hens, ducks, guinea pigs, chickens, among others, as well as to buy balanced feed for them. With this, Felicitas hopes to offer better products to her customers which will allow her to increase her income and thus increase her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more animals and to buy balanced feed for them.

loans.name: Hector

texts.es: Héctor tiene 28 años de edad y habita en casa propia con su compañera de vida y sus 2 hijos de 12 y 6 años de edad. Héctor se dedica a prestar sus servicios como jornalero en una finca de cultivo de caña de azúcar, entre sus funciones están la corta de la caña, limpia de terreno (carrilear) entre otros. Héctor con sus pocos ahorros, logro construir una vivienda de adobe, pero no ha logrado instalar el techo, puertas y ventanas por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para la compra de madera, laminas y clavos para instalar puertas, ventanas y techo y cumplir el sueño de tener una vivienda digna que ofrecer a sus hijos.
texts.en: Héctor is 28 years old and lives in his own home with his partner and his 2 children who are 12 and 6 years old. He earns a living giving his services as a day working on a sugar cane farm. Among the jobs he does he cuts the cane and cleans the ground, among others. With his small savings he managed to build a home from adobe. However he hasn't been able to put in a roof or windows and so he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to buy wood, sheeting and nails to put in doors, windows and a roof and to fulfil his dream of having a decent home to offer his children.

loans.use: to buy wood, sheeting and nails to install doors, windows, a roof and to fulfil the dream of having a decent home.

loans.name: Jekko

texts.en:
Jekko is 25 years old and single. He wants to help his parents to make a living. So he is engaged in a piggery business. He raises pigs and sells them at the market. 

He aims to increase his income and to achieve this he must have more sales of pigs. So he decided to take a loan to buy feeds for the pigs. This way, he will be able to produce good quality pigs and able to sell more pigs in the market. This will result in a good income.

Jekko's plan for the future is to save money for his forthcoming education.

loans.use: To buy feeds for the pigs.

loans.name: Viwalo

texts.fr: Viwalo est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans et mère d’un enfant. Viwalo vit à Agoè pour entreprendre son activité. Viwalo vend des produits de commerce général et des détergents en parcourant le quartier pour gagner sa vie et aider sa famille. Viwalo s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Viwalo demande ce crédit pour acheter un sac de riz, un bidon d’huile et des cartons de spaghettis afin de réaliser des bénéfices pour soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille et permettre une bonne éducation à son enfant
texts.en: Viwalo is a married woman of 28 who has one child. She lives in Agoé where she runs her business. Viwalo sells general groceries and detergent as an itinerant saleswoman in her neighbourhood to earn a living and help her family. Viwalo buys her stock four times a month at the market. She requests this loan to buy a sack of rice, a can of oil, and boxes of spaghetti in order to make a profit that she will use to help her husband with the family expenses and to provide her child with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice, a can of oil, and two boxes of spaghetti.

loans.name: Nurzhamal

texts.ru: Нуржамал, 23 года, замужем, есть дочь. Нуржамал уже 5 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет 9,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 15 овец и лошадь. На 6,0 Га земли она выращивает люцерну и клевер. Нуржамал обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от бизнеса она планирует вкладывать в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Nurzhamal is 23 years old, married, and has a daughter. Nurzhamal has been farming for five years. Her monthly profit is 9,000 som (KGS). She has four cows, fifteen sheep and horse. She grows alfalfa and clover on 6.0 hectares of land. Nurzhamal has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 40,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow in order to increase the size of her herd. She plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy a cow in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Nabonswende Bibata Group

texts.fr:
Mme BIBATA est responsable du groupe NABONSWENDE BIBATA. Mariée, elle est mère de 06enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 02 vont à l'école et elle a 02personnes en charge.
Mme fait l'élevage depuis 05ans. Elle s'approvisionne dans un village environnant.
Elle veut s'acheter 03moutons.
Avec ses bénéfice, elle veut réinvestir dans son activité. Elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bibata is the leader of the Nabonswende Bibata group. She is married with six children. The oldest is 20 and the youngest is one year old. Two of the children go to school. She has two people who are dependent on her.
Mrs. Bibata has been fattening livestock for five years. She buys her animals in a neighbouring village.
She would like to buy three sheep.
With the profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy three sheep.

loans.name: Sr. De Ccoyllority Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SR. DE CCOYLLORITY”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Carmen ella es soltera y tiene 66 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja en su negocio de restaurant, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes,la socia es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que por medio de este negocio la socia quiere sacar adelante a su familia, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 10 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pideron permiso por motivos de trabajo.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de hotel, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de hotel.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the Sr. de Ccoyllority communal bank, located in the district of Cusco, province and department of Cusco.

Carmen, 66 years old, is single and has one child. She has a restaurant business where she works preparing a variety of dishes such as chicken with potatoes, soups, and stir-fried beef. She is an enterprising, hardworking woman who wants to get her family ahead through this business.

She works from 8 am to 5 pm, she's already had the business for 10 years and it is going very well. Carmen's dream is to expand her restaurant.

She is requesting this loan to buy cooking ingredients, including chicken, beef, and vegetables.

The other group members work in hotels, selling clothing and in a grocery store. Due to work demands, the members who have their photo attached to the group photo had permission to have these taken after the meeting.

Carmen is grateful to everyone who is making her dream possible through this loan, and she promises to make her payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy cooking ingredients including chicken, beef and vegetables.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans. Ama qui vit à Agoè avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Elle travaille  activement pour son épanouissement. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Ama frit des arachides et des dérivés d’arachides destinés à la vente dans son quartiers et gagner son bénéfice. Ama achète ses provisions six fois par mois sur un marché local du quartier. Pour commander des bols d’arachides, Ama demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer plus de bénéfice pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Ama is a married woman of 39. Ama lives in Agoé with her four dependent children. She works hard to help her family to thrive. To reach her goal, Ama fries peanuts and peanut derivatives which she sells locally to earn a profit. Ama buys her stock six times each month at a local market. To order her bowls of peanuts, Ama  requests this loan to pay for her purchase and make more profit to offer her children an education.

loans.use: to buy 15 bowls of peanuts.

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr: Ahoefa est une femme divorcée âgée de 40 ans. Ahoefa vit à Agoè pour entreprendre ses activités. Pour répondre aux besoins quotidiens qu’elle éprouve, Ahoefa vend des pagnes dans le quartier en se promenant afin d’avoir un revenu. Ahoefa s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Dans le souci d’avoir un nouveau stock, Ahoefa sollicite ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes qu’elle pourra vendre et faire une bonne rentabilité pour agrandir son commerce.
texts.en: Ahoefa is a divorced woman of 40. Ahoefa lives in Agoé and runs her business there. To provide for her daily needs, Ahoefa sells pagne traditional cloth on an itinerant basis in order to make a living. Ahoefa  buys her stock four times every month at the market. Hoping to renew her stock, Ahoefa  requests this loan to buy pagnes that she will sell to make a good profit to enable her to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy 12 units of pagne cloth.

loans.name: Lagem Taaba De Koulgorin Group

texts.fr:
M. CLAVER est responsable du groupe  LAGEM TAABA DE KOULGORIN. Marié il père de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 17 ans et le moins âgé a 02 ans. 04 enfants vont à l’école et il a 09 personnes en charge.
Monsieur fait l’élevage depuis 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne  dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 05 moutons et 20 poules. 
Monsieur veut épargner ses bénéfices et veut aussi les utiliser pour créer un lieu pour l’élevage. Il ambitionne être plus tard un grand eleveur.
texts.en:
Mr. Claver is the leader of the Lagem Taaba de Koulgorin group. He is married with six children. The oldest is 17 and the youngest is two. Four of his children go to school, and he has nine people who are dependent on him.
This gentleman has been fattening livestock for 15 years. He buys his animals in the local villages.
With the money he requests, he hopes to buy five sheep and 20 chickens.
Mr. Claver would like to save up his profits and  to use some of these profits to create a breeding farm. His ambition is to be an important livestock farmer.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and 20 chickens.

loans.name: Ramiro Ruperto

texts.es:
