Don Ramiro es un señor de 64 años, vive junto a su esposa en la ciudad de Santo Domingo, en el mismo lugar cuenta con su propio taller de carpintería, lleva años trabajando en este negocio.
Ramiro elabora puertas, juegos de comedor, camas y demás; gracias a este negocio él ha podido darles la educación a sus hijos y poder superarse poco a poco. Para nuestra institución es cliente nuevo, comenta que con este crédito el podrá aprovechar a comprar la madera antes de que suba de precio, para seguir haciendo sus obras y poder seguir con su negocio, actualmente tiene un trabajador. Se siente orgulloso de su negocio y de poder dar trabajo a terceras personas que necesitan.
Está feliz por el crédito y porque la institución le ha dado la oportunidad para seguir adelante con su taller y  Con esto mejorarán muchos sus ingresos y podrá abastecerse de madera.
texts.en:
Ramiro is a 64 year old man who lives with his spouse in the city of Santo Domingo, which is also where he has his own carpentry workshop. He has been working in this business for several years. 

Ramiro builds doors, dining sets, beds and other things. Thanks to this business he has been able to gives his children an education and slowly better himself. 

He is a new client to this institution, he says that with this loan he will be able to make the most of buying wood before the prices increase, to keep making his goods and to be able to continue with his work. He currently has one worker. He is proud of his business, and of the fact that he can give work to third parties that need it.

He is happy to have the loan, and that the institution has given him the opportunity to continue on with his workshop. With this he will greatly improve his income and stock up on wood.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and to continue growing his business.

loans.name: Lilian Coral

texts.es:
Lilian es una mujer de 34 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 7 y 10 años, y su negocio es la sastrería.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, paciente, buena oyente, solidaria, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona Sur de la ciudad,
caracterizado por sus parques ecológicos, plazas y canchas multi deportivas. De clima cálido sub tropical con una temperatura que varía durante el dia entre 21-35 grados centígrados.
Lilian es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el guaraní que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza junto a su pareja que trabaja como tejedor y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en un cuarto propio construido de madera con techo de calamina y piso de ladrillo que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la sastrería, ella se ocupa del arreglo de cualquier prenda de vestir, como; largo de pantalón, ancho de cintura, rasgaduras, etc., actividad que realiza en un cuarto en su domicilio, habilitado como taller, durante las horas del día, “también recibo pedidos y mi pequeña máquina no abastece las necesidades de mi taller…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con pedidos constantes, la desventaja es la falta de una máquina de coser industrial para abastecer sus pedidos. Su sueño es abrir una tienda en el centro de la ciudad para vender sus propias confecciones, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una máquina de coser industrial y cortes de tela para confeccionar ropa de cama de hospital. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 3 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Lilian solicita un préstamo para la compra de una máquina de coser industrial y cortes de tela para cumplir con sus pedidos.
texts.en:
Lilian is a 34 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and her 2 children, aged 7 and 10. Her business is tailoring.   

She is a good mother, enterprising, patient, a good listener, supportive, responsible, and very hardworking. She runs her business in the southern part of the city. It is characterized by its ecological parks, its plazas and its multi-sport fields. It has a warm, sub-tropical climate with a temperature that varies between 21-35 degrees centigrade. 

Lilian has dark skin, brown eyes, long, black hair, short stature, and a thin build. Her mother tongue is Guaraní, which is spoken in the area, and she speaks Spanish for the general culture and for her business. She lives with her spouse, who works as a weaver, and with her children, who are in school. They live in their own home built from wood, with a sheet metal roof and a brick floor. It has potable water, electricity and plumbing. Her business is tailoring. She alters and repairs any article of clothing, such as hemming pants, taking in or letting out waists, sewing tears, etc. She does this work in a room in her house that is set up as a workshop, during all hours of the day. “I also receive orders and my little machine can't meet the needs of my workshop," she remarks. The advantage of her business is that it has constant orders. The disadvantage is the lack of an industrial sewing machine to meet her orders. Her dream is to open a store in the center of town to sell her clothing she makes herself. She wants to expand her business by buying an industrial sewing machine and cuts of cloth to make hospital bedding. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 3 years that she has been doing this activity. 

It is for these reasons that Lilian is asking for a loan to buy an industrial sewing machine and cuts of cloth to meet her orders.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and cuts of cloth to meet her orders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods and garments so that she can increase her clientele.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 50 años de edad y habita en casa propia con su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 22 y 19 años de edad. Él se dedica a la agricultura y también a trabajar como molinero desde hace 25 años y es así como él se gana la vida para llevar el sustento a su familia. José desea cambiar el techo del corredor de su vivienda ya que se le filtra el agua lluvia por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lamina, hierro y clavos para cambiar el techo del corredor y de esta manera proteger a su familia y su vivienda de las inclemencias del tiempo.
texts.en:
José is 50 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and two children, ages 22 and 19 years old. José has been making a living working in farming and as a miller for 25 years, and this work has allowed him to earn a living so as to support his family. 

José wants to replace the roof of the hall in his home as rain is leaking in to the building. José is applying for a loan from FUSAI in order to buy metal sheets, iron bars and nails in order to replace the roof of the hall in his home and thereby protect protect his family and his home from the elements.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, iron bars and nails in order to replace the roof of the hall in his home and thereby protect protect his family and his home.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es: Maria es una madre cabeza de familia que a sus 56 años está convencida que tomó la mejor decisión de su vida al acceder a la vida comercial y por medio de esta actividad constantemente  asume nuevos retos que le permiten llevar una vida activa y entusiasta.  Hace tres años aceptó la sugerencia de la persona con quien trabajaba como empleada y se vinculó como consultora de una empresa distribuidora de productos por catálogo. Se dedica a esta actividad diariamente mediante visitas a sus clientes para promocionar sus productos y propiciar las ventas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en perfumes, ropa, y artículos de tocador.  Con esta inversión planea incrementar el inventario de productos,  incrementar el número de clientes, aumentar su nivel de ventas y generar mayores utilidades.  Su meta es tener los recursos suficientes para contribuir con el bienestar de sus hijos y nietos.
texts.en: Maria is a mother and head of household. At 56 years old, she is convinced that she made the best decision of her life by becoming involved in the business life. Through that activity she is constantly taking on new challenges that allow her to lead an active and enthusiastic life. Three years ago, she took the suggestion of a person who worked as an employee and she got involved as a consultant with a catalog product company. She works at this activity daily through visiting her customers to promote the products and drive sales. Right now, she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first loan she has taken out with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in perfumes, clothing and toiletry items. With this investment, she is planning to increase her product inventory, increase the number of customers and her sales, and generate more profit. Her goal is to have enough resources to contribute to the well being of her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to invest in perfumes, clothing and toiletry items.

loans.name: Carmena

texts.en:
Carmena is a 43 years old, separated and have three children. To earn a living she is engaged in a buy and sell business of dried fish. She buys dried fish and sells it to the community. 

She aims for a better income that's why she decided to availed a loan to buy more dried fish for sale and able to have more sales that will generate more income.

Carmena plan for the future to save money out from her business to sustain her children's needs.

loans.use: To buy more dried fish for selling.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old, married to James and she supports a family of 5 children. 

She has been practicing farming for the last 8 years earning KES 6,000 per month. 

Teresa has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy new  farming tools since the ones she has are old and ineffective.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy land for rental construction. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy new farming tools since the ones she has are old and ineffective

loans.name: Junalyn

texts.en:
“With the grace of God, we will be able to put up a big, profitable piggery someday. My children will finish their education, acquire decent job, and enjoy a better living condition.”

Junalyn speaks this phrase with faith as she shares her aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT. She’s a dedicated member of the organization where she continually gains inspiration from Bible reflections and sharing of life experiences. She is married to Steppen, a tricycle driver, and they have children. They live in Oton, Iloilo in the Visayas region. Her husband’s irregular income from tricycle driving is not enough to support all their needs. This is why she complements it by raising hogs in their backyard. According to her, it is a tiring venture but she focuses on its sustainability and its contribution to food production for the community. 

As of now, she needs to buy additional piglets and feeds; and she is requesting for PhP 15,000 loan. With additional piglets, she can increase her income and she can also set aside some amount for her children’s education. It is her aim to supply more consumers in their community in the next few months. She is praying that you would be one of God’s instruments to help her. She would really appreciate your kind support.   

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and feeds to increase her income and use for education of her children

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is thankful that she was granted a 20000 PHP loan which she used to purchase various grocery items and products needed in her general store. Through her earnings she is able to assist her parents meet their daily living expense. Aside from her general store she also has a boarding house where she rents out rooms.

She would now like to apply for a 50000 PHP loan which she will use to buy more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, frozen foods to sell. Part of the loan she will use to improve her rooms for rent. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Margie dreams of having a bigger General Store and bigger boarding house for rent. She prays that God will continue to bless her family with good health. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies .

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital  and repay Micro-Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages to sell and to renovate her boarding house as well.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is a married man with 2 children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail shop where he sells maize flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil and other items for 7 years. His business is located in a highly populated area and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of maize flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil. His business goal is to have a wholesale shop within 5 years. 

He hopes that in the future, he will improve his living standards. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children.

loans.use: buy more stocks of maize flour, rice, sugar, cooking oil

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Hog raising is a practical endeavor that surely alleviates food shortage in the community. Juanita is into this business for fifteen years and she’s convinced that it is such a profitable enterprise that offers affordable food for the community. Her income from this business helps sustain their daily needs. Despite some problems like hog illness and mortality, she remains diligent in her business. She lives in Oton, Iloilo together with her husband Rodrigo, who is a tricycle driver. 

Now that Juanita aims to improve her business by reducing illness and mortality, she wants to buy more feeds, vitamins and medicines. She will also buy additional piglets so she can increase her income. She would like to ask for PhP 10,000 loan for this purpose. This will serve as stepping stone towards her dream of a more progressive business that will secure the future of her family. 

She shares her experiences and aspirations to her co-fellowship* members at CCT Credit Cooperative. They regularly meet every week to share stories about their life and businesses and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more feeds, vitamins, medicines and additional piglets

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lourdes is 54 years old and has one child in school.

Lourdes has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lourdes has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Judith is 29 years old and has one children who are in school.

Judith has a buy and sell scrap recycling business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more scrap to sell.

Judith has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycling scraps to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting, nails and wire to replace the roof of his home and protect his family from the elements.

loans.name: Vanis Patricia

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Vanis, quien con su credikiva pudo ofrecer un mejor servicio en su Salón de Belleza e incrementar su capital de trabajo; por eso ella dice a los financiadores de Kiva “Muy agradecida por su apoyo, estoy satisfecha y esperanzada en sacar adelante a mis tres hijos”. En la actualidad está aplicando su segundo credikiva, con el cual surtirá sus  vitrinas con nuevos productos de belleza y responderá a encargos de productos de sus clientes. Su credikiva nuevamente será todo un éxito gracias a su dedicación y empeño.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Vanis, who used her last Kiva loan to offer better service at her beauty salon and to increase her assets. Vanis tells Kiva investors, "I'm very grateful for your support. I am happy and hopeful that I can move forward with my three children."

Vanis is now applying for her second Kiva loan, which she will use to stock up her display cases with new beauty products. She will also use the loan to fulfil customers' orders.

Thanks to Vanis' determination and dedication, this new Kiva loan will be a big success.

loans.use: to buy a foot spa and a chair for hair cutting.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane has a 1.5 acre farm in Gatimbi village, Kenya, where she lives and farms with her family. She keeps a dairy cow, 2 goats and 5 hens. She also grows cash crops such as coffee and bananas on a small scale. Jane sells her farm produce at Meru town, which is near her home. For the many years that she has been involved in farming, Jane has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

The biggest growth constraint that Jane has been dealing with is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to plant more banana trees on her farm. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and pay for labour.
 
With your lending, Jane will be able to afford farm inputs and wages necessary to plant more banana on her farm. This will elevate her livelihood and provide her family with better income.

loans.use: to grow more bananas to provide her family with a better income

loans.name: Everlidys

texts.es: Residente en un barrio del sur occidente de Barranquilla, Everlidys es una emprendedora mujer de 56 años que por tradición familiar ha estado vinculada al comercio desde niña; su familia es comerciante y el hogar de sus padres su sustento gracias a sus negocios independientes. Su experiencia de toda una vida en esta actividad le permitió organizar en su casa un local comercial donde vende artículos para el hogar, calzado, bolsos, papelería y cacharrería en general, productos que adquiere al por mayor en el comercio de Barranquilla. Su clientela está conformada por los vecinos y los transeúntes del sector donde reside, pueden realizar sus compras todos los días a partir de las 9:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m.  Actualmente está solicitando su primer credikiva, con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en calzado,  ropa, y artículos para el hogar,  inversión que le permitirá ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos y por lo tanto espera le genere un incremento en sus ventas y sus utilidades.  Su meta es abrir una sucursal de su negocio en otro punto del barrio, pues está convencida de que el espíritu de superación, esfuerzo y la convicción de que cada uno de nosotros puede aportar mucho a la realidad en que vivimos, hace que cada día busque más y mejores oportunidades.
texts.en: A resident of a neighborhood in southwest Barranquilla, Everlidys is an enterprising, 56 year old woman. By family tradition, she has been involved in business since she was a child. Her family are merchants and her parents' home is supported by their independent businesses. Her whole life's experience in this activity allowed her to set up a business locale in her home where she sells household items, shoes, bags, paper items and general crockery. She acquires these products wholesale from the Barranquilla market. Her customers are made up of the residents and visitors to the area where she lives. They can make their purchases every day from 9:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. Right now, she is asking for her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in shoes, clothes, and household items. This investment will allow her to offer a wider variety of products and therefore she hopes to increase her sales and profits. Her goal is to open another store for her business in another part of the neighborhood. She is convinced that the entrepreneurial spirit, hard work, and the conviction that each of us can contribute a lot to the reality we live, makes her seek more and better opportunities every day.

loans.use: to invest in shoes, clothing and household items.

loans.name: Renato

texts.en:
Here is Renato, a 51-year-old “pedicab” driver from Oton, Iloilo. “Pedicab,” also known as “trisikad,” is a three-wheeled vehicle just like the tricycle, but it doesn’t use gasoline or diesel to run. Just the power of “sikad” or kick makes it run. Simply put, it’s a bicycle with attached compartment or section for passengers. A pedicab driver uses his strength in carrying or transporting his passengers. 

Maybe Renato is really strong, not just physically, but also emotionally. His wife got sick and passed away. He was left with debts, and he alone would take responsibility for their children. 

He knows that his income from pedicab driving is not enough to sustain their needs, pay their debts, and ensure the good future for his children. This is why he plans to nurture a farm and start a sari-sari (variety) store. He needs capital of PHP 10,000 to buy seedlings and fertilizer for now. He’s knocking at your kinds hearts. Rest assured that he will use it wisely.

He dreams that his farm will be productive in the near future. He also aspires to run a sari-sari store and acquire additional pedicabs someday. Personally, his heart’s desire is to have someone, a partner in life, with whom he can share everything. He is a compliant member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with his co-fellowship* members every week to inspire and strengthen each other through religion. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the necessary materials to perform repairs on his house.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
Inocencia es una mujer de 54 años de edad, soltera, tiene un hijo de 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de cerveza.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, optimista, de buena actitud, generosa, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Ballivian’ que está ubicada al norte de la ciudad donde algunas casas todavía tienen la esencia de ser la muestra de antaño, con un muro bajo y descolorido, hechos de simple adobe. De clima frio y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -3/9 grados centígrados.
Inocencia es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la disfruta con su hijo que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto en alquiler construido de ladrilo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de cerveza al regateo, actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en fiestas patronales, bodas, aniversarios y otros, “inicié mi labor con un capital mínimo, luego logré tener mercadería por mayor..., voy a diferentes zonas a recepciones, fiestas de fraternidades…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una agenda para todo el año, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reponer su mercadería. Su sueño es vender mayores volúmenes de cerveza, ella desea realizar la compra de diferentes variedades de cervezas por mayor para almacenarlas y distribuirlas a sus clientes continuos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Inocecnia solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerveza por mayor para ofertarla en diferentes acontecimientos.
texts.en:
Inocencia, 54, is single, has a 16-year-old son, and sells beer. She is a good mother and a dynamic entrepreneur. She has an optimistic streak and is always of a sunny disposition. Generous to a fault, she is also responsible and very hard-working.
She sells beer in the Ballivian neighbourhood, in the northern part of the city, where some of the houses still look like they did in the past, with low and discoloured walls made of simple dried brick.
The weather is cold and dry, with temperatures of between -3 and 9 degrees Celsius during the day.
Inocencia has brown skin, brown eyes, and long black hair that she wears in a braid. She is on the short side and quite strong too. She dresses in traditional garb (a hat, a plaid, and a skirt)
and her mother tongue is Aymará, which she speaks at home. She learned Spanish by hearing people speak it around her and by speaking with her customers.
She enjoys life with her son, who goes to school. They live in a rented room made of bricks and cement with a thatched roof and wooden floors. It has drinking water, electricity, and gas, and is connected to the sewer system.
Inocencia sells beer and sets the price by haggling. She peddles her wares at saints' celebrations, weddings, birthdays, and other festive gatherings.
She says that she started her business with very little capital and then managed to buy her merchandise wholesale. She goes to various areas and targets receptions, frat parties, etc.
Her business's main advantage is that it can be practised all year round. The main challenge for Inocencia is that she lacks capital to replenish her stock. Her dream is to sell more beer and she wants to buy many varieties wholesale in order to satisfy her regulars.
Inocencia has been in business for six years, but this is her first loan with the field partner.
She will use the loan to buy beer wholesale in order to sell at parties and gatherings.

loans.use: to buy beer wholesale to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
Candelaria continúa con su negocio de venta de ropa de segunda mano. Él préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor, sus ventas fueron continuas y logró pagar sus cuotas a tiempo y sin inconvenientes. Su vida personal cambió por la llegada de un cachorro que encontró en la calle y lo adoptó. En esta oportunidad y constantemente, ella necesita abastecer su negocio con mayor variedad y cantidad de ropa, también desea abrir otra tienda del mismo rubro en otro mercado. La ventaja de su negocio es que la ropa se vende constantemente porque tiene un puesto fijo de venta, la desventaja es la falta de capital para reponer la mercadería vendida. Su sueño es vender ropa de segunda mano por mayor, ella desea realizar la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para reponer su inventario y continuar con su negocio. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Candelaria solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa de segunda mano por mayor para reponer su inventario y continuar con su negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria still sells second-hand clothes.
She invested the previous loan in the purchase of second-hand clothes wholesale. Sales were good and she managed to repay her loan on time without difficulty.
Her personal life changed when she adopted a puppy she found on the street.
Now, Candelaria needs again to replenish her stock and buy more clothes of various types. She also wants to open a similar shop in another part of town.
One advantage in this business is that she can sell all year round because she has a shop. The main challenge for Candelaria is that she lacks capital to replenish her stock.
She dreams of becoming a second-hand-clothing wholesaler, but for now she wants to buy more clothes to replenish her stock and keep her shop going.
Candelaria has been in business for ten years and this is her second loan with the field partner. She asks for a loan to buy more clothes wholesale to replenish her stock and keep her shop going.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en:
Morris is a married man. He has seven children. He describes himself as humble. 

He operates a food stall where he sells tea, coffee, mandazi and other food. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an area good for business and his primary customers are individuals. 

He describes his biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. 

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 32 years old, married to Geoffrey and supports a family of one child. 

She has been selling vegetables for the last eight years, earning KES 6,000 per month.
 
Joyce has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy additional stock of fresh tomatoes, onions and green leafy vegetables for resale.

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy land for rental construction. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fresh tomatoes, onions and green leafy vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in cement and sand to plaster the house and provide better security for her family.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself as humble. 

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, rice, soap and other items. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. He hopes that in the future, he will be successful. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Virginia is 45 years old and has three children are presently in school.

Virginia has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish and other materials to her business.

Virginia has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her dried fish business

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is 27 years old and has two children.

Mary Joy is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She has been farming vegetables for two years now and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Mary Joy requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Mary Joy would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 58 years old and married with nine children. With one child in school, Elisa works very hard to provide for them.

Elisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Elisa has been in this business for 30 years. 

In the future, Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, canned goods, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Rowena works hard to support her family.

She has a fish-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from food vending. 

Rowena is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for milk production so as to increase the number of litres of milk supplied to clients daily.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy animal feeds for his animals for higher production

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a single woman. She has two children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, rice, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds. 

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and maize seeds for planting so as to get a better harvest for family use and sale to clients in the market.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
“As for me and my household, we will serve the Lord.” (Joshua 24:15)

This is Maria Teresa’s favorite Bible verse. She prays to God that her children will know more about God, and her whole family will serve Him. She’s not only concerned about their financial needs or social life, but she gives more importance to their spiritual growth.

Maria Teresa is a fish vendor from Talisay City, Cebu. Her husband, Ernesto, is jobless; that is why she works diligently to earn a living. But the rainy season gives her difficulty to earn enough for her family. The price of fish increases during this season, and she can hardly afford it.

She needs additional capital of PHP 50,000 to augment her business. She can use this to buy volume and different varieties of fish in order to keep her business running, even during rainy days. Her income from this will sustain their daily needs. She can also set aside some amount for her children’s education. Her goals are to eventually make her business prosper, gain stability in the midst of stiff competition, complete her children’s education, and enjoy a better living condition someday.

Maria Teresa is a dutiful member of CCT Credit Cooperative and meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy volume and different varieties of fish.

loans.name: Glen

texts.en:
Glen, 30, is an expectant father and he imagines himself as a better husband and a very good father when his child is born. He’s doing everything to prepare for his wife’s delivery. 

He makes fruit tarts and sells them to his friends and neighbors in Oton, Iloilo. He also accepts orders for different occasions. 

Now that their child is on the way, he plans to increase his sales and profit. He appeals for a PHP 20,000 loan to buy ingredients and equipment for making fruit tarts. This will enhance his income, which he will use to buy medicines and vitamins for his wife. He will also save for the upcoming delivery expenses. 

He dreams of having an outlet where he can display his products, so he can be easily located by many buyers. He regularly meets with his co-fellowship members every week to share stories of his life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and religion. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and equipment for making fruit tarts.

loans.name: Sheila

texts.en:
Sheila is 39 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Sheila requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Sheila has been raising pigs for 2 years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF two times in the past to support her business. In the future, Sheila would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Ma. Ailene

texts.en:
Ma. Ailene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Ailene is 40 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Ma. Ailene has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

Ma. Ailene has been in this business for two years. In the future, Ma. Ailene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Tomasita

texts.en:
Tomasita is a 22-year-old, married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Tomasita has a fishing business in the Philippines, and she requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

Tomasita has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 42 years old and has four children who are in school.

Cristina has a buy and sell root crops business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy root crops to sell in her business.

Cristina has been in this business for 4 years.  In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy root crops to sell in her business, to save for college fees

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah has a 2.5 acre farm in Nwituria village, where she farms and lives with her family. Her farm has four dairy cows, 12 head of poultry and 75 trees.  She sells her farm produce at Mwithare, which is a local market near her home. She started farming 28 years ago when she got married. Through the years, farming has provided her a source of income to help her husband provide for their four children.
  
The biggest growth constraint for Sarah is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 

With your lending, Sarah will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and her family income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Fehmida

texts.en:
Fehmida is the responsible mother of nine children and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 35 years. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family. He needs to do maintenance on his taxi because the current condition of his taxi is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. 

Due to insufficient financial means, her husaband is unable to make maintenance of his taxi. Therefore Fehmida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Fehmida's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn a profitable income. Fehmida also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.

Fehmida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to repair her husband's taxi

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 53 years old and is married to Hellen. They are blessed with 5 children. He has been supplying spare bicycle parts for the last 10 years, earning 12,000 KES per month. 

Samwel has applied for his first loan (25,000 KES) from VisionFund Kenya to buy more stocks of bicycle repair parts to sell. He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to buy land for rental construction. His future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bicycle repair parts to sell.

loans.name: Jeondry

texts.en:
Jeondry is 35 years old, married and has two children to provide for. 

He wants to give his family a good living, so he engaged in a transport business within his community. He aims to increase his income to provide his children a better life, so he decided to borrow a loan to buy spare parts for motor maintenance. This way he will  be able to continue catering passengers that can generate more income.

Jeondry plans for the future to save money from his business to sustain the educational needs of his children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motor maintenance.

loans.name: Jannah

texts.en:
Jannah is 27 years old, married and has one child to provide for. To earn a living and be able to help her husband as a driver for a living, she is engaged in and manages a transport business. With this business, their family has been providing their daily needs for two years already. 

She wants to increase her income, so she decided to borrow a loan to pay the motor registration and for motor maintenance so that they can continue catering to passengers that generate more income.

Jannah's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle to expand her business.

loans.use: to pay for the motor registration and motor maintenance.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Direct selling business is common in the Philippines, especially for housewives who want to be productive and are willing to supplement the lack of family resources. Working people who want to earn extra money often engage in this business also. It’s easy to venture into a direct-selling business since it typically requires low capital to begin with. Then the entrepreneur or direct selling representative will just enhance the business by expanding her network and properly rolling up capital.

Clarita, of Oton, Iloilo, is a direct-selling representative who sells Avon products. She is married to Jonathan, a laborer, and they have children who are studying in high school. Her husband’s job is occasional and his income cannot suffice for their everyday expenses and the children’s education. This is the reason why Clarita aspires to improve her business with the aid of additional capital amounting to PHP 15,000. 

She will use the loan to buy more Avon products that she can sell to her friends, neighbors and others. She’s positive that this additional capital will give her more profit to support their everyday expenses. Her dream is to have a stable space or a showroom for her business someday. She also desires for a good future for her children and harmonious relationships among her family. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and her religion. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more products for her direct-selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building materials like sand and bricks, to build a house for her and her children.

loans.name: Datkaim

texts.ru: Даткаим, 50 лет, замужем, мать 2 детей. В 2000 году она начала сельскохозяйственный бизнес. На сегодняшний день есть 10 коров, 6 овец и 2 лошади. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает рис и клевер. Дети и супруг помогают по хозяйству. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнеса Даткаим около 17,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров. Доходы от кредита позволят Даткаим развить ее бизнес и улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Datkaim is 50 years old, married, and the mother of two children. In 2000 she started an agricultural business. Today she has ten cows, six sheep and two horses. She grows rice and clover on 2.0 hectares of land. Her children and husband help on the farm. The monthly profit from Datkaim's business is about 17,000 som (KGS). She has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy two cows. The proceeds of the loan will allow Datkaim to develop her business and improve the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy two cows in order to increase her herd.

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Ruslan, who is 30 years old, lives in the village of Tsodoreti. He has a wife, mother and pensioner grandmother. Ruslan and his family members are temporarily unemployed and live under poverty. In the region, there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.

So Ruslan decided to start a private business with a loan, but the local credit providers usually demand experience and some stable income from the borrowers. His credit requests were rejected several times, as he was unable to satisfy their requirements. 

Ruslan received credit in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo through the Startup Program that gives rural, poor people the chance to start or restart businesses.
  
With the requested amount, Ruslan will purchase all needed tools and will start painting cars. He will have customers among the local people and will generate his own income. 

The Startup credit will be a great support for the family, as they will get the only source of income that will increase their living conditions. Regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and start painting cars

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is 25 years old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her spouse and four children. Her husband has been running own tailoring shop in the local market for 2 years, her husband is only responsible to fulfill the needs of entire family.

Shamim's husband needs to buy different types of tailoring accessories e.g. pieces of cloth, lace, needles and sewing machine accessories. But due to some financial constraints, her husband is not in suitable condition to buy above these items for his business purpose. 

Therefore Shamim has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount she will financially assist her husband to above these tailoring accessories to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn more profitable income.

On this financial assistance Shamim is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's tailoring business for the welfare of the family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for her work.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet has a 1.5 acre farm in Gatimbi village, where she lives with her family. Her farm has one dairy cow, five hens, 20 trees and banana trees. Her primary source of income is bananas, which she sells at Meru market located near her farm. 

Janet started farming in 1993, and through the years, she has learned a great deal about banana farming and the food market.  

The biggest growth constraint for Janet is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds and fertilizers and to pay for labor that will be involved in seedbed preparation.  

With your lending, Janet will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to grow more bananas on her farm

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 43 years old and married to David. She supports six children. 

She has been a farmer for the last 18 years, and the business earns her KES 12,000 per month. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for family use. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and expand her agricultural sector. 

Her hope is to be financially stable and educate her children to higher levels of education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for family use.

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en:
Parveen is a 52-year-old woman, and a mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a vegetable seller by profession. Her husband sells vegetables, e.g., potatoes, onions, tomatoes, etc. Her husband is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Parveen's husband needs to purchase different types of vegetables for reselling purposes, so that he can increase the size of the business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. But due to an unfavorable financial position, her husband is not in the condition to purchase vegetables for his business purpose.

Therefore, Parveen has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's vegetable business

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik lives in Stepanavan with her 21-year-old daughter. 

Hasmik works at a local postal service and also is engaged in clothing sales. She trades in men's and women's clothing and also sells some cosmetics from her house. 

To be able to overcome financial difficulties, Hasmik works day and night. Her business is stable, and she is able to maintain her daughter's living. 

To be able to purchase new clothing to sell to customers, and cover their current orders, Hasmik has applied for this loan. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

This is Hasmik's first deal with Kiva, and she hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for new clothing to sell to customers

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr: Minata  est la femme qui tient la tasse dans ses mains, elle est vendeuse de savons. Minata est mariée et mère de 03 enfants, Elle fréquente le marché local pour faire ses achats et ventes. En vue d’accroitre ses activités commerciales pour soutenir plus son mari aux charges familiales, (éducation, frais de santé habillement etc…des enfants. Elle a une bonne réputation dans le quartier et au sein de son groupe.
texts.en: Minata is the woman holding the bowl in the photo. She sells soap for a living. Minata is a married mother to three children. She frequents the local market to purchase and sell her wares. She wants to grow her commercial activities and thereby further support her husband with their family's needs (school fees, health costs and clothing for their children). She maintains a good reputation in her local area and within her group.

loans.use: to purchase soap for resale

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is 58 years old, married to Robinah and supports a family of 7 children. 

He has been practicing small scale farming for the last 28 years earning KES 12,000 per month.

Samwel has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to improve his farming activities in the area. 

His future hopes and plans are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the market for more income gain.

loans.name: Gail

texts.en:
Gail is a 34 years old, single and has one child. As a single mother, she wants what is the best for her child, that's why she engaged in a food selling in the school. She wants to increase her income so that she can provide her child daily needs. So she decided to buy more grocery items for sale and able to increase her inventory that will generate more income.


Gail plan for the future is to save money to sustain her child educational needs.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items for selling.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is 62 years old, married and has four children to provide for. To earn for living she plants her vegetable garden, She plant vegetables and sell them to the community. She wants to increase her income that's why she decided to borrowed a loan to purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden, so that it can produce a good quality of vegetables and able to have a lot of vegetables to be sell in the market. 


Estela plan for the future to expand her business to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her vegetable garden.

loans.name: Jeancy

texts.en:
Jeancy is 53 years old, married with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jeancy has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jeancy requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Jeancy has been in this business for three years. In the future, Jeancy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Verna Liez

texts.en:
Verna Liez is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Verna Liez is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Verna Liez has a food vending business in the Philippines. Verna Liez requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Verna Liez has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Verna Liez would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Shuhratjon

texts.ru:
Шухратчон мужчина 35 лет, женат, счастливый отец 4 детей. Он родился и вырос в семье рабочих и с детства приучен к труду. Он не смог поступить в университет, потому что у его родителей не было средств. Он остался жить с родителями, женился и начал заниматься животноводством. Сейчас у него участок в 10 гектаров земли, в стаде у него 6 коров. Его жена доит коров и относит молоко на рынок для продажи. Молоко хорошо скупается.
Шухрат один работает в семье, содержит и своих родителей, и жену с детьми. Ему приходится тяжело. В настоящее время Шухрат обратился в МДО Арванд за получением кредита. Он хочет расширить свой бизнес и купить 2 коров. Но у него нет полной суммы денег. Шухрат благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Shuhratjon is a 35-year-old man. He is married and the happy father of four children. He was born and raised in a working class family and was accustomed to work from childhood. He was not able to go to university because his parents did not have the funds. He remained living with his parents, got married and began rearing animals. Now he has a 10 hectare parcel of land and he has six cows in his herd. His wife milks the cows and takes the milk to market for sale. The milk sells well.

Shuhratjon alone works in his family, and he supports his parents as well as his wife and children. It is difficult for him. At the present time Shuhratjon has applied to MDO Arvand to receive a loan. He wants to expand his business and buy two cows, but he does not have the full amount of money. Shuhratjon thanks you for your support and trust.

loans.use: to expand the size of his herd.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has a 10 acre farm in North-Rift area of Kenya where she lives and farms with her family. She keeps 3 diary cows and grows cash crops and trees on her garden. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home. She started farming 45 years ago and through the years, she has formed strong relationships with her customers.
 
The biggest growth constraint for Teresa is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. 

She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 
With your lending, Teresa will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and family income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as certified seeds and fertilizers to improve her crop productivity

loans.name: Ma. Fatima

texts.en:
Ma. Fatima is 29 years old and has two children. She is married and both of her children are attend in school.

Ma. Fatima is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Ma. Fatima requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Ma. Fatima has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ma. Fatima would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Tiburcio

texts.es:
Tiburcio es un pequeño caficultor de 43 años, su pequeña finca es de 5.6 hectáreas, de las cuales 2.8 son de café, el cual es manejado bajo los criterios de certificación de comercio justo, lo cual ha logrado por su esfuerzo y dedicación en el manejo de su finca.

En el ciclo pasado él tuvo dificultades con su cosecha, ya que no cuenta con la infraestructura productiva para el manejo adecuado de su café, lo cual afecta los rendimientos y calidad de su producción.

Por lo anterior, está solicitando un financiamiento para la construcción de un beneficio húmedo que le permita mejorar los ingresos por un aumento en la productividad de su finca.
texts.en:
Tiburcio, aged 43, is a small-scale coffee grower. His small farm is 5.6 hectares, of which 2.8 ha are used for coffee. This is managed under the criteria of fair trade certification, which he has achieved by his hard work and commitment in managing the farm. In the last growing cycle he had difficulties with the harvest, since he does not have the production infrastructure to handle the coffee properly, which affected the yields and quality of his product. 

Because of this, he is asking for a loan to build a wet coffee-processing plant which will enable him to improve his income by increasing the productivity of his farm.

loans.use: to build a wet coffee-processing plant and improve the yields and quality of the coffee he produces.

loans.name: Silvia Nohemy

texts.es: Silvia tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 1 año de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas con eso ella obtiene sus ingresos para ayudarle a su compañero de vida a llevar el sustento a su hogar. Silvia está construyendo una casa de adobe, pero necesita hacerle divisiones de ladrillo y lamina para el techo, por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: ladrillo, cemento, arena, lámina y madera para hacer divisiones y colocar techo a su vivienda para cumplir el sueño de tener casa propia.
texts.en: Silvia is 21 years old and lives in her own house with her life companion and her one year old son. She works selling pupusas where she gets the income to help her life companion provide sustenance for the household. Silvia is constructing a house out of adobe, but she needs to make brick partitions and put laminated sheeting on the roof. So she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy brick, cement, sand, laminated sheeting and wood to make partitions and put a roof on her house to fulfill the dream of having her own house.

loans.use: to buy brick, cement, sand, laminated sheeting and wood to make partitions and put a roof on her house to fulfill the dream of having her own house.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a 52 years old, married and has three children to provide for. To earn a living she is engaged in a banana production business. She sell bananas to the market from her banana farm. To increase her income she needs to produce more bananas and deliver more bananas in the market.

 To achieve this she decided to borrowed a loan to pay the labor cost for harvesting the bananas so that she can have more bananas to be deliver in the market.

Elpedia plan for the future to save money out from her business income to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: To pay the labor cost for harvesting her bananas.

loans.name: Gloria Aida

texts.es:
Gloria, de 48 años de edad, es madre de 7 hijos, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, solo tres de sus hijos viven con ella y su esposo.

Gloria, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, pero anteriormente trabajó en una pequeña granja de pollos que ella instalo, pero después decidió dedicarse plenamente a su familia. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizantes para los cultivos que su esposo sembró.

Para el futuro sueña con construir su propia vivienda, ya que actualmente la casa donde vive no es propia.
texts.en:
Gloria, age 48, has seven children.  She went to school through the third grade.  She is married, and her husband works in agriculture.  Only three of their children live with her and her husband.

Gloria devotes herself to the household chores.  However, she previously worked with a small chicken farm that she set up.  Later she decided to devote herself completely to her family.

She needs the loan to buy fertilizers for the crops that her husband planted.

In the future she dreams of building her own house.  The house where she currently lives is not her own.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the crops that her husband planted.

loans.name: Ma. Magdalena

texts.en:
Ma. Magdalena is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Magdalena is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Ma. Magdalena has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Ma. Magdalena requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell.

Ma. Magdalena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Magdalena would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Ol Rongai Upendo Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Naomi, a member of Ol rongai Upendo women group in Nakuru Kenya. She is married and blessed with ten children. Naomi joined Hand in hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2013.

Naomi does maize, beans and livestock farming. HiH EA enterprise training has enabled her to manage the enterprise profitably. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds that will improve the quality and quantity of her crop yield, thus to maximize profit.  Income from this enterprise will help meet family basic needs and medical care.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds that will improve the quality and quantity of her crop yield thus to maximize profit.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a 23 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and is the mother of one child. Her husband owns a printing shop and is the guardian of family and responsible to fulfill the need of all family members. 

Shamim has been running her own beauty saloon for past three years, she also contribute her income with her husband to manage the household.
 She needs to buy different types of cosmetics i.e creams, hairbrushes and other accessories for her beauty salon but due to financial constraints she is not capable to buy these items for her business purpose. 

Therefore Shamim has applied for a Kiva loan. This loan will help her to buy the relevant items for her business purpose so that she can provide better services to her customers and it will also be helpful for her to earn maximum profitable income to fulfill the needs of her business and family.

For this financial assistance Shamim is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her beauty salon business with creams, hairbrushes etc and to earn more for the family welfare

loans.name: United Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Lilian, a member of United women group. She is fifty eight years old, married and has eight children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in year 2014 to learn and gain knowledge in enterprise start up and financial management. From the training she has been able to manage her business and keep her financial records well.
 
Lilian’s economic activity is maize and beans farming. She is borrowing from Kiva to buy top dressing fertilizers. By so doing she will increase her yields and hence increases her income. This will further enable her meet the rising family needs such as clothing, food and education.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy top dressing fertilizer that will help increase yield thus meet rising family needs such as clothing, food and education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, sand, cement, iron, corrugated metal sheeting, nails, doors, and windows in order to finish the fourth bedroom.

loans.name: Eulita

texts.en:
Eulita has a 3.5 acre farm in Nandi Hills area of Kenya where she lives with her family. On the farm, she keeps 6 dairy cows and 4 sheep, and grows tea and trees. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home where Juhudi Kilimo has an office set up for them.

It has been 4 years since Eulita started farming and she has reached a point where she needs external funding to grow her business. She is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests. 

With your lending, Eulita will be able access capital, from a licensed and credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will enhance her crops' health, increase quality and quantity of yields and ultimately provide better income for her family to meet their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, like improved seeds and fertilizer for better yield and thus profit

loans.name: Lilian Elizabeth

texts.es:
Lilian vive en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, habita sola en una humilde casa de madera que la ha podido construir gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo.
Lilian cuenta con un puesto en el centro donde vende ropa usada, calzado y mochilas, atiende muy atentamente todos los días de la semana, cuenta con años de experiencia en el negocio. Sale desde muy temprano y regresa por la tarde a su hogar, comenta que al principio fue duro comenzar porque no contaba con el apoyo de nadie, comenzó de a poco y ahora ya tiene su negocio propio.
Lilian jamás ha trabajado con créditos, cuenta con un garante ya que los vecinos del negocio la conocen y la respaldan. Con este dinero recibido podrá comprar más mercadería, surtir con más calzado ya que es una buena época por ser temporada escolar.
Se siente feliz porque así podrá seguir saliendo y creciendo adelante en su negocio; agradece a la institución y a Kiva por permitir que microempresarios como ella surjan.
texts.en:
Lilian lives in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados. She lives alone in a humble wooden house which she has been able to build thanks to her efforts in her work. Lilian has a stall in the centre where she sells used clothing, footwear and rucksacks. She runs the business very attentively every day of the week and has years of experience in the business. She goes out very early and returns home in the evening. She says that at the beginning it was hard to get started because she did not have help from anyone. She started gradually and now she has her own business. Lilian has never worked with loans; she has a guarantor since the neighbours of her business know her and support her.

With this money she has received she will be able to buy more merchandise and stock up with more footwear since this is a good time as it is the school season. She feels happy because in this way she will be able to keep moving forward and growing in her business. She is grateful to the institution and to Kiva for allowing micro businessmen and women like her to make progress.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise and stock the business and so make progress in life as a micro businesswoman.

loans.name: Set- Kobor Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Joan, a member of set-Kobor group in Nakuru Kenya. She is twenty one years old, married and blessed with one child. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in February 2014.
 
Joan does maize and beans farming, and also keeps poultry. With the training she got from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she has been able to run her enterprise better and profitably unlike before. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizers and chicken feeds. This will increase her farm production thus meet the demand for cereals and chicken leading to more income. This will  go a long way in supporting her family basic needs such as medical care. 

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and chicken feeds that will help boost farm output thus more income to meet medical expenses.

loans.name: Mastona

texts.ru: Мастона женщина 40 лет, замужем, мать троих детей. Мастона по окончанию школы вышла замуж. Сейчас у нее трое детей. Её муж шофер, он также работает на стройке. Ему было сложно одному содержать семью, поэтому Мастона решила начать заниматься животноводством. Сейчас у нее в стаде 5 коров и 10 баранов. Коров она доит и относит молоко на рынок для продажи. Молоко хорошо скупается.Также она занимается купле-продажей скота. Сейчаc она хочет купить корм для стада, но у нее нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому она обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Мастона надеется, что ей выделят нужную сумму. Благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en: Mastona is a 40-year old woman. She is married and the mother of three children. Mastona got married on graduation from school. Now she has three children. Her husband is a chauffeur and he also works in construction. It was difficult for him to support the family on his own, and so Mastona decided to start rearing animals. Now she has five cows and ten sheep in her herd. She milks the cows and takes the milk to market for sale. The milk sells well. She also buys and sells livestock. Now she wants to buy feed for the herd, but she does not have enough money. She has therefore applied to MDO Arvand for financial support. Mastona hopes that she will be given the necessary sum. She thanks you for your support and trust.

loans.use: to buy livestock feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 29-year-old single man. Six years ago, he started working in furniture making to cover his needs and expenses. He also started lately transporting students as a second source of income. He is an ambitious man and a hard worker who has a good reputation among his customers.

Today, Hussein is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his furniture making business through buying a mini van which will help him in transporting raw materials to his shop and in delivering requested products to his customers.

Hussein hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a mini van to collect his furniture making raw materials and then deliver the manufactured results to clients

loans.name: Seidy

texts.es: Doña Seidy es una mujer de 57 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su compañero, el cual es el padre de sus hijos. Actualmente en la casa viven ellos y dos nietos que ella tiene a cargo. Los dos nietos estudian uno cursa la primaria y otro la secudaria. Muy trabajadora y esforzada por cumplir sus metas. Ella se dedica al comercio ambulante de ventas por catálogos de zermat y productos naturales. Primero ve su hogar y luego sale a ofrecer su mercadería. Tiene varios años de obtener ingresos de esa manera sin descuidar a su familia, debido a que le gusta relacionarse con las demás personas. Cuenta con el apoyo de su familia en las decisiones a tomar. Su patrimonio ha sido financiado en tres ocasiones por la Fundación y ha mostrado puntualidad. Éste es el cuarto crédito que solicita para invertir más fuerte en la compra de productos naturales para la salud. Una de sus metas es aumentar su cartera, asi sus ventas para superarse como persona, socializarse más y mantenerse ocupada en algo que la lleve al éxito, por eso solicita otra vez financiamiento,para satisfacer a sus clientes, cumpliendo con los pedidos para mejorar la salud, asi también mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Seidy is a 57 year old woman, she lives with her life partner who is the father of their children. Currently, the two of them live at home with two grandchildren she is taking care of. The two grandchildren study, one is in elementary and the other in high school. Very hard working and making a strong effort to accomplish her goals, she works in commerce as a traveling saleswoman, selling zermat catalog products and natural products.
First she takes care of her home and then she goes out to offer her merchandise. She has been generating incomes for several years this way, without neglecting her family, as she likes to interact with people. She enjoys the support of her family in the decisions she has to take. Her estate has been financed on three occasions by the foundation and she has shown her punctuality. This is the fourth credit she is requesting to invest more heavily in the purchase of natural health products. 
One of her goals is to increase her purse and her sales to better herself as a person. Other goals include socializing more and staying busy on something which brings her success. This is why she is requesting financing again to satisfy her clients, fulfill the orders to improve health and by doing so improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase natural products and cosmetics through catalogs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new digital camera

loans.name: Hayam

texts.en: Hayam, 37,  is married and has two children. Her husband works in wall plastering, and she has a small clothing business. Hayam previously requested two consecutive loans and successfully repaid them. She is requesting a 10,000 EGP loan to buy more clothing to increase her sales especially during Ramadan and feast seasons.

loans.use: To buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Kabuwoko School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Alfred. He is the Head teacher of Kabuwoko Secondary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Masaka with 500 students. Kabuwoko Secondary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank with a pump, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kabuwoko Secondary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Alfred ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: invest in: cement, sand and gravel to pour cement for the floor and walls of his residence

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es:
Sabina es una mujer de 53 años, casada, sin hijos, y su negocio es la confección y venta de chamarras.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, amable, abnegada, buena mujer, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘cosmos 79’ donde se encuentra el estadio de futbol de la ciudad. Ubicado a una altura de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frío y seco durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -3/12 grados centígrados.
