Sabina es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, complexión física robusta, su forma de vestir es tradicional (sombrero, manta y pollera), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la confección y venta de chamarras, ella se ocupa de comprar tela, hilos, cierres, etc., para confeccionar chamarras. También se ocupa de la venta, está la realiza por mayor y menor, “inicié mi negocio con mi esposo, las ventas las realizamos por mayor y por menor…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que las ventas son por mayor y a diario, la desventaja son la falta de material de confección como; tela por rollo, hilos, cierres, botones, etc. Su sueño es vender a otras ciudades, ella desea realizar la compra de tela por mayor y otros materiales de confección. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 20 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Sabina solicita un préstamo para la compra de tela por rollo para confeccionar chamarras y vender a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
Sabina, age 53, is married and has no children.  Her business is making and selling jackets.  She is an enterprising, independent, kind, selfless, good, responsible, and very hard-working woman.  She conducts her business in the ‘Cosmos 79’ area, which is where the city soccer stadium is.  It is 4,000 meters above sea level with a cold and dry climate during the whole year.  The temperature during the day varies between 3 and 12 degrees centigrade.

Sabina has a dark complexion, brown eyes, and long hair that she braids.  She is short and has a sturdy build.  She wears traditional clothing (hat, shawl, and skirt).  Her mother tongue is Ayamará, which she speaks with her family.  She speaks Spanish with the general public and for her business.

She shares her life with her husband, who is a merchant.  They live in their own house made of brick and cement.  It has a corrugated metal roof and a wood floor.  It has running water, electricity, gas, and indoor plumbing.

Her business is making and selling jacket.  She buys fabric, thread, and zippers, etc. in order to make jackets.  She also sells them for wholesale and retail.  “I started my business with my husband.  We make our sales for wholesale and for retail,” she says.  The advantage of the business is that the sales are in bulk and made daily.  The disadvantage is the lack of materials; like bolts of fabric, thread, zippers, and buttons, etc. to make the jackets.

This is the first loan cycle with the institution in the 20 years she has been in this business.  It is for these reasons that Sabina is requesting a loan to buy bolts of fabric in order to make jackets and sell them in other cities.

loans.use: to buy bolts of fabric in order to make jackets and sell them in other cities.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 25 years old and married with three children, one of whom is in school. For three years, she has earned a living by raising livestock and running a general store in the Philippines. Emily is borrowing 7,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en: Barnabas is a male aged 44 years with 3 children of whom 2 attend school in Kasese-Uganda. He deals textiles and has an additional source of income from motorcycle transport. He ventured into business in 2007 so as to look after his personal needs although the business is faced with a challenge of market competition and price fluctuations. He describes himself as being hard working. He has a hope of constructing a residential house. He is requesting a loan to buy more textiles for selling.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for selling.

loans.name: Mirgul

texts.ru: Миргул, 29 лет, замужем, есть 3 детей, старший сын- школьник. У Миргул среднее образование, 10 лет занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду и целеустремленности Миргул, на сегодняшний день у нее имеется 3,0 ГА собственного земельного надела, где она ежегодно выращивает пшеницу и рис для реализации. Также в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 8 овец. Ежемесячный доход от сельскохозяйственной деятельности составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Миргул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) для покупки и посадки экологически чистого риса. Миргул намерена направлять доходы на развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Mirgul is 29 years old, married, and has three children. Her eldest son is a school pupil. Mirgul has a secondary education. She has been growing crops and rearing animals for ten years. Thanks to Mirgul's hard work and dedication, today she has a 3.0 hectare plot of her own land where each year she grows wheat and rice for sale. She also has two cows and eight sheep. The monthly income from agricultural activities is about 7,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Mirgul has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy and plant organic rice. Mirgul intends to direct the proceeds towards developing her business.

loans.use: to plant and cultivate organic rice for sale.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en:
Salma is 34 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan and mother of 4 children. Her husband is an electrician and he has been running his electric store for past 15 years, her husband is responsible to feed his entire family and fulfill their needs.

Salma's husband has to purchase electric merchandise e.g wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other electric devices but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to purchase these items for business purpose.

Therefore She has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. So that she can help her husband to purchase these merchandises as per his business needs. This loan will also him her husband to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.

Salma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's electric business, buying wires,cables, plug shoes etc to maximize his sales and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy chips, biscuits, candies, school supplies like papers, pen, crayons and pencils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops in her farm so as to enable her get better harvest for family use and sale

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
She is Catherine, 24 and resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She has a life partner named Aldrin who works as a machine operator. She has a small business to augment their income to meet their personal and household needs.

Catherine is a dealer of different kinds of processed meat.  She earns by buying several packs of process meat at wholesale price and sells them at retail price. Her food items include marinated pork, marinated beef, hot dog, bacon etc.  Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, and the local community. She is happy with the return on her investment. She earns a minimum of PHP 800 in sales every day.  

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 19000 loan which she will use the loan to buy several packs of various kinds of processed meat to meet the increased demand of her food items especially now that school year has started in the Phils. She is also thanking God and you for your good heart for your great help.

Catherine hopes to be able to grow her business and desires to have an abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for processed meat to sell.

loans.name: Josephyn

texts.en:
Josephyn is 21 years old with a two-year-old son from the town of Ronda in Cebu.  Josephyn works hard for the needs of her son. She sell t-shirts and shorts, locally known as RTW (Ready-to- wear) in her community. Some of these items are taken on credit so she can hardly buy additional stocks on time. 

She is asking a loan to buy shirts, shorts, hard wood and nails for her house repair.  Josephyn hope to expand her business and make the most of her livelihood.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts and also hard wood and nails for her house repair

loans.name: Waldy Enrique

texts.es: Waldy de 40 años, reside en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla en compañía de su cónyuge y sus seis hijos, por mucho tiempo trabajo en tiendas de barrio, donde tuvo la oportunidad de adquirir la experiencia necesaria para que años más tardes aperturara su propia tienda. Este emprendedor en compañía de su cónyuge, todos los días de la semana ofrecen a los habitantes del sector víveres de la canasta familiar, carnes y licores.  Su buena actitud frente a los clientes ha promovido la fidelización, la voz a voz de excelentes precios y productos de buena calidad han incrementado la demanda, al punto que está solicitando su primer credikiva, con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir más surtido; aceite, arroz, legumbres, bebidas, carnes, detergentes, cervezas y demás. Su meta a largo plazo es realizar unas adecuaciones locativas a su vivienda y continuar financiándole los estudios a sus hijos.
texts.en:
40-year-old Waldy lives in a neighbourhood situated in the town of Barranquilla along with his spouse and their six children. For a long time he worked in neighbourhood shops, where he had the opportunity to gain the necessary experience so that years later he could open his own shop. Accompanied by his wife, he is an entrepreneur. Every day of the week they offer the local inhabitants everyday family groceries, meat and spirits. Their good attitude towards customers has promoted loyalty, and by word of mouth their excellent prices and good quality products have increased demand. 

This has reached the point where he is asking for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in more stock: oil, rice, vegetables, soft drinks, meat, detergent, beer and other items.

His long-term goal is to carry out some home improvements and to continue to pay for his children's studies.

loans.use: to invest in more stock: oil, rice, vegetables, soft drinks, meat, detergent, beer and other items.

loans.name: Aloysious

texts.en:
Aloysious is 34 years old married with 2 children living in Kasese Uganda. Aloysious owns a car washing bay and earns his side income from salary and farming. He started his business in 2013 which has seen him maintain all his businesses. 

He has a dream of buying land for the expansion of the car washing bay and taking good care of his family. He is requesting a loan to purchase more materials like the washing jets and soap for the success of his business.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like the washing jets and soap for the success of a car wash business.

loans.name: Anin

texts.ru: Анин, 58 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей и 2 дочерей. Анин жизнерадостная и ответственная женщина, в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается сельским хозяйством, стартовав в 1995 году. Благодаря упорному труду, на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 20 овец, 2 лошади. На 0,53 Га собственно и 1,0 Га арендованной земли она выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Анин обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для отгона на пастбище и откорма. Доходы от кредита Анин планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и планирует накопить на покупку автомобиля.
texts.en:
Anin is 58 and married with three sons and two daughters. She is a cheerful and responsible woman who works in farming as a source of income for her family, a business she started in 1995. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has three cows, 20 sheep and two horses on her farm as well as 0.53 hectares of her own and 1.0 hectares of rented land where she grows barley for sale. 

With the goal of further developing her business, Anin has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase a horse to fatten at pasture. She plans to put profits from the loan into further developing her business and plans to save toward buying a car.

loans.use: to buy a horse to fatten at pasture

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase two display cases for hygiene products

loans.name: Yrys

texts.ru: Ырыс, 21 год, замужем, детей нет. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Ырыс с 2012 года занимается животноводством. В хозяйстве Ырыс на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 10 овец. На 2,0 Га земли выращивает кукурузу и клубнику. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 24,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров для реализации экологически чистого молока. Доходы от кредита Ырыс планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en: Yrys is 21, married, and has no children. She has been earning the family's main income since 2012 by raising livestock. She currently has two cows and ten sheep. She grows corn and strawberries on a 2.0 hectare plot of land and earns around 24,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to develop her business, she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy dairy cows so that she can sell organic milk. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in the future expansion of her farm.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows and sell organic milk

location.town: On Besh Zhash village, Osh region

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is the age of 41 and is mother of a single child, living in Lahore, Pakistan Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. From the past many days his rickshaw is not working properly because of which he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw. 

Therefore,Rukhsana has requested for a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rukhsana is so much thankful to Kiva and Brac Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's rickshaw which needs repairs

loans.name: Victory Learning School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Kakande. He is the Deputy Head teacher of Victory learning Primary School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nyendo in Masaka with 1300 students. Victory learning Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 1000 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Victory learning Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Kakande ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy piglets and feed to make money to support his family

loans.name: Ma. Lisa

texts.en: Ma. Lisa is 50 years old. She lives in Badian, Cebu.  Ma. Lisa is married with a seventeen year old son. She sells fish for a living.  She started her business two years ago. Ma. Lisa is asking a loan of Php10000 to buy more fish that she can sell. With additional capital, she can sell from morning, afternoon and evening, thus increasing her profits. In the future, she hope to continue expanding her business for more success.

loans.use: to buy more fish for increased profits

loans.name: Wycliffee

texts.en:
Wycliffee is 33 years old, married to Mary and supports a family of 2 children. 

He has been operating in motorcycle transport for the last 4 years earning KES 8,000 per month. 

Wycliffee has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain. 

He plans to use the anticipated profits to educate his children and to expand his farming activities. 

His future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for more income gain.

loans.name: By His Grace Rubiri Group

texts.en:
By his grace Rubiri group is a new group located in Rubiri -nyamityobora, Mbarara district. It’s comprised of  women who have changed their homes through cooperation and have managed to improve their standard of living  via working together as a group and these people believe in praying to bless whatever they are doing. 

The group members have been in business for over 11 years and all of them are in retail business purposely to educate their children looking after their families economically.  They applied for a group loan from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd to boost their businesses.

Their prime target is to expand their shops and get enough money to cater for their families and get income to expand their business.  Also to place their children in better schools in the country. But they are limited by capital and funds to enable them achieve their dreams and compete with other people in the area who have similar business. Lukia will use her loan specifically to buy groceries for sale. This will increase her sales and profit.

loans.use: To buy groceries for sell to increase her profit for the benefit of her family

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to enable her get better harvest for family use and the surplus produce for sale in the market to clients.

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is 55 years old, married to John, and supports a family with five children. 

She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 17 years, earning KES 16,000 per month. 

Wilkister has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams include being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old, married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Jocelyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 28,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 25 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 42-years old married woman. Her financially condition is not good. Her son has been driving Moto Rickshaw (a type of three-wheeled rickshaw). This rickshaw is being drive over local roads and for small distances. Its body made by polyester which is not enough strong to bear jerks over roads. Now the rickshaw body needs to be replace because it has rattled during driving. This is the reason her son wants to buy a new body for Moto Rickshaw.

Shahida requested a loan of 50,000 PKR so that her son can buy the rickshaw body, so that he could drive it smoothly. Shahida thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw body for her son's transportation business

loans.name: Kalmira

texts.ru: Калмира, 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. У Калмиры среднее образование, на протяжении 15 лет занимается животноводством и пчеловодством. Первоначально скот выделил свекр, потом начали инвестировать сами. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 3 коровы, 10 овец, 50 ящиков пчелосемей. Благодаря упорному труду Калмиры, ее ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет 15,600 сом (KGS). Калмира решила развить ее бизнес и обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки телят. Доходы от кредита позволят Калмире улучшить благосостояние ее семьи.
texts.en: Kalmira is 44 years old, married, and is raising three children. Kamira has a secondary education. She has been rearing animals and keeping bees for 15 years. Her first livestock were given to her by her father in law, then she began to invest in it herself. Today she has three cows, ten sheep, and 50 beehives. Thanks to Kalmira's hard work, her gross monthly profit is 15,600 som (KGS). Kalmira has decided to develop her business and has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to increase the size of her herd by buying some calves. The proceeds of the loan will permit Kalmira to improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy some calves in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is a 41-year old married woman, mother of five children, and is living with her family in Lahore, Pakistan. Her son owns a general store in their hometown where he sells different kinds of products. Previously his father was running this shop but due to his old age he looks after other matters now.
Tahira's son purchases the inventory in large quantity from a nearby bakery and general store and sells it over at his store. Now he wants to offer different types of products to his customers but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy these additional products.
Therefore, Tahira requested a loan so that her son could buy his desired products to sell. He will make some savings with the profit amount and hopes in the future he will be able to nourish his business further.
Tahira thanks Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her son's general store.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta is 63 years old and married with eight children.

Crisanta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

Crisanta has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Crisanta aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Rahimakhon

texts.ru: Рахимахон 67 летняя жительница района Рудаки. Она счастливая бабушка двоих внуков. Рахимахон обожает проводить время вместе с внуками, но не забывает о своем бизнесе. Рахимахон вместе с мужем имеют не большой бизнес. Они занимаются пчеловодством. От продажи меда они зарабатывают на жизнь. Рахимахон хочет расширить бизнес и по этой причине обратилась за кредитом. Она планирует увеличить пчелиные ульи. Для этой операции нужны средства и она надеется, что ее поддержат. Спасибо
texts.en:
Rahimakhon is a 67 year old resident of the Rudaki area. She is a happy grandmother of two grandchildren. Rahimakhon loves to spend time with her grandchildren, but she does not neglect her own business. 

Rahimakhon has a small business with her husband. They are engaged in beekeeping. They earn a living by selling honey. 

Rahimakhon wants to expand her business and has applied for a loan for this reason. She plans to increase the number of beehives she has. She needs money for this, and she hopes that you will support her. Thank you.

loans.use: to increase the number of beehives.

loans.name: Josue David

texts.es: Josué tiene 23 años de edad y vive junto a su madre la cual ha sido su único apoyo y lo saco adelante sola. Josué se dedica a la fabricación y venta de muebles de sala el cual es su principal fuente de ingresos desde hace 5 años y lo que le ha permitido ayudar a su madre con los gastos del hogar. Josué es un joven emprendedor y  gracias a su gran experiencia y su buen trabajo de calidad es muy bien recomendado por sus vecinos y amigos por lo que cada día su negocio va creciendo y las exigencias de sus producto en el mercado son mayores, de manera que para cumplir la demanda de sus clientes y ofrecer más variedad de estilos de su producto  ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI, y con el monto solicitado poder comprar: telas, esponja, madera, tachuelas, clavos y barniz para mejorar aún más su negocio.
texts.en:
Josué is 23 years and lives with his mother who has been his only support and raised him by herself. Josué works making and selling living room furniture which has been his principal source of income for five years. It has allowed him to help his mother with the household expenses.

Josué is a young entrepreneur and thanks to his long experience and good quality work is well-known by his neighbors and friends. So his business grows daily and the demand for his product is greater. So in order to fill the demand from his clients and offer more variety of styles for his product he has decided to request a loan from FUSAI. With the amount requested he can buy fabric, sponge, wood, tacks, nails and varnish to further improve his business .

loans.use: to invest in fabric, sponge, wood, tacks, nails and varnish to improve his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed, sugar and rice

loans.name: Lucita

texts.en:
Lucita is 43 years old, married with two children.

Lucita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

Lucita has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetable and e-loading.

Lucita aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Lovella

texts.en:
Lovella is 60 years old and married, with five children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lovella is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Lovella has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from fruits vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccines and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana, age 32, is the mother of three children. Her husband owns an jewelry shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband needs to purchase a new variety of jewelry material to resell. However due to lack of money her husband finds it difficult. This will help him to offer more variety to his customers and to continue his work efficiently and professionally. For that his wife, Farzana is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of helping her husband.

Her husband will purchase new variety of jewelry materials. Farzana is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new materials to increase her husband's jewelry business

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Juliet is from Moalboal, Cebu. She is married with 2 children, aged 13 and 16. 

Juliet has been in the business of house rental for 5 years now, earning her PHP 15,000 per month. 

However, Juliet would like to renovate her house but she lacks funds. She is asking a loan to buy house materials like hard wood, nails, cement and steel.  Juliet knows that once she can make improvements, it will be more attractive to her future tenants. 

in the future she plans to build another house.

loans.use: to buy house materials like hard wood, nails, cement and steel

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fabric for making clothes to meet clients' demands and family needs.

loans.name: Dzidzai

texts.en:
Dzidzai is 39 years old and married with one child. She lives in the Chiredzi district of Zimbabwe, where she also volunteers in schools as a Camfed Learner Guide, teaching health and life skills education and offering guidance and counseling in local schools. 

Dzidzai supplies tomatoes, vegetables, potatoes and beans to her surrounding communities. She has already paid back her first $500 loan, which she used to expand her business. Dzidzai now wishes to take out a larger loan, to invest in her irrigation project to support the farm. She will use the profits she receives monthly to buy basic commodities for home consumption and to pay school fees for her child .

loans.use: To expand her irrigation project.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en:
Hussien is 46, married to a housewife, and has four children. One of his sons is married and lives with him in the same house. 

Hussien has a frozen meat sales shop and is requesting a 5000 EGP loan to prepare a small place in his shop to sell sandwiches and to buy frozen meat for sale. He wishes to increase his income to help his son with his marriage expenses and to guarantee better living conditions for his family.

loans.use: To prepare a small place in his shop to sell sandwiches and to buy frozen meat for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for top dressing her crops so as to get a better harvest for sale in the market and for family use.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his farming activity through purchase of certified seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anelen

texts.en:
Her name is Anelen, 44, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Married to Danilo, a pensioner. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to meet their daily personal and household needs.

Anelen operates a small variety store for four years already. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of 800 PHP a day.

To help Anelen continue operations of her general store business she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan which she will use to buy grocery items like rice, instant noodles, coffee, eggs, beverages, soap, and shampoo to sell at her store. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her since her store earnings are a great help in their daily sustenance.

Anelen dreams of building a bigger store. She prays for God to bless their lives abundantly. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for groceries, beverages and toiletries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase an egg incubator to enable her hatch more chicks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk in the area for more income earning.

loans.name: Noeme

texts.en:
Noeme is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living through her aquaculture business, farming oysters in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to buy bamboo, binders and other paraphernalia for her oyster culture.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Noeme dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, binders, and other paraphernalia.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, sand, brick, and metal sheets in order to build a sanitary bathroom that will allow her to guarantee better hygiene and health to her family.

loans.name: Rafaela

texts.en:
Rafaela is a 28-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, aged 4, 7, and 9. She has been engaged in a sari-sari (general) store business for ten years now.

Rafaela is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stock for her store such as canned goods, chips, cooking oil, sachet items for coffee, toothpaste, milk, bath soap, hair conditioner, eggs, noodles, and soy sauce. She believes that if she will be provided with financial support through the loan, she can finally purchase the necessary stock for her business.

In the future, Rafaela believes that through this opportunity she can improve and expand the range and scale of her business, which would eventually give her a larger amount of income. And, she hopes that she can continue to send her children to school so that they will be able to gain a higher level of learning for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, cooking oil, sachet items for coffee, toothpaste, milk, bath soap, hair conditioner, eggs, noodles, and soy sauce.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is a salesperson, a dairy and maize/corn farmer, who has access to many sellers in the food chain. To make a better income, Stella makes commissions on sales from helping arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. 16 years in the business has taught her to build strong relationships since success in this business depends on reputation.

Given that Stella can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. 

She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell them at a profit. 

Your loan will help Stella’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales. It will help her family to make a better income and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell them at a profit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To acquire a green house for his farming activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock of oranges and tomatoes to sell to clients in the market to meet client and family needs.

loans.name: Aigerim

texts.ru: Айгерим, 23 года, замужем, есть двухгодовалая дочь. Образование у Айгерим средне-специальное, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, после свадьбы начала заниматься животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду Айгерим, на данный момент в хозяйстве имеется корова, лошадь. На 2,0 Га земли она выращивает перец и клевер. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айгерим обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков. Доходы от кредита Айгерим планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Aigerim is 23 years old, married, and has a two-year-old daughter. Aigerim has a secondary vocational education. After her marriage she began rearing animals and growing crops for income for her family. Thanks to Aigerim's hard work, at the present time she has a cow and a horse. She grows peppers and clover on 2.0 hectares of land. Her monthly income is approximately 10,000 som (KGS). In order to develop her business further, Aigerim has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy three steers. Aigerim plans to invest the proceeds of the loan in expanding her business further.

loans.use: to buy three steers in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Rukhsana Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana is the age of 38; she is the mother of two. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. For the past many days his rickshaw has not been working properly, so he is unable to generate any amount of income. He wants to repair it as soon as possible. However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. 

Therefore,Rukshana has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband to cover the cost of repairing the rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rukhsana is so much thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to maintain her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seedlings for her farm

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more goods to stock in her kiosk and to pay for her daughter's schooling expenses.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.en:
Inocencia is 48 years old, married with one child.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Inocencia requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for three years.

In the future, Inocencia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ana Milagro

texts.es:
Ana, de 48 años de edad, está acompañada, su pareja es agricultor y también albañil, tiene 2 hijos y los dos trabajan.

Ana, tiene una venta de tortillas desde hace 10 años, aprendió a elaborarlas gracias a su mamá, también se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, todo lo hace desde su casa y con ella trabajan sus hijos. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar otra plancha, para aumentar su producción de tortillas.

Ella sueña con que su negocio crezca, para poder darles una mejor condición de vida a su familia e hijos.
texts.en:
Ana is 48 years old and lives with her partner.Her partner is a farmer and bricklayer, they have two children and both work.

Ana has been selling tortillas for 10 years. She learned to make tortillas from her mom. She also raises pigs, and all of her work she does from home and her children work with her. 

She needs the loan to buy another grill in order to increase her production of tortillas.

She dreams of growing her business so that she can improve the living conditions of her family and children.

loans.use: to buy another grill in order to increase her production of tortillas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal merchandise.

loans.name: Evelin Roxana

texts.es: Con 21 años de edad Evelin vive en vivienda muy humilde junto a su esposo. Ella presta sus servicios domésticos en un hotel de playa cercano desde hace 3 años. Evelin desea iniciar la construcción de su vivienda, ya que actualmente su vivienda está hecha de pedazos de madera, lámina y plástico, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, ladrillo y hierro para construir su vivienda y cumplir el sueño de tener casa propia.
texts.en: At 21 years of age Evelin lives in a very modest dwelling together with her husband. She has been working in housekeeping services in a nearby beach hotel for three years. Evelin wants to begin building her own house, since her actual dwelling is made of pieces of wood, sheet metal, and plastic. That's why she's asking for a FUSAI loan to invest in:  cement, sand, gravel, brick and iron to build a house and fulfill her dream of having her own home.

loans.use: To invest in: cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to construct her home.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 34 years old, married to James, and she supports three children. She has been practicing small-scale farming for the last eight years, earning KES 10,000 per month.

Grace has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya, to buy a wheelbarrow and farm tools for use on the farm, for high production and supply and for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy land for rental construction. Her future hope and dream is to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow and farm tools for use on the farm.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
After such a positive experience with her first Kiva loan and successful repayment, Nancy has decided to submit a request for her second loan to help expand and strengthen her business by entering her products into the New York Gift Show in August. 

Nancy is now taking advantage of every opportunity she has to develop her leadership skills and lead the Sasa Designs by the Deaf team to the next level of production and operations. Nancy and her team have been invited to sell their products at the New York Gift Show in August. This loan will allow her to pay for the booth fees and to prepare enough products to qualify and sell at the show. The show will be a huge opportunity for Sasa Designs for the Deaf to showcase their products and story. 

As Sasa Designs by the Deaf’s lead artisan, Nancy oversees the artisan team, ensuring production is planned out, organized and always to the top level of quality. Having lost her hearing at the age of 8, Nancy had to work extremely hard to make her way as a Deaf woman in a hearing world. She’s now a strong example and mentor to the artisan team and younger deaf women who see Nancy’s success as an inspiration.

loans.use: Fund booth fees for the New York Now Global Handmade Pavilion, sales materials, and production costs for samples and the first round of sales from the show.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers in the food chain. To make a better income, Juliana makes commission on sales from helping arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. The key lessons she has taken away from being in the business are building strong relationships and guarding your reputation.

Given that Juliana can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit.

Your loan will help Juliana’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales, as it will help her family to make better income and uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereal merchandise.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира, 45 лет, замужем, 5 детей. У нее высшее образование, с 1990 года занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, 10 овец, 3 лошади, а также 1,0 ГА арендованной и 0,25 ГА собственной поливной земли, где Гульмира выращивает ячмень. Она известна, как жизнерадостный, честный, трудолюбивый человек. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку овец для откорма на пастбище и реализации. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена накопить на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 45 years old, married, and has five children. She has a higher education, and has been engaged in farming since 1990. 

On her farm, she has two cows, ten sheep and three horses. Gulmira also has 1 hectare of rented land and 0.25 hectares of her own irrigated land, on which she cultivates barley. She is known as a cheerful, honest and hardworking person. 

In order to further develop her farm, Gulmira has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS), which will go into buying sheep for fattening in the pasture, and then reselling. 

Gulmira plans to use the funds from the loan for the development of her farm, and also intends to save up for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy additional sheep for fattening in the pasture and reselling.

loans.name: Oscar Mauricio

texts.es:
Oscar, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, su esposa trabaja junto a él vendiendo pan, tiene dos hijos, pero una ya está acompañada, mientras el otro estudia noveno grado. 

Oscar, tiene más de 20 años de dedicarse al comercio de ganado, al destazo, a la venta de tostadas y totopostes.

Oscar, necesita el crédito para comprar y vender ganado.

En el futuro, desea dejar un capital de trabajo para sus hijos y una casa propia para que no tengan que alquilar.
texts.en:
Oscar, forty-five ears old, attended school until the ninth grade. He is married, his wife works alongside him selling bread. He has two children, but one is already married, while the other is in the ninth grade at school. 

For over twenty years Oscar has worked in the livestock business, butchery, selling tostadas and cornbread. 

Oscar needs a loan for buying and selling livestock. 

In the future, he would like to leave the business to his children, and have his own house so they don't have to rent.

loans.use: to buy and sell livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy products for her store like soap, detergent, rice, beans, bread and coffee.

loans.name: Luís Eduvige

texts.es:
Luis, de 30 años de edad, está soltero, vive con su mamá y su papá.

Luis, es empleado, tiene 4 años de trabajar en una empresa distribuidora de gas, pero también se dedica a criar ganado, lo aprendió por medio de su papá, quien desde pequeño le inculco este negocio. 

El crédito lo necesita para comprar dos novillas para criarlos, engordarlos y luego venderlos.

El sueño de Luis, es que sus novillos se desarrollen en buen estado, para obtener buenas ganancias y darle una mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, thirty years old, is single and lives with his mother and father. 

Luis is employed, for four years he has worked for a gas distributor. But he also raises livestock, a trade he learned from his father, who involved him in the business ever since he was little. 

He needs a loan to buy two heifers to raise, fatten and then sell. 

Luis' dream is that his heifers develop well, so he can improve his earnings and give his family a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy two heifers to raise, fatten and then sell.

loans.name: Kirk John

texts.en: Kirk John is an 18-year old college undergraduate who lives in Hinigaran. He belongs to a family of four. His father is deceased and his mother has a dried goods business. Kirk John is the youngest in his family. His eldest brother has already graduated from college but has no work. The family's total monthly income of PHP 8,000 ($180) is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. Kirk John needs to find means to help the family have more income. That's why he joined Bagosphere's 2-month training program. Kirk John wants to have a stable job in a BPO company and become a successful businessman. Your generosity will help Kirk John have a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition for a 2-month call center training program that can get him a job paying about $270 monthly

loans.name: Gloria Concepción

texts.es:
Gloria, de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está casada y su esposo es agricultor, tienen 1 hijo que vive con ellos y que también se dedica a la agricultura, además de ellos también vive su madre y una sobrina en su casa.

Gloria, desde su niñez se ha dedicado a la agricultura, a ella le enseño su familia ya que se han dedicado a la siembra de maíz, frijol y hortalizas, actualmente tiene sembrados 14,000 metros cuadrados de frijol y 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, a una distancia de 20 minutos y le ayuda su hijo en todas las labores agrícolas. 

Gloria, necesita del préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: abono, pesticidas y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, todo para que sus cultivos se desarrollen y produzcan una buena cosecha. 

El sueño de Gloria, es seguir trabajando en la agricultura y tener buenas ganancias para pagar el préstamo.
texts.en:
Gloria, 57 years old, studied until the third grade. She is married and her husband is a farmer. They have 1 child who lives with them and who also makes a living from agriculture. Her mother and a niece also live with them in their home.

Since her childhood, Gloria has made a living from agriculture. Her family taught it to her since they have made a living from sowing corn, beans, and vegetables. Currently, she has cultivated 14,000 square meters of beans and 7,000 square meters of corn at a distance of 20 minutes from her home. Her son helps her in all of her agricultural work.

Gloria needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies, such as: compost, pesticides, and fertilizers for her crops, all so that her crops grow and produce a good harvest.

Gloria’s dream is to continue working in agriculture and have good profits to pay back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, such as: compost, pesticides, and fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Allen Troy

texts.en: Allen Troy is a 20-year-old college student who lives in Pulupandan. He is part of a family of six, and father works in construction while his mother is a housewife. Allen is the oldest child; two of his siblings are in high school while the youngest is in elementary school. The family’s total monthly income is only Php 6,000 ($135), which is why Allen needs to find way to  increase the family’s income. He wants to do this by improving his communication skills so he can become a successful call center agent with a high salary. This loan will help him pay for his tuition and secure a better life.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Mirundia

texts.en: Mirundia is 27 years old, married and the mother of three children. She has been a farmer for the last two years and earns KES 10,000 per month. Mirundia has applied for her first loan from Vision Fund Kenya, for KES 25,000, to buy fertilizers for her crops so she can get a better harvest for family to use and to sell in the local market. She plans to use the profits she earns to repay her loan and educate her children. Her goals for the future are to be financially stable and expand her farm.

loans.use: to improve her crop by buying fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in beverages such as soda water, beer, and fruit to prepare fresh juices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock since he has a pasture and with the livestock he will be able to use it.

loans.name: John Christopher

texts.en: John Christopher is an 18-year-old college student who lives in Bacolod City. He is married and the father of a 5-month old child. The family’s total monthly income is only PHP 7,000 ($157). John Christopher has long seen the need to help his family by earning more money, but didn’t have the means to do this until he learned about Bagosphere’s two-month training program that could lead to a call center job. Now that he has passed Bagosphere’s selection process, he needs help to finance his tuition. When he starts earning a higher income, he can better provide for his family and save some money for his child’s education.

loans.use: to pay his tuition.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 39 years old, married to Kennedy, and supports three children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last six years, earning KES 8,000 per month.

Josephine has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow, so as to supply more milk for more income gain. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to buy land for rental construction.

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Kaliyman

texts.ru: Калийман успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав его по назначению. Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог Калийман в финансировании. У нее в хозяйстве есть 8 коров, 2 лошади, а также 1,30 ГА поливной земли, где Калийман выращивает картофель, кукурузу и клевер. Калийман известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме около 18,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока, скота и овощей. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калийман вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS), который направит на покупку кобыл. Доходы от кредита Калийман планирует использовать на постройку дома с сараем и садом.
texts.en:
Kaliyman has successfully paid off her loan, having used it as intended. She is thankful to Kiva and everyone who responded and helped her with the financing. 

On her farm, Kaliyman has eight cows, two horses, and 1.3 hectares of irrigated land, where she cultivates potatoes, corn and clover. Kaliyman is known as a principled, honest, respectable, and reliable person. Today her business brings in a monthly profit of about 18,000 som (KGS) from the sales of milk, cattle, and vegetables. 

In order to further develop her farm, Kaliyman has again applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 65,000 som (KGS), which will go to buying mares. Kaliyman plans to use the funds from the loan to build a house with a barn and a garden.

loans.use: to buy mares in order to increase her livestock headcount.

loans.name: Pearly

texts.en: Pearlyn is 34 years old, married and the mother of a child who is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her livestock. Pearlyn has been in this line of work for three years, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF. In the future, she would like to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is a 27-year-old vocational graduate who lives in Bacolod City. She is married to a construction worker and the mother of four children aged 10, 7, 5 and 3. Two of her children are in elementary school. The family's total monthly income is only PHP 5,000 ($112). Geraldine has long seen the need to help her husband support their family, but lacked the means until she learned about the two-month training program at Bagosphere that could lead to a call center job. Now that she has passed Bagosphere's selection process, she needs help to finance her tuition. Once Geraldine starts earning, she can help provide for her family's basic needs and save some money for her children's education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition.

loans.name: Freddy Junior

texts.es: Freddy de 21 años es un joven que ofrece servicios de mantenimiento y reparación de electrodomésticos, día a día identifica cuales son las causales de las fallas que están presentando neveras y lavadoras, sin embargo esta no es la única actividad a la que se dedica, él comercializa pasteles (comida típica elaborada a base de arroz, carne de cerdo y pollo, vegetales y aderezos, envueltos en una hoja bijao)  a sus vecinos y conocidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un Credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo para invertir en compra de repuestos para atender oportunamente los servicios y víveres para la elaboración de los pasteles de arroz.  Su meta a futuro es crear una empresa constituida legalmente y tener una estabilidad financiera para continuar apoyando económicamente a su familia.
texts.en:
Freddy, 21 years old, is a youth who offers electrical appliance maintenance and repair services. Day to day, he identifies what are the reasons for the breakdown of refrigerators and washers. Nevertheless, this is not the only activity from which he makes a living. He also sells pasteles (traditional food created from a base of rice, pork and chicken, vegetables, and seasoning, wrapped in a bijao leaf) to his neighbors and acquaintances. 

Currently, he is applying for a Kiva loan, the first financing he is requesting from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to invest in the purchase of spare parts to provide repair services in a timely manner and of supplies to produce the rice cakes. His goal for the future is to start a legally formed business and to have financial stability to continue to economically support his family.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of spare parts to provide repair services in a timely manner and of supplies to produce the rice cakes.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su conyugue trabaja en la agricultura, tiene 4 hijos pero solo dos asisten a la escuela, ya que los otros aun no tienen la edad para estudiar. 

María, se dedica a los oficios domésticos  y a cuidar sus niños, pero también ayuda a su compañero de vida en los trabajos agrícolas cuando es necesario. 

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar herbicidas y fertilizantes para sembrar maíz y frijol, considera que con este crédito lograra cubrir esa necesidad. 

Ella sueña con que sus hijos crezcan, estudien y se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
María, 30 years old, studied until the seventh grade. She is in a relationship and her spouse works in agriculture. She has 4 children but only two attend school since the others have not yet reached the age for school.

María is dedicated to domestic work and caring for her children, but she also helps her life partner in his agricultural work when it is necessary.

She needs the loan to purchase herbicides and fertilizers to sow corn and beans. She considers that with this loan she will be able to cover that necessity.

She dreams that her children grow, study, and prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase herbicides and fertilizers to sow corn and beans.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en:
Shahida is a 51 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has three sons and her children are doing studies. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for seven years. He is the only one responsible for feeding the entire family and manages the house hold. Shahida's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these clothes.
Therefore, Shahida is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband will also increase the size of his business and earn a maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Shahida is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to assist her husband to increase his clothes business.

loans.name: San

texts.en:
San is 59 years old, married with five adult children, and lives in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Her husband is 61 years old. Since 2000, San and her husband have grown rice and they can earn $2 a day. One of her five children is in school, two are working as factory workers, and one works in construction, making a daily income of $5 each.

San would like to request a loan to buy a plot of land. That’s why she has decided to take out a loan. With the loan, she will have enough money to buy the land. In the future, she is going to build a kitchen and support the child earning a high school diploma.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: St Moise Group

texts.fr: Pascaline Fati est la responsable de ce groupe qui regroupe des femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Pascaline Fati est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Cette brave dame fait la coiffure et cela fait 20 ans. Pour faire avancer son activité, elle a besoin d'un prêt avec lequel elle pourra acheter des mèches, du gèle pour son salon. En plus de cela, elle fait le commerce de pagnes. Le professionnalisme,l'accueil et le respect des rendez-vous font la force de Pascaline Fati. Après la ventes de ses différents produits et son service rendu en coiffant ses clients, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de d'aider à faire les dépenses de sa maison mais aussi de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Pascaline Fati is the official of this group composed of determined women, who all work in commerce. She is a married mother of three. This good and honest woman has been a hairstylists for twenty years. To advance her work, she has need of a loan, by which she will be able to purchase hair extensions and gels for her salon. In addition to this, she does commerce in 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa).  Pascaline Fati’s business strengths come from her professionalism, accommodating approach, and respecting of appointments. After making sales of her different products and rendering hairstyling services for her customers, she will have a profit allowing her to help cover household expenses and also to continue her work.

loans.use: to purchase hair extensions and gels for her hair salon and also 'pagne' cloth to sell

loans.name: Leonel Rofino

texts.es: Leonel es un hombre de 49 años que esta casado con la dulce Feliciana, viven en la localidad rural de Cabanaconde que esta ubicado en Arequipa. Ambos se dedican a la agricultura desde ya hace mucho tiempo, sobre todo a la agricultura orgánica. Ellos desean ofrecer a sus clientes un cultivo natural libre de químicos. Actualmente tiene sembrado habas en su terreno agrícola, pero necesitan el préstamo para poder darle mantenimiento a dicho cultivo, parte del dinero lo usaran para poder comprar fertilizantes orgánicos naturales que están a un precio mas elevado que el convencional. En el futuro Leonel espera poder darle a su esposa estabilidad económica y lograr mejorar su casa para que vivan cómodamente.
texts.en:
Leonel is a man of 49 years who is married to his sweet wife Feliciana. They live in the rural town of Cabanaconde, which is located in Arequipa. They both have worked in agriculture for a long time, especially in organic farming. They want to offer their clients natural crops, free from chemicals. They are currently cultivating fava beans on their farmland. They need the loan to maintain their crop. They will use part of the money to buy natural, organic fertilizers, which are more expensive than conventional fertilizers. 

Leonel hopes to give his wife economic stability and better earnings to live comfortably in the future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizers for his fava beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bricks to construct a better house

loans.name: Angelitas 1 Group

texts.en:
Elvira remembers that before she was 10 years old, her family had great limitations. They were 7 siblings, 5 girls and 2 boys, and they did not had enough food, clothes, nor shoes. She married at the age of 16 years, her husband worked at Guatemala City, 250 km away and 8 hours in bus from Chajul. They could be together only one weekend a month. She had only a child and considered that they were in good economic shape.

Now Elvira is 28, and she receives this year her fourth loan. The first one allowed her and her husband to initiate her own store of articles of prime necessity, but also let her husband come back to Chajul and work together in their business. This fourth loan will let them to expand the store. Their store will let them have a better life.
Now she has 4 children, the first one is in 4th grade, the second is 3 months old.

Elvira is the leader of Angelitas Group 1 (Little Angels). The group has 7 women, and the average age is 31 years, and they have in average 4 children. The average amount of the group loan is Q 3,714.29. Six women will invest their loan in expanding their stores and one in cardamom farming.

loans.use: to expand her store buying more, beans, corn, vegetables, fruit, bread, dairy products and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy the materials to build a new toilet, improving the health of her home and community

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, bread, sweets, beans, salt, corn, coffee, eggs, vegetables and other items to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa has a two-acre farm in Munyaka village, in Central Kenya. She, her husband, and their three children live in the house she is pictured in. 

Outside, on the farm, they have 14 heifers, five sheep, five heads of poultry and a three-acre, cash crop garden that support their living. She sells her farm produce at a local market, near her home. She started farming ten years ago and, through the years, she has had no difficulty in satisfying her customers’ needs. 

The biggest growth constraint for Teresa is lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. 

Teresa is seeking a loan to buy improved seeds, fertilizer, and other important inputs that control weeds and pests.  With your lending, Teresa will be able to access credit from a credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and her family's income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para invertir en: cemento, arena, laminas para el techo, polines, ventanas, puertas.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: repair the leaky roof of her home and prevent illnesses

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 54 years old and married with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a cafeteria business in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy coffee, sugar and utensils for her cafeteria business.

Gloria has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coffee, sugar and utensils for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 44 years old, married and has two children.

Julieta is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Julieta has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gulgooky

texts.ru: Гулгоокы, 28 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Образование среднее, на протяжении многих лет занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав бизнес с суммы 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гулгоокы в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 15 овец. На 0,91 Га арендованной и 0,13 Га собственно земли она выращивает кукурузу, лук, перец, помидоры для реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 4,600 сом (KGS). Гулгоокы обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений и семян для выращивания экологически чистых овощей. На полученные доходы от кредита Гулгоокы планирует и дальше увеличивать свой бизнес, она хочет построить сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Gulgooky is 28 years old, married, and has 3 children. She has a secondary education. Over the past many years, she has been raising animals and growing crops, having begun her business with a sum of 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulgooky's hard work, she now has 2 cows and 15 sheep on her farm. On 0.91 hectares of rented land and 0.13 hectares of her own land, she raises corn, onions, peppers, and tomatoes for resale. Her monthly profit is 4,600 som (KGS). 

Gulgooky has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 25,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizer and seeds to grow organic vegetables. With the profits she gets from her loan, Gulgooky plans to continue expanding her business, and she wants to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for growing organic vegetables.

loans.name: Hilda Faviola

texts.es:
Hilda es una señora de 56 años, vive junto a su hija y su nieta en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados.
Hilda ha trabajado con la institución hace varios años, comenzó con montos pequeños en grupo, ya luego trabajó de manera individual. Comenta que gracias a los microcréditos ella ha podido mejorar mucho su domicilio, incluso actualmente arrienda un pequeño departamento.
Hilda cuenta con un taller de costura muchos años, es una modista reconocida en su barrio, tiene mucho trabajo, por ello cuenta con una joven que casualmente le va a ayudar en los acabados de sus prendas. Hilda ha ido creciendo poco a poco, cuenta con varias máquinas de coser.
Es una señora muy agradecida con la institución, este crédito lo va a invertir en la ampliación de un cuarto para adecuarlo bien y luego arrendarlo y poder generar más ingresos en su hogar; seguir apoyando a su hija y a su nieta.
texts.en:
Hilda is a 56 year old lady who lives with her daughter and granddaughter in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados.

She has been working with the institution for several years now, at first borrowing small amounts as part of a group, and now works independently. She says that thanks to the microloans she has been able to greatly improve her home, and is currently even renting out a small part of it.

Hilda has had a sewing workshop for several years, and she is a recognized dressmaker in her area. She has a lot of work, but she has a young woman who informally helps her out with the finishing touches to her garments. She has been slowly expanding, and has several sewing machines.

She is very grateful to the institution, this loan will be used to extend a bedroom to adapt it so that she can then rent it out and generate more income, to continue supporting her daughter and granddaughter.

loans.use: to adapt a bedroom within her business, which will increase her income and could improve quality of life, as well as that of her daughter and granddaughter.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Mavlyudahan

texts.ru: Мавлюдахан, 57 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. На протяжении 5 лет, она занимается торговлей продуктами питания в магазине около дома. На сегодняшний день у Мавлюдахан есть товар в обороте на сумму 76,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от бизнеса составляют около 16,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Мавлюдахан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку продуктов питания для увеличения оборотных средств. Доходы от кредита Мавлюдахан планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, она мечтает открыть свой цветочный магазин.
texts.en:
Mavlyudahan is 57 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. Over the last 5 years, she has sold drinks from a storefront near her house. Currently, Mavlyudahan has goods in stock worth 76,000 som (KGS). The profits from her business are about 16,000 som (KGS) per month. 

In order to further develop her business, Mavlyudahan has applied to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy drinks to increase her assets. Mavlyudahan plans to use the profits from her loan to develop her business. She dreams of opening her own florist shop.

loans.use: to buy drinks for retail sale in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow for more milk to gain more income.

loans.name: Vilmarie

texts.en: Vilmarie is 34 years old and lives in Badian, Cebu.  She is married with six children, ages1 to 16. Vilmarie has been buying and selling hogs, chicken and goats for a living. She serves as a middleman, buying these farm animals for people in the city. She is asking for a loan of PHP 12,000 to buy and sell more goats, chickens and hogs. Vilmarie plans to continue her business, make it grow in the future and make it more self-sustaining for her family.

loans.use: to buy more goats, chickens and hogs

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a dairy farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers in the food chain. To increase her income, Gladys makes a commission on sales by helping to arrange the logistics of getting farm products from local farmers to their buyers. Over the three years that she has been in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships with the people she interacts with.
Given that Gladys can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of farm products. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more products from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 
Your loan will help Gladys’ clients to focus on production, rather than sales, as it will help her family to increase their income and uplift their living standards.

loans.use: to buy more farm products from local farmers

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 45 years old, married and has four children to support. To earn a living, she is engaged in a food vending business. She always dreams of a better life for her family, so she must increase her income to achieve this. To make this happen, she decided to borrow a loan to buy additional ingredients for her new menu and be able to sell more food,, which will generate more income.

Judith's plan for the future is to expand her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients for her new menu

loans.name: Lordan

texts.en:
Lordan is 39 years old, married and has three children. He is engaged in a transport business to earn a living. He wants to increase his family income through his transport business so he decided to take out a loan to buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance. That will enable him to serve his passengers better and generate more income.

Lordan's plan for the future is to buy a new motorcycle to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy motor parts for motorcycle maintenance.

loans.name: Uulkan

texts.ru: Уулкан, 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. У Уулкан- среднее образование, вместе с мужем она занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Уулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход составляет 19,000 сом (KGS), также обрабатывает 1,12 ГА земли, где в основном выращивает ячмень. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уулкан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец для откорма на пастбище и реализации. Доходы от кредита Уулкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en:
Uulkan is 52 years old and married. She and her husband have raised 3 children together. Uulkan has a secondary education, and she and her husband raise animals and grow crops. They started their farm 30 years ago with the purchase of livestock for 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Uulkan's hard work, her farm now has 3 cows and 2 horses. Her monthly profit is 19,000 som (KGS), and she also works 1.12 hectares of land, where she typically grows barley. 

In order to further expand her business, Uulkan has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep to fatten in the pasture and resell. Uulkan plans to use the profits from her loan to continue increasing their number of livestock, and wants to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy some sheep to fatten in the pasture and resell.

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en:
Isaiah is 28 years old, married to Lydia and supports two children. 

He has been selling maize grains for the last year and the business earns him KES 11,000 per month. 

He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase maize cereal to sell to clients in the market. The extra income will meet both family and client needs.

He plans to use gained profits to repay the loan and educate his children. 

His hope is to be financially stable and expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase maize cereal to sell to clients in the market and meet both family and client needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for spare parts and for maintenance on the tricycle units (motorcycle and sidecar) used in his transportation business.

loans.name: Zachaeus

texts.en:
Zachaeus is 30 years old, married to Teresa, and he supports four children. He has been offering motorcycle transport services to clients for the last two years, and the business earns him KES 10,000 per month.
 
He has applied for his first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as wind screens and rubber tubes for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle so as to enable him to provide better and faster transportation services. 

He plans to use his anticipated profits to repay the loan and educate his children. His hope is to be financially stable and to purchase more motorcycles to offer transportation services to clients.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts such as wind screens and rubber tubes for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 56 years old, is married to Samwel, and supports a family of eight children. 

She has been operating her cafe for the last 25 years, earning KES 7,000 per month. 

Anne has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy materials for renovating her cafe so as to attract more clients for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. Her future hopes and dreams include being financially stable.

loans.use: to buy materials for renovating her cafe so as to attract more clients for more income gain.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
