Letecia is grateful that she was granted a 40,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for fertilizer and farm supplies needed on her farm. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs.

She would like to apply for another PHP 50,000 loan, which she will use to buy more materials and supplies such as fertilizer for a more productive harvest on her pineapple farm. She is encouraged and happy with the healthy produce of her pineapples. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her, for her earnings are a big help to cover their daily sustenance.

Letecia dreams for her farm to grow and flourish, and she continues to pray for a healthy and abundant life. She faithfully meets up with her fellowship group* to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups, composed of 15 to 30 community partners each, that gather weekly to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials like wire and baskets and supplies such as seeds and fertilizers to be used in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build a hallway in her home as soon as possible before winter

loans.name: Vanessa Carolina

texts.es: Vanessa de 24 años de edad vive en casa de sus padres junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos pequeños hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad, por lo cual se esfuerzan mucho para llevar el sustento al hogar ya que ella es una mujer muy trabajadora. Vanessa se dedica a la venta de atoles como arroz en leche, atol de maíz y otros por lo que tiene experiencia desde hace 2 años, Vanessa quiere construir su vivienda propia ya que vive con sus padres, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: arena, ladrillos, cemento, grava, laminas, madera y clavos para construir su vivienda, por lo que se sentirá feliz al ver su vivienda terminada.
texts.en:
Vanessa, age 24, lives in her parents' home with her partner and their two children, ages 8 and 3 years. She constantly strives to provide for the household and she's a very hard-working woman. 

Vanessa's main work is selling corn-based drinks, called atoles, like basic atol and rice in milk and more. She has two years of experience at this work. Vanessa wants to build her own home, since she's currently living with her parents. She is requesting this loan from FUSAI to invest in sand, bricks, cement, gravel, metal sheeting, wood, and nails. She will be very happy to see her home built at last.

loans.use: build her own home and move her family out of her parents' house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more various kiosk stocks such as: detergent, soap, shampoo and snacks

loans.name: Mirsavli

texts.en:
Mirsavli is 56 years old and married and is a father of 3 sons and 2 daughters. His wife doesn’t work. He is IDP(internally displaced person)and lives with family in Bilasuvar region. He is a skilled, respected, honest also responsible and professional person.

Mirsavli is a dairy farmer. He started keeping dairy cows 34 years ago. Ever since then, he has developed and grown his business steadily to a point where he is able to get more then 12 litres of milk every day that he sells to his society. 

Thanks to his hard work, he has been able to improve and expand his merchandise.The profits from this business have allowed him to expand his sales volume. Mirsavli has already borrowed loans from Agroinvest in the past. Now he needs money and wants to buy food for his cows. 

He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy food for his cows, which he has been keeping for 34 years

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 49 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rosalinda has a general store business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned good, noodles, soft-drinks and other groceries.

Rosalinda has been in this business for twenty years. In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned good, noodles, soft-drinks and other groceries.

loans.name: Kacungiro United Women Group

texts.en:
Mary is a female married with five children four of them attending school and a member of Kacungiro united women group in Kasese Uganda. Mary sells cassava flour and has been in business since 2012. She gets additional income from rental houses and fish mongering. 

She dreams of expanding her business into new markets however faced with the challenge of market competition which leads to price fluctuations. Mary is a hard working woman requesting for a loan to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour for selling.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 54 years old, married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Susana has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Susana requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell.

Susana has been in this business for five years. In the future, Susana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more sea foods to sell.

loans.name: Evy Lizth

texts.es: Evy es una mujer de 40 años y goza de la compañía de su adorada familia, vive junto a sus 3 hijos y su esposo en la localidad rural de Huaynacotas, ubicado en Arequipa. Se dedica a la agricultura junto con su esposo, pero ella ademas se dedica a la cría de animales de granja. Ella solicita el crédito para poder comprar forraje a su ganado vacuno, ella siempre elige lo orgánico dado que siempre quiere darle lo mejor a su familia y sus clientes. En el futuro espera poder mejorar su casa para que sus hijos vivan mejor y sobre todo darles una buena educación para que sean personas con muchos valores.
texts.en:
Evy is a 40-year-old woman who enjoys the company of her beloved family. She lives with her 3 children and her husband in the rural town of Huaynacotas, which is located in Arequipa. She and her husband make a living working in agriculture. In addition, she raises farm animals. 

She is requesting a loan to buy organic feed for her cattle. She always chooses organic because she always wants to give the best to her family and to her customers. In the future, she hopes to be able to improve her home so that her children can live better and, above all, to give her children a good education so that they can become adults with great values.

loans.use: to buy organic feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Maurecia

texts.en:
Maurecia is 60 years old. She is a single woman who support herself with the income that she generated from renting out her houses. This has been her business for ten years now. 

She is asking a loan to buy materials so she can renovate her house. She will use her loan to buy hard wood, steel, cement and nails.  Maurecia plans to save so she can afford to build more houses to rent in the future.

loans.use: to buy hard wood, steel, cement and nails for house renovation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use on the farm for high production and supply to gain more income.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and married with one child.

Emma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

Emma has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from house rental.

Emma aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell for her general store business. Maria Victoria successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. NWTF is presenting Maria Victoria's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelita is 43 years old and has five children who are in school.

Angelita has a buy and sell banana business in the Philippines. Angelita requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of banana to sell.

Angelita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Angelita would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Wendy Johana

texts.es: Wendy de 19 años, posee una amplia experiencia como comerciante, comenzó cuando tenía 16 años bajo la dirección de su madre, hoy día comercializa prendas de vestir, calzado, cosméticos y detalles para toda ocasión principalmente a sus familiares, vecinos y compañeros de estudio. Como es muy exigente con sus compras las realiza en países vecinos como Panamá y Venezuela, también en Maicao ubicado en la Guajira y en almacenes de Barranquilla, ella tiene en cuenta las características de los productos en cuanto a calidad y precio que le garanticen  buenas utilidades, manteniendo la satisfacción del cliente. Ella es una joven apasionada por el negocio actividad que combina con sus estudios en cosmetología y estética, profesión que considera le ayudará en la comercialización de productos cosméticos además de que a futuro puede ofrecer nuevos servicios a su clientela. Wendy está aplicando para su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de acceder a los recursos que requiere para invertir en ropa, calzado y artículos para el hogar que demandan sus clientes y que le garantizará un incremento progresivo  en sus ventas y sus utilidades y a la consolidación de su actividad como emprendedora por la cual está dispuesta a luchar incansablemente.
texts.en:
At just 19 years old, Wendy already has a lot of experience in sales. She began under the direction of her mother when she was 16 years old, and today she sells clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and accessories for all occasions, mostly to her family, neighbors, and classmates. She is very demanding about her purchases, shopping in neighboring countries like Panama and Venezuela, as well as in Maicao, part of Guajira and in shopping malls in Barranquilla. She keeps in mind every detail about the products, like their quality and price, to make sure they can be used well, thus earning her customers' satisfaction.

Wendy is passionate about her work, which she combines with her studies in cosmetology and esthetics. She believes that that profession will help her in her sales of cosmetics and also allow her to offer new services to her clientele one day in the future. 

Wendy is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with the goal of gaining the resources she needs to invest in the clothing, shoes, and home goods that her customers demand. This will guarantee her progressive increases in her sales and profits and drive her business forward. She is a true entrepreneur and is ready to fight tirelessly in her work.

loans.use: buy clothing, shoes, and accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Şükran

texts.en:
Şükran is married and a mother of two. At home she knits, embroiders contours of scarves, sells them, and makes money. With her first loan she bought thread and scarves, made her products and made money. With the help of her second loan she is planning to do the same and expand her business.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Şükran hanım evli iki çocuk annesi.  Evde örgü örüyor, yazma oyalıyor ve yaptığı işleri satıyor para kazanıyor.  Kullandığı birinci mikro kredi ile örgü ipi ve yazma aldı üretip satarak para kazandı.  İkinci alacağı mikro kredi ile örgü ipi ve yazma alarak üreterek satarak işlerini geliştirmeyi planlıyor.

loans.use: to buy thread and scarves

loans.name: Dorren

texts.en:
Dorren lives in the Chiredzi District of Zimbabwe. She is 27 years old and married with one child. She is actively involved in Camfed’s Mother Support Groups which assists orphans and vulnerable children in the community. With the $500 she got from Kiva, Dorren purchased goods such as shirts, t-shirts, bags, solar panels, trousers, skirts, baby clothes, and blankets to the community. 

Using the second loan she intends to further expand her business into gardening and then she will open her own store for selling her farm products and clothes. Using the profits from her business Doreen hopes to pay for education for her child as well as meeting her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: To expand her gardening and purchase farm inputs like seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruba

texts.en:
Ruba is a 22-years-old single lady from Qalqilia city. Ruba is a student in the university where she studies social science.  Ruba took a USD loan from FATEN. 

This loan will help her to pay the university installments for the coming semester. By taking this loan, Ruba will be able to pay part of the urgent expenses she has. 
Ruba appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay her university fees in social science for the coming semester.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en: Narcisa is 58 years old from Moalboal, Cebu. She is engaged in selling fried fish balls in her place. Fried fish balls are always a favorite of students because of their good taste and affordability. Narcisa is asking for a loan of PHP 14,000 to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, vegetables, seasoning, and kitchen utensils. Narcisa is determined to make her business successful so that she can buy a multicab (a kind of custom-made vehicle that can accommodate up to 20 passengers) in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, vegetables,  seasoning, and kitchen utensils

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to acquire spare parts to repair and maintain his motorbike

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 54 years old and married with three children.

She runs an agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Nelly is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Nelly has been in this business for four years and earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers in the food chain. To make better income, Rose makes commission on sales from helping arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the years in business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships because success in this business depends on reputation.

Given that Rose can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit.

Your loan will help Rose’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales, and it will help her family to make better income and uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereal merchandise.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a mother, a dairy farmer, and salesperson who has access to many sellers in the food chain. To earn a better income, Emily earns a commission on sales from helping to arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. Over the years of being in the business, she has made an effort to build strong relationships with other value chain actors.

Given that Emily can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. Your loan will help Emily’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales, and it will help her family to earn better incomes and uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stock of maize cereals to mill and sell to clients as maize flour and meet their demands.

loans.name: Perihan

texts.en:
Perihan is divorced and living with her three children.  She is making crochet items at home and selling them on the stands. With the help of the loan she bought wool, cotton and fabrics for her products and therefore to made money and expanded her business.  With the help of her fourth loan she is planning to buy more wool, cotton and fabrics.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff
Perihan hanım üç çocuk annesi eşinden ayrı.  Aile ekonomisine katkı sağlayabilmek için evde stantlarda yaptığı ve ürettiği çeyiz işlerini satıyor.  Kullandığı mikro kredi ile çeyiz malzemesi ip kumaş alarak ve üreterek satarak para kazandı ve işlerini geliştirdi.  Dördüncü mikro kredi ile de kumaş ve ip alacak.

loans.use: to buy more wool, cotton and fabric for her hand crochet business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, is a married mother of 3 and a farmer and salesperson, who has access to many sellers in the food chain. On her half an acre farm, she keeps dairy cows, poultry, pigs and a garden full of bananas and trees. To make better income, Grace makes commission on sale from helping arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. 

She has been doing this business for 30 years. She understands her strength is the strong relationship she has with sellers and buyers.
Given that Grace can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

Your loan will help Grace’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales, as it will her family to make better incomes and uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereal merchandise for reselling using her market experience

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to supply more milk to gain more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to lease more land to expand his sugarcane farming.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 45 years old, married to Simion and supports a family of 4 children. 

She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 15 years earning KES 16,000 per month.
 
Rosemary has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain. 

She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to start a retail shop. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk for more income gain.

loans.name: Emine

texts.en:
Emine is married and a mother of two.  She sells small items of hardware at the city and district bazaars.  For years she has done this, made money,  raised her children and married them off.  With the help of her second loan, she bought products in bulk and increased her income. Her dream is to open a store on her own.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Emine hanım evli ve 2 çocuk annesi.  İl ve ilçe pazarlarında hırdavat satarak evine ek gelir sağlıyor.  Emine hanım uzun yıllardır pazarlarda satış yaparak çocuklarını büyütmüş ve evlendirmiş.  Maya’dan ikinci kredisini kullanan Emine hanım bu kredilerle toptan ürün alarak kar oranını artırdı.  Emine hanımın en büyük hayali bir dükkan açmak.

loans.use: to buy hardware materials

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 43 years old and married with two children.

Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and personal care products.

Mary Jane has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Mary Jane aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell such as canned goods, bread, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, drinks, sugar, eggs and other personal care products

loans.name: Sannex

texts.en:
Sannex is 39 years old and married with five children, all attending school and living in Kasese, Uganda. She has a depot for soda and beer. To supplement her income, she earns a monthly salary from the government.

Sannex would like to use the loan credit to buy soda and beer to sell and expand her business to get more profits in the future. She is also a hardworking and honest person who faces a difficulty of limited capital that hinders her business growth.

She has a dream of educating her children.

loans.use: to buy soda and beer to sell.

loans.name: Zoia

texts.en: Zoia, age 58, lives in Svaneti, Georgia in the Caucasus Mountains with her family. They have a small farm and a vegetable garden where they grow food for their own use. She earns a little income with fish farming. There are two ponds with trout where they are kept and fed until they are big enough. Then they are sold, mainly to tourists who come to the area during the summer. The ponds are old and need some renovations. With the help of the loan, Zoia can have the necessary earth-moving and concrete work done. Some of the channels and pipes will be renewed so that the water from the nearby mountain creek can flow into the ponds unhindered. Good circulation is important to supply the fish with oxygen and to prevent illnesses. She will buy fish food, too.

loans.use: To renovate her fish pond and to buy fish food for her little trout farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to supply milk with his motorcycle for increased income.

loans.name: Dala Group

texts.en:
Adele is the featured borrower for Dala Group. She got joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Adele is a 30-year-old married mother of one child who decided five years ago to start selling cosmetics to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker who has a good reputation among her customers. 

Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with new collection of cosmetics and make up to satisfy her customers' special requests. Adele is the first lady on the right of the photo.  Noura is the lady sitting in the middle, and Najiya is the first lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with a new collection of cosmetics and make up

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is 45 years old and married with two children.

Elma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Elma has been in this business for five years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Elma aspires to save money to expand her business and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bonny

texts.en:
Bonny is a divorced female with three children, all attending school and living in Kasese Uganda. Bonny owns a boutique, which helps her earn income to facilitate supporting her family, mostly by educating her children. She has been in business for six years, working 11 hours a day six days a week. 

Bonny has a dream of building a strong house for her children. Bonny wants money to pay school fees for her children

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Sol Marina

texts.es: Sol Marina es una ama de casa residenciada en la ciudad de Barranquilla y a sus 61 años está convencida de que el crear su negocio ha dinamizado su rutina.  Sol Marina  tiene claro que todas las personas tienen la oportunidad de emprender nuevos retos y estos surgen de las ideas más  sencillas como en su caso que aprovechando el vínculo laboral de su cónyuge con una empresa distribuidora de pollos y gallinas al por mayor, se le ocurrió que ella podría comercializar estos productos entre los habitantes del sector donde reside. Su negocio tiene 8 años de establecido y cuenta con una buena clientela a quien le vende pollos, gallinas y carbón mineral. Ella está aplicando para su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que requiere para la compra de un mayor volumen de pollo y gallinas, pues su inversión actual no le permite atender en su totalidad la demanda de sus clientes; así mismo cancelará algunas obligaciones financieras de alto costo en las que ha incurrido para atender el movimiento de su negocio. La meta de Sol Marina es incrementar sus utilidades para continuar apoyando a los estudios de sus hijos y seguir colaborando con los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Sol Marina is a housewife who lives in the city of Barranquilla. At the age of 61, she is convinced that creating her business energized her routine. It is clear to Sol Marina that all people have the opportunity to undertake new challenges that arise from the simplest ideas, as was true in her case. Taking advantage of her spouse's employment relationship with a business that distributes chickens and hens at wholesale, it occurred to her that she could sell these products to the people that reside in the area where she lives. She has had her business for the past 8 years, and she has a good customer base to whom she sells chickens, hens, and coal. 

She is applying for her first CrediKiva through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She needs a loan to buy a greater volume of chicken and hens, since her current inventory does not allow her to meet the demands of her customers fully. Additionally, she will cancel some high-cost financial obligations that she has in order to focus on moving her business forward. Sol Marina's goal is to increase her earnings so that she can continue supporting her children's studies and helping with household expenses.

loans.use: to buy a greater volume of chicken and hens.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is 36 years old; she is a married woman. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

She deals in a business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income.

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a Murabaha loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase more animals to inflate her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to inflate her sales.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en: Suriya, 41, is a married woman raising animals to sell with the help of her husband (who is also shown in the photo). Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of five children and is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with a good education, food and clothing. She has requested a murabaha loan (a loan acceptable under Islamic teachings) of 20,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to sell

loans.name: Nezahat

texts.en:
Nezahat is married and has a child.  She is sewing bedspreads and bed sheets, selling them to her neighbours and at the district bazaars and financially supporting her husband.  With the help of the loan she bought fabric in bulk for bed sheets.  Her dream is to provide her child with a good future.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Nezahat hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Evinde çarşaf ve pike takımları dikerek bunları çevresine ve il pazarlarında satarak maddi olarak eşine destek oluyor.  Nezahat Hanım maya’dan aldığı kredi ile toptan çarşaf kumaşı aldı.  Nezahat hanım çocuğuna iyi bir gelecek sağlamak istiyor.

loans.use: expand her business of sewing bedspreads and linens

loans.name: Riffat

texts.en:
Riffat is 43 years old and a married lady. Her son(also shown in the photo) is running a small general store in his community for many years.  He offers a variety of grocery items at reasonable prices and has retained many customers who regularly shop at his store. 

For her son's business advancement, Riffat  requested for a Murabaha loan of 25000 PKR to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way her son would be able to meet the increasing demand consistently.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, grains, biscuits, oil and flour from the market at lower rates

loans.name: Kaneez

texts.en:
Kaneez  is 51 years old widow. She is shown in the photo with her daughter. She deals in a business ofselling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them  in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute in the family income. She also sells milk to generate an extra amount of income. 

She needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 20000  to purchase more animals to increase her sales. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level.

loans.use: to purchase more animals to increase her sales.

loans.name: Khalida

texts.en:
Khalida  is a 41-year-old married woman and a mother of four children. She and her husband have worked in agriculture for some years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Khalida has currently applied a Murabaha loan of 30,000 PKR. This will help her to grow more crops, which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with  packs of insecticides and pesticides,

loans.name: Aysel

texts.en:
Aysel is 50 years old and is a mother of two.  After her husband died, she opened a small grocery store in order to earn money for the education of her two sons.  With the help of the loan, she bought products wholesale for the grocery store and increased her profit.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Aysel hanım 50 yaşında 2 çocuk annesi.  Eşini kaybettikten sonra iki oğlunun eğitim masraflarını karşılamak için küçük bir bakkal dükkanı açarak işletmeye başlamış.  Aysel hanım maya‘dan kullandığı kredi ile bakkal dükkanına toptan ürün alarak kar payını artırdı.

loans.use: to buy food and fruit materials for her grocery store, to support her sons

loans.name: Dorcus

texts.en:
Dorcus is a young woman aged 35 who is married with 5 children. She currently resides in Chikomba West District. 

She received a $500 loan which she used to expand her business. Now the profits from her business are making her a pillar of support to her family. Her husband and children say that they are living well and are now accessing basics. 

With the requested loan Dorcus would like to diversify to broiler farming. She volunteers as a Community Health trainer in her community, actively disseminating health information.

loans.use: To buy feeds and broiler chicks for her expanding business

loans.name: Fungai

texts.en:
Fungai is 30 years old, married and has two children. She lives in Chikomba West where she sells poultry and eggs. She produces about 120 broiler birds every six weeks and sells them to the local residents in her community.  

With her second Kiva loan she wishes to diversity her business into cattle fattening. She feels this loan will enable her to expand her business.     

Fungai volunteers in schools in her village as a Camfed community health trainer where she spreads information about various health issues. 

Thank you for funding Fungai ‘s loan!

loans.use: To buy cattle heifers and some feeds for fattening and re-sale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 52 years old and married with nine children.

Cecilia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Cecilia has been raising pigs for eleven years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF and more recently, from Kiva to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is from Stepanavan town where she lives with her husband.  For 10 years, she has been involved in clothing sales. Anahit usually purchases the goods in the wholesale market, and resells it from her house. Sometimes Anahit and her husband also take clothing to nearby villages and sell it there. 

Anahit asks this loan to purchase a summer collection clothing to sell to customers. She needs this funds to boost her sales in summer season and gather income for her family's living.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for a summer collection of clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria, 43, is married and has three children, one of whom is in school. For the past six years she has worked constantly buying and selling dried fish to make a living.

Gregoria has applied for a 10,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell. She is always working to improve her business and insure the future wellbeing of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and timber to finish his house.

loans.name: Jengen

texts.en:
Jengen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jengen is 34 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jengen has a general store business in the Philippines. Jengen requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Jengen has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jengen would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar is 46 years old and a married woman. Her husband(also shown in the photo) has been successfully running a small general store. She is the mother of 6 children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. 

For the improvement of her husband's business she has requested a Murabaha loan of 20000 PKR  to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices to cope with the increasing demands of the customers. Anwar is positive about her husband's better future earnings.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits, rice, spices and juices.

loans.name: Laban

texts.en:
This is Laban from Nairobi County. He is married with three children, who are currently schooling. He owns a grocery shop from where he sells different kind of fruits. He started his business one year ago. He shops for his fruit from the local market where he buys in bulk to get favorable prices. Some of his client are not able to buy a whole fruit and thus has devised a way of cutting up the fruits in pieces and selling them in parts so that all customers can access. 

He dreams of being a fruit distributors to other grocers in his area. He wants to expand his fruit stall to be able to provide a better display of his fruits and get more space for the fruits. With a Kiva  loan he will buy building materials to expand his fruit stall.

loans.use: To pay for building materials for expansion of his fruit stall

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan  is a 46-year-old, married woman. She is a mother of seven children. She, along with her husband, has been doing business in animal purchase sales and for many years. Chan fully supports and assists her husband in running their household activities.  

Now, she has requested for a Murabaha loan of 20,000 PKR. She wants to use this loan to purchase more cattle to resell in the market. She desires to improve her standard of living thorough all her efforts.

She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle  resell in the market.

loans.name: Señor De Eccehomo Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE ECCE HOMO, el banco está ubicado en el departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cirila alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria  a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de casacas, polos  entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Este crédito pertenece a una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa, crédito que se otorga a bancos comunales  que cumplen con los pagos puntuales.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
Cirila belongs to the Señor De Ecce Homo communal bank, which is located in the Cusco department.  Cirila alternates her daily activities with her business of selling clothes.  She is a responsible and diligent person.  She has been in her business for a good amount of time.  It is going well for her due to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  Cirila sells in an itinerant manner to all of her customers.  This is the way that she gets her family ahead.

Cirila requested a loan to buy coats and polo style shirts, among others.

The members are grateful for the loan that was granted, and they pledge to make their established payments.  This loan is part of a line of loans from the Asociación Arariwa, which give loans to communal banks that make punctual payments. 

The group members whose picture is attached to the group asked permission to arrive late at the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy coats and polo style shirts, among others.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy jackets and other items.

loans.name: Elnara

texts.en:
Elnara, 29, is married and has a son and a daughter. Her husband is unemployed. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region of Azerbaijan. She is an honest and responsible person who is skilled and respected in her field.

For the past six years Elnara has had a dairy. The yield from her herd has steadily grown to the point where her cows produce more than twelve litres of milk to sell every day. Her sales have resulted in increasing profits for her.

Elnara has already borrowed and repaid loans successfully through Kiva's field partner Agroinvest in the past. Now she is applying for a 1,500 AZN loan to buy fodder for her cows. She thanks Kiva lenders in advance for their support.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cows

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
María Elsa tiene 44 años de edad , conviviente, con un hijo a su cargo, vive en casa propia, en el dsitrito de Oyotún, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa norte de Perú, la cual es una zona rural.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas caballeros y niños, hace 02 años, negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio;además se dedica a la crianza de animales. Solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo;compra de mercaderia para aumentar el stock de su negocio,esto le servirá para poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas, generando mayores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María Elsa is 44 years old and lives with her partner. She has one child under her care and lives in her own house in the Oyotún district, which belongs to the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the North coast of Peru, which is a rural area.

For 2 years she has made a living selling men's, women's and children's clothing. Her business is located in her home. She also makes a living raising animals.

She is asking for the loan to invest in working capital, to buy merchandise to increase the stock in her business. This will enable her to satisfy her customers' tastes and so increase her sales, generating more income and thus improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase the stock in her business.

loans.name: Mestel

texts.en: Mestel is a 61-year-old married man with nine children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns rentals as his main source of income and at the same time does dairy farming that earns him more income. He faces the challenge of competition that hinders expansion of his business. However, he has future hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. He has asked for a loan to buy barbed wires to fence his farm.

loans.use: to buy barbed wires to fence his farm.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Esther has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Esther has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Jesus Reynaldo

texts.es:
Jesus es un hombre de 36 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 2 hijos de 8 meses y 8 años, y su negocio es la venta de licores.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, fuerte, alegre, optimista, responsable y muy trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘Alto de la Alianza’, donde se encuentran varios monumentos que representan a los mineros y fabriles, los habitantes son ex trabajadores de las minas que fueron relocalizados producto de los movimientos económicos efectuados en la década de los 80. Ubicado a una altura de 4000 metros sobre el nivel del mar, de clima frío y seco durante todo el año, con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre -3/12 grados centígrados.
Jesus es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus suegros que trabajan y con sus hijos; el mayor estudia en la escuela y el menor aún no se encuentra en edad escolar. Viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y piso de madera que cuenta con energía eléctrica, agua potable, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de licores como; wiski, ron, cerveza y otros. Actividad que realiza en su tienda durante la semana, desde la tarde hasta la noche, “inicié mi negocio con mi familia, para abrir una cadena de tiendas de licores…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con licores variados y la tienda se encuentra bien ubicada, la desventaja es la falta de capital para abastecer y surtir el negocio continuamente. Su sueño es tener un ambiente propio donde trabajar, él desea realizar la compra de variedad de bebidas para surtir y abastecer su negocio para continuar en el rubro. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 10 años que desarrolla esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jesus solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedades de licores para surtir y abastecer su negocio y con los beneficios cubrir los gastos médicos de su bebé.
texts.en:
Jesus is a 36-year-old man, lives with his partner, has 2 children aged 8 months and 8 years, and has a business selling liquor. He is entrepreneurial , independent, strong, cheerful, optimistic, responsible and very hardworking.

His business has grown in the 'Alto de la Alianza' (Top of the Alliance), where there are several monuments representing the miners and factory workers. The inhabitants are former miners who were relocated as a product of economic movements from the 80s. It is located at an altitude of 4000 meters above sea level, with a cold and dry climate throughout the year, and with daytime temperatures which vary between -3 and 12 degrees Celsius.

Jesus has of dark complexion, brown eyes, short black hair, short stature, thin physique, and his mother tongue is Aymara, which he speaks with his family. He also speaks Spanish by culture and while doing business. His lives at home with his working in-laws and with his children; the oldest studies in school and the youngest is not yet of school age. They live in a brick and cement home with a tin roof and wooden floor that has electricity, water, gas and sewer.

His business is selling liquor; whiskey , rum, beer and others. He sells in his shop during the week, from the afternoon until the evening.
"I started my business with my family, in order to open a chain of liquor stores..." he says.

The advantage of his business is that it offers various spirits and the shop is well located. The disadvantage is the lack of capital to continually stock and supply the business. His dream is to have a proper environment in which to work. He wants to purchase of variety of liquors to stock and supply his business to continue in the area. This is the first sequence of loans to the institution in the 10 years that he's been in this business
.
It is for these reasons that Jesus asks for a loan to purchase a variety of liquor to stock and supply his business and with the profits cover medical expenses for his baby.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of liquors to stock and supply his business and with the profits cover the medical expenses of his baby.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 51 years old and a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Alma has a general store business in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell.

Alma has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Alma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, candies, detergent soap, shampoo, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Damawia

texts.en:
Damawia is a hard working woman from Rubiri- nyamityobora, Mbarara district. She has applied for ugx2,000,000 to buy manure and hire labourers to work in her agricultural plantations. 

She has planted three acres of banana plants but she did not have money to manure it and that’s why she came for a loan and part of the money will be used to buy groceries for sell.  She has dreams of earning a lot of income which will help her to expand her land for planting more bananas and also increase her sales and income. She applauds the Kiva lenders for their great work of alleviating poverty.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs in form of organic fertilizers

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has a small piece of land in Kipsaiya, Kenya, where she lives and farms with her family. She keeps livestock and produces cash crops on a small scale. She sells her farm produce at a local market near her home where the Juhudi Kilimo office is found.
The biggest growth constraint that Susan faces is the lack of access to capital to buy agricultural inputs necessary to increase her farm’s productivity. She lives in a part of Kenya where there are no banks. She is seeking a loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy improved seeds, fertilizers and other important inputs that control weeds and pests.

With your loan, Susan will be able to access capital from a credible source, to buy important farm inputs that will increase her farm’s productivity and improve her family's income.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Myrachel

texts.en:
Myrachel is 25 years old and married with two children. With one child currently in school, Myrachel works very hard to provide for them.

Myrachel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Myrachel has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, cooking oil, etc. 

Myrachel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ümmü

texts.en:
Ümmü is married and has one child.  In order to support the family budget she is selling lingerie and baby wear at the gatherings.  She started this business with a very small budget buy with the help of the loan she bulks of lingerie and baby wear and increased the variety of her products and her income.


Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Ümmü hanım evli ve bir çocuk annesi.  Eşine ve ev ekonomisine katkı sağlamak amacıyla altın günlerinde iç çamaşırı ve çocuk kıyafetleri satıyor.  Çok küçük bir sermaye ile bu işe başlayan Ümmü hanım Mayadan kullandığı kredi ile toptan çamaşır aldı.  Sermayesini ve ürün çeşitliliğini artırdı.

loans.use: to buy lingerie and baby wear for re-sale

loans.name: Farirai

texts.en:
Farirai is a 29-year-old married woman with 2 children. She is living in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. Farirai’s poultry business has improved since she received her first loan that she used to increase her capacity from 20 chickens to 75 chickens. 

With this loan she would like to increase production to 250 per fortnight.  She has been able to improve her standard of living and has earned respect in her community. She volunteers in schools in her community, offering guidance and support to students through life skills education.

loans.use: To expand chicken production numbers and buy more feed .

loans.name: Panga-Yawendé Group

texts.fr: le groupe Panga-Yawendé fait partie des bons clients de ACFIME. Il est formé de femmes battantes qui font toutes le commerce. Ce groupe est à son 17ème contrat avec ACFIME et les remboursements se font à bonne date et par moment même par anticipation. Ouassa est la responsable du groupe, elle est veuve et mère de 4 enfants. Cette femme se bat au quotidien pour pourvoir au besoin de sa famille et aussi d'assurer un avenir à ses enfants. Elle a besoin d'un prêt pour acheter des fruits et des légumes pour vendre.Elle exerce cette activité depuis 30 ans.Pour maintenir sa clientèle,Ouassa vend des produits de bonne qualité et elle accueille bien aussi ses clients. Après ses ventes, elle aura un bénéfice qui lui permettra de continuer à s'occuper de ses enfants et aussi de faire son activité.
texts.en: The Panga-Yawendé Group is one of ACFIME's trusted clients. It is made up of hard-working women who all have their own businesses. This group is currently on its 17th loan with ACFIME and all their previous loans have been paid back either on time or even ahead of time. Ouassa, a widowed mother to four children, is the group representative. This woman struggles daily to provide for her family and ensure that her children have a good future. She needs this loan to purchase fruit and vegetables which she will then resell. She has been carrying out this activity for 30 years. In order to keep her customers, Ouassa sells good-quality produce and treats her patrons well. After selling her produce, she will have enough profit to allow her to continue supporting her children and run her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a young man living in an informal settlement in Nairobi. He has come to iSmart in search of a job so that he can earn money to support himself. 

At iSmart, Fredrick sells life-improving products like solar lamps and clean cookstoves. He earns a commission on each sale that he makes. 

Please help Fredrick earn a living and bring these beneficial products to others in his community.

loans.use: to pay for clean cookstoves to sell.

loans.name: Elgun

texts.en:
Elgun is 27 years old and married. His wife doesn’t work. He is IDP(internally displaced person)and lives with family in Bilasuvar region. He is a skilled, respected, honest and also responsible and professional person.

Elgun is a dairy farmer .He started keeping dairy cows 6 years ago. Since then he has developed and grown his business steadily to a point where he is able to get more then 11 litres of milk every day, that he sells to his society .Thanks to his hard work he has been able to improve and expand his merchandise.The profits from this business have allowed  him to expand his sales volume. 

Elgun has already borrowed loans from Agroinvest in the past. Now he needs money and wants to buy food for his cows.

He thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to buy food for his dairy cows

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio  pertenece al banco comunal  “MADRES TRABAJADORAS, él socio  continua dedicándose al negocio de transporte, él socio lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
 El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
El socio solicita el crédito para hacer el mantenimiento de  su carro.
texts.en:
The associate is a member of the communal bank "Madres Trabajadores." He continues working in the transportation business. He has been working in this business for a long time, and it is going well for him thanks to the effort that he puts into his business every day. He wants to be able to continue working so that in this way he can continue supporting his family.

He feels grateful for the loan and promises to make the payments on his account.

He is applying for the loan to do maintenance on his car.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his car

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en:
Armed with his dream of having professional children and enjoying a decent living condition, Victoriano, is working really hard to improve his business. He is running a food stall that sells fried chicken, a favorite food of most Filipinos. Maybe this is the reason why he chose this kind of enterprise. His usual customers are students, working people and even those staying at home. The recent school opening brings greater demand for his business. Hence he is requesting for additional capital of PhP 8,000 to buy more chicken meat and other ingredients. He will also improve the water-proof canvas covering for his stall in time for the rainy season. 

He has small children with his wife Ritchell and they are living in Tondo, Manila. They want to see their children finish their schooling so they can have better opportunity to gain a decent living wage. He draws inspiration from his co-fellowship* members who meet every week to share stories about life and business and to draw strength from the Word of God. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more chicken meat and other ingredients for his fried chicken stall

loans.name: Retchie

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Thanks for being a part of Retchie's journey. With your previous financial support, she procured more supplies for her variety store that resulted to her increased income. She was able to support her family's daily needs and provide for the educational expenses of her children. She's been consistent in her passion of strengthening her business despite some problems like long time debts of her neighbors. She's focused on her dream of having store branches in different places and ensuring the future of her children through completed college education. 

This time she wants to avail of PhP 50,000 loan to continue reaching her dream. Again, she will buy volume of supplies like grocery items, beverages and toiletries to keep her business growing. 

She has been faithful in repaying the previous loan and she's determined to maintain her integrity. She's still active in attending their weekly fellowship* where she draws strength and inspiration from the Word of God. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries, beverages, and toiletries she needs to keep her profit from her store growing.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 41-year-old woman who owns a general store in Alegria, Cebu.  She is married with four children. Her eldest is sixteen and her youngest is two. Emma would like to grow her store to include items like  bleaching agents, detergent, bath soap, more seasonings, condiments, and toiletries.  A store that looks full always attracts customers.  

With additional capital, Emma plans to improve her business and to sell more items that she has not previously offered.

loans.use: to buy bleaching agents, detergent, bath soap, more seasonings, condiments, and toiletries

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Rise and shine lenders! You have become a blessing once more in the life of Lerma. 

Lerma previously availed a loan worth PHP 22,000. It was a big help for her in her business journey. Through your granted loan, she was able to buy enough resources and raw materials needed in her tailoring business, like needles, cloth, threads and other important stuff. By that, she found a way to increase her sales. 

To continue widening her inventory, she humbly requests you to allow her to have a loan worth PHP 25,000 that she would use again for the same purpose. She would like to obtain additional materials needed for making clothes. Hope you can give her another chance this time to prove that her dream (to someday have a better living and be able to assist her grand children 'til their graduation in college) is worth working hard for. 

She meets with her co-fellowship* members every week, where she can share stories of her life and business and also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God that she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to obtain additional materials needed for making clothes.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en:
Maritess, 47, and her husband, Epelito, who is a vendor, work diligently to raise their children well. She has a sari-sari, or small general store in her community of Tondo in Manila. She sells various commodities such as sachets of shampoo, toothpaste, soap, snacks, candies, bread, repackaged condiments and many others.

The income from Maritess’ shop pays for some of their basic needs, but there are times when it isn’t sufficient to her. She’s not content simply to make a daily living; she wants to put away more money for the future. With this forward-looking mindset, she wants to make her sari-sari more profitable.

Maritess is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's field partner CCT to buy more dry goods and grocery items for her store. She knows that the additional income resulting from this loan will boost her savings for her children’s future and education.

Moreover, Maritess is planning to renovate her store. She wants to elevate its floor in preparation for the upcoming rainy season. The area where she lives in Tondo is prone to flooding, so she wants to make sure her supplies are not submerged in floodwaters.

All CCT community clients such as Maritess are organized into fellowship groups of fifteen to thirty members who meet on a weekly basis. There they share stories of their work, repay microfinance loans and draw strength and inspiration from their study of the Word of God.

loans.use: to buy dry goods and grocery items for and restructure her sari-sari

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Hi there, lenders! 

Maria sends her utmost gratitude as you allowed her have financial support that has indeed helped in her buy-and-sell business. Well, aside from this, she also gets income from her small sari-sari store, which she aims to  improve. 

The problem is that she doesn't have enough capital to do so. With this, she asks to borrow a loan amounting to PHP 40,000 that she would use to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell and materials to be used in the beautification of her store . The main reason behind this expansion is that she wants to earn higher profit that would surely help her family to at least cover their daily expenses. 

Maria really hopes for your helping hands. 

Maria dreams of being successful in the years to come. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members every week to share stories of their work. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell and materials to be used in the beautification of her store

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 54 years old and married with three children. 

Julieta is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Julieta requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Julieta has been raising livestock for 2 years now, and has borrowed 3 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Julieta would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana works hard to support her family. Luciana is married and has a raising livestock business in the Philippines.

Luciana requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Luciana has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Luciana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim is a married lady and the mother of 2 children. The man shown in the photo is Shamim’s husband who is providing services of vehicle repairing from many years. He has now established good clients and makes enough to meet the household expenses. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds he is unable to meet with the daily demands of his customers. For this reason Shamim  requested a Murabaha loan of 30000 PKR to Kashf Foundation. In this way her husband would be able to purchase more equipment, such as screws, nails and spare parts to provide better services to his customers. Shamim is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment such as screws, nails and spare parts for her husband's vehicle repairs shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in raw materials: wheat flour, corn, oil, salt and potatoes.

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es: Mónica de 40 años, es residente en el municipio de Soledad y por falta de empleo, ante la necesidad de generar ingresos que le permitieran ayudar a su cónyuge con los gastos del hogar, decidió aceptar las recomendaciones de una amiga quien le sugirió incorporarse a  las ventas por catálogo. Mónica afirma que desde el primer día supo que era su oportunidad  y  decidió en ese momento enfocarse con este negocio y desde hace dos años ha logrado consolidar una clientela a quien diariamente visita para promover sus  ventas de productos para el hogar y cosméticos.  En la actualidad está aplicando para un credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, primer financiamiento que planea invertir en cosméticos y artículos para el hogar con el fin de ampliar su mercado y generar mayores utilidades. Su visión para el futuro es lograr establecer un punto de venta que le permita atender a sus clientes con mayor comodidad.
texts.en:
Monica, age 40, is a resident in the municipality of Soledad.  Due to unemployment, and given the need to generate income that enabled her to help her spouse with the household expenses, decided to accept the recommendations of a friend who suggested joining her in catalog sales. Monica says that from the first day she knew it was her opportunity and decided at that moment to focus on that business.  For two years, she has managed to form a clientele whom she visits daily to promote sales of household products and cosmetics. 

     Currently, she is applying for a credikiva with the Foundation Mario Santo Domingo. It is her first loan which she plans to invest in cosmetics and household items in order to expand her market and generate higher profits. Her vision for the future is to establish a store front that will allow her to meet her customers with convenience.

loans.use: to invest in cosmetics and household items in order to expand their market and generate higher profits

loans.name: Maharram

texts.en:
Maharram   is  40 years old and married. His wife   doesn’t work. He has a  daughter. Maharram  is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with  his family in Bilasuvar region. He is a skilled, respected, honest also stable and professional person. He is a farmer and  started his work 20 years ago. 

Maharram buys seeds (fruit and vegetable seeds)from other markets. After that he sows his land and then sells the harvest. His biggest dream is to expand his land and be able to plant more seeds. But before this he  has  to have some money. For this he needs Kiva Lenders to support him.

loans.use: to expand his farmland and be able to plant more seeds

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
A lot of good has happened to Beatriz, lenders, as she started improving their lives through your previously granted loan worth PHP 20,000. Because of your wide and helping hands, Beatriz was able to increase the profit from her enterprise, thus allowing her family to have a little better daily living conditions than usual. 

She wants to continue the struggle, and so she is asking for another loan worth PHP 20,000 that she would surely use to purchase more direct-selling products like detergents, liquid soaps and other personal product to sell. This can be a good opportunity for her as she tries to explore different avenues to success. At present, she just prays that your unwavering support for her won't vanish. 

With a vision in mind, to strive for a better life and business for the family, Beatriz does everything she can to make every step into success.  

She meets up weekly with her fellowship* co-members to share stories of her work and draw strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
 
* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more direct-selling products like detergents, liquid soaps and other personal products to sell.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Great day dear lenders! 

Thank you for your wonderful generosity to Letecia. Recently, she was given a loan worth PHP 20,000 that she utilized in developing her buy-and-sell business. With that, she was able to buy supplies of varieties of biscuits and dried fish. As a result, she was able to gain a higher income at hand.  What a great joy it brings to her and to her family! 

Noting, besides her buy-and-sell business, she also sells ice candy (a favorite dessert in Filipino custom). She hopes to expand this too. Thus, she is asking if she could take out a loan amounting to PHP 20,000 that she would use to purchase additional ingredients to make ice candies. Hope that you'll consider this because this is a lot more now to her. It would be a great remedy for their family's daily living expenses. 

Someday, she dreams nothing more but just to be successful in life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients in making ice candies.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime had already entered into different businesses just to earn a living for his family. For long years, he has experienced a lot of ups and downs that made him strong enough in facing life trials. And thank God that Kiva and CCT have been parts of this years-long journey. 

Almost four years ago, he was given a chance to have a loan amounting PHP 10,000 that he used for the maintenance of his buy-and-sell(footwear) business. But aside from the mentioned inventory, he also owns a tricycle unit. This time, he asks for PHP 20,000 for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. He hopes that you'll help him again with his request. 

Jaime hopes to have a successful future far beyond their life today. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship members* to share stories of his work and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his tricycle unit.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is 30-years-old and has two children. Flordeliza is married and has two children who are in school.

Flordeliza is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Flordeliza requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Flordeliza has been in pig fattening for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Zinaida

texts.en:
Zinaida is a professional dentist from Tbilisi, the capital of Georgia. She has a lawyer husband and school-age daughter. Zinaida worked at the private clinic and with the saved money, she decided to open her own dental clinic. She has already renovated the place and now she needs financial support to purchase all needed equipment and instruments and open the clinic in order to continue running her lovely activity in a more profitable way. 

Zinaida has been approved for a loan within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

The loan will greatly help Zinaida and she will be able to improve her economic situation and give her family a better style of life, as her generated salary will significantly increase regards to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and open a dental clinic

loans.name: Geminina's Group

texts.en:
Geminina is a farmer who lives in the locality of Las Perlas. Las Perlas is a marginalized and vulnerable locality in the municipality of Las Margaritas in the state of Chiapas. The locality has 232 residents and is situated in the jungle area so the community has natural resources to survive. In spite of the natural resources, it is a poor region where residents do not have access to basic needs like electricity.

Geminina is a farmer who cultivates corn and coffee all year but she receives an income in the season of the cultivation. She lives with her husband and children, so she wants to purchase a solar system to improve her family and her life conditions. With the solar system they will stop consuming firewood, will be able to see at night and her children will be able to do their homework and study after sunset.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system so her children can study after sunset and also to replace the use of firewood.

loans.name: Chipo

texts.en:
Chipo is 26, lives in Chiredzi District and has five years of experience in the retail industry. Her business is based at a table at the local flea market where she sells products such as handbags, shoes, jeans, skirts, track suits, and T-shirts. 

Using a $500 loan from Kiva last year, she expanded her business, increasing her sales by 25% which enabled her to support her family and send her two children to school.  

With a new Kiva loan, Chipo will purchase more stock and grow the business further, to take her one step closer to her dream of owning a store one day. This will help her to secure her children’s education and provide for her family’s basic needs. 

Chipo also volunteers in schools counseling students and teaching entrepreneurship skills to school graduates. Her aspirations are to eventually go to university to study law.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Carmelina's Group

texts.en: Carmelina and her husband live in the jungle area of the state of Chiapas, in the locality of Las Perlas. Las Perlas has only 232 residents. Carmelina and her husband own a small grocery shop in Las Perlas. In the grocery shop they sell snacks, sodas and other simple things like candles and pencils. Regularly Carmelina and her husband visit the Municipality to get the things they sell in their grocery shop. Carmelina wants to purchase a solar system to improve their life conditions by replacing the use of candles, which represent a high percent of their income, and also to allow her children to study after sunset.

loans.use: to purchase a solar system to replace the use of candles and to be able to open her grocery shop after sunset.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita today owns a pedicab and this is one of her sources of income aside from her food stall business that was recently supported by Kiva also.

A pedicab is more like a tricycle unit which is also a means of transportation for people. The difference is, tricycles are run by motorcycles while pedicabs are mechanically driven with bicycles. With a pedicab, people can go in nearby places with just merely paying a certain amount for the ride. 

Now, to maintain the current business, Juanita wants to ask your reaching hearts. She wants to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 that she would utilize for the maintenance of her pedicab. If you give her this chance, Juanita assures you that your help will not be wasted as she pursues to grow her current business. 

Thank you in advance! 

Juanita hopes her family to always have good health and she wants to earn at the same time for future investments. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: for the maintenance of her pedicab.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients for her pastry and baking business.

loans.name: Augie Marie

texts.en:
Augie Marie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Augie Marie is 37 years old and her two children are in school.

Augie Marie has a electronic mobile load retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to resell.

Augie Marie has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional amount of electronic mobile load to resell

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is furniture maker. In the rented territory, Murad and his two sons are involved in furniture making. They mostly make kitchen furniture having numbers of customers during month. Murad has also wife and 79-years old mother to take care of. 

Besides furniture production he also trades with milk. 
Murad purchases milk from nearby villages of Ejmiatsin town (20 kms far from Yerevan) and takes it a cheese making factory to sell.
