Murad has applied for this loan to pay for renovation of a car and purchase raw materials for furniture making. He  has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This is Murad's first deal with Kiva and he hopes to receive support from lenders and develop his business.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of a car and purchase raw materials for furniture making

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a Babban Gona maize farmer from Karofi  Village. Mohammed joined Babban Gona to create a better life for his children.  In the past, Mohammed suffered from poor yields that crippled his ability to feed his family and children. Now that he has joined Babban Gona, Mohammed has the chance to attain yields of up to 30 bags of maize/hectare, double the national average in Nigeria, and earn an income of up to $2,000/hectare. 

Through Babban Gona’s input loan, Mohammed will have access to high-quality farm inputs such as fertilizers, herbicides, and improved seeds that will increase his yields and income considerably. Mohammed can now ensure that his children get a post secondary school education.

loans.use: To ensure children get post secondary school education

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme célibataire  qui vit à Adidogome. Agée de 28 ans, Abla est tres dynamique et  vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches pour gagner son revenu quotidien. Grâce à cette activité, Abla arrive à faire une bonne épargne et tirer un bon profit de son activité. Abla s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local. Pour équiper son atelier, Abla demande ce nouveau prêt pour acheter des mèches et des tissages pour gagner son revenu et atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en:
Abla is a single woman who lives in Adidogome. Aged 28, Abla is very dynamic and sells cosmetic products and hair extensions to earn her living. Thanks to this business, Abla manages to put a good deal aside and she makes a fair profit from her business. She stocks up twice a month in the local market. 

To equip her salon, Abla is requesting this new loan to buy hair extensions and weaves in order to earn her living and attain her goals.

loans.use: to buy 45 hair extensions and 30 hair weaves

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 48 years old and has five children. Annabelle is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Annabelle is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Annabelle has been raising pigs for 5 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Kisosso School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Charles. He is the Principal of Kisosso Parents School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kisosso in Masaka with 750 students. Kisosso School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore, has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Kisosso School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Charles ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 33-year-old businesswoman. She is a single mother who has been operating a grocery shop in Mudzi District, Zimbabwe. 

With the first loan that she received, she increased her stock of sugar, cooking oil, washing soap and drinks. Susan intends to expand her business and  increase her stock to improve sales and profits. A higher income would make it easier for Susan to support her child.  

Susan also volunteers as a community health development officer and a Camfed Learner Guide in her community.

loans.use: To expand her grocery business

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
Felicidad is a proud mother and a very supportive wife. There is nothing she dreams but to take her family out of poverty. That's why she really helps her husband in finding out ways to earn. 

Previously, she was given a chance to borrow a loan that she used to improve her small sari-sari store. She is indeed thankful to have you part of this as helping hands. By this time, she wants to avail again a loan that she would utilize in buying grocery items to sell in larger quantities. She hopes that you truly grant this request. A PHP 18,000 peso would become a big help for the family. 

Someday, Felicidad wants her grand children have good lives but they can't acquire this in just a snap. Of course,they need to finish their studies. Looking forward for this, Felicidad makes everything to bring them good education through maintaining and growing her business.   

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be utilized in buying grocery items to sell in larger quantities.

loans.name: Dadirai

texts.en:
Dadirai is 31 years old and married with three children. She lives in Chikomba West district.

With the second loan she want to buy heifers for fattening which she will sell to abattoirs. Dadirai has peace of mind and a sense of security by being the owner of the business. She has gained respect and value from her family and community and is now more involved in family decisions. This second loan will help her to diversify her sources of income and continue to build resources for her family and the community.

Dadirai volunteers in schools as a Cama Community Health Trainer spreading health information to school children and her community members.
Thank you for supporting Dadirai’s Kiva loan!

loans.use: To purchase heifers and feeds for fattening and re-sale to provide income

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Agée de 28 ans, Yawa est une femme qui a deux enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adidogomé, Yawa est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotidiennes. Yawa vend des charbons de bois à la devanture de sa maison et réalise un revenu favorable. Yawa s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Yawa sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et avoir assez de profits pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aged 28, Yawa is a woman responsible for two children. Living in Adidogomé, Yawa is very dynamic and active in ensuring that she can cover daily expenses. She sells charcoal outside her house and makes a fair profit. She stocks up at the market twice a month. 

Yawa is requesting this small loan to buy sacks of charcoal so as to make enough profit to promote the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy 16 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in bricks, sand, cement, gravel and a door in order to construct two walls and install a door.

loans.name: El Manantial De Pariachi Group

texts.es: Mayde de 32 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “el Manantial de Pariachi”  la cual lo conforman 05 socios con deseos de  trabajar honradamente. Mayde hace más de 01 año que se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa. Gracias a su constante dedicación ella puede ayudar con los gastos del hogar.  Su mayor deseo es  tener su local propio ya que su negocio es ambulatorio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de polos faldas y buzos. La Alcancía “El Manantial de Pariachi” agradece a los Inversionistas de Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Mayde es la segunda del lado izquierdo y viste casaca de color negro.
texts.en:
Mayde, 32 years old, lives with her domestic partner and has two dependent children. She belongs to the communal bank El Manantial de Pariachi [The Spring of Pariachi] which is made up of five members who desire to work honestly.

Mayde has made a living selling clothes for more than a year. Thanks to her continual dedication she is able to help with the household expenses.

Her greatest wish is to have her own permanent location as her business is itinerant. She requested the loan in order to purchase t-shirts, skirts and sweatshirts.

The bank El Manantial de Pariachi [The Spring of Pariachi] thanks Kiva lenders for the support granted.

Mayde is the second one from the left, wearing a black jacket.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, skirts and sweatshirts.

loans.name: Liliane

texts.fr: Liliane habite à Adidogomé avec quatre enfants à sa charge. Liliane est une femme mariée et âgée de  36 ans. Pour contribuer aux charges quotidiennes de la famille, Liliane vend des pagnes pour trouver un revenu leur permettant de se nourrir. Liliane s’approvisionne deux fois par mois. Liliane demande ce crédit pour acheter des pièces de pagnes d’où elle peut tirer du bénéfice pour favoriser un bon épanouissement à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Liliane lives in Adidogomé where she is raising four children. She is a married woman of 36. To contribute to the daily family expenses, Liliane sells African print cloth to make an income that allows the family to pay for food. She stocks up twice a month on cloth to sell. 

Liliane is requesting this loan to buy some lengths of cloth from which she can earn a profit that will allow her children to flourish.

loans.use: to buy seven lengths of African print cloth

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Hope you're having a good day lenders! 

Meet and Greet Emily. She's 57 by now, married to Eduardo, and lives at Intramuros, Manila. She has three kids and she doesn't want them to follow her shadows (mentioning that she only reached sixth grade then suddenly stopped studying). She knows that education is very important to reach success. She experienced so much poverty because of lack of education and to keep her children from the track, she is working very hard to make sure that her children will finish their studies, no matter what. 

She's into a meat-selling business right now. She buys meat of pork in a huge quantity then sells them per kilo at a given cost. By this, she maintains daily living for the household and is able to support her husband as well in establishing the family status. 

She wants to improve her sales, and this would not happen if she doesn't have enough resources. To say, she is requesting a loan that will fully carry the expenses of buying more supplies of meat to sell. PHP 9,000 would be enough. She hopes to touch your kind hearts. She's doing this only for her family. 

She meets every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used in buying more supplies of meat to sell.

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en:
Blessing is 33 years old and a single mother of one child. She lives in Chiredzi District, Zimbabwe. She is the primary bread-winner in her family, which makes her responsible for her child, her siblings and her extended family.  

With a Kiva loan last year, she managed to increase her production capacity by 10%. She now  hopes to receive a second loan so she can expand her fowl run to increase its carrying capacity to 300 birds per cycle.. This will make it possible to integrate her business into the restaurant market as a reliable supplier.   Improving her business will enhance her life considerably and she will be able to put her child and two additional dependents through school. She is also using the profits from her business to build her own house. 

Blessing is well-known for her passion to help people in her community. She volunteers as a community health trainer in the district and works both in and out of schools educating people about health issues.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens to expand her production for the restaurant market

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Thanks for your kindness and willingness to help lenders. Because of your support previously to Agnes, she was able to improve sales from her previous business- computer shop. At the same time, she well managed her sari-sari store simultaneous with her computer shop. The income she got from these well aided the family needs then. 

This time, she humbly asks for a financial assistance through a loan worth PHP 30,000. She is observing that her supplies of merchandise items is depleted. She would like to use this loan as an additional capital for buying more quantity of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business. It's a great response for her if you'll be affirmative regarding the matter since this business is a great means of the family in getting a living. 

She hopes that you will not get tired of helping other people like her, because through this scheme of helping, many lives are being changed and transformed for the better. She prays that her business will someday expand and that her family will live always a peaceful life having good health conditions. 

As of now, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative (CCT) community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to be used as an additional capital for buying more quantity of merchandise products like grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Hmayak

texts.en:
Hmayak is taxi driver from Eghegnadzor town.  Hmayak is not married and lives with his retired parents. Using his own car, Hmayak drives a taxi. He receives different orders during the month and has already number of loyal customers.
 
Because the car is damaged and is currently not in use, Hmayak asks this loan to be able to renovate it and purchase new tires. This is very important for him to be able to continue taxi driving. 
 
Hmayak  has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.
This is his first cooperation with Kiva and Hmayak hopes to receive lenders' support and trust.

loans.use: to pay for partial renovation of his car and to purchase new tires

loans.name: Ngock Anna

texts.en:
She is married with five children. They all live in a four-bedroom house in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many difficulties in life, which have been sickness of her family members, death of her loved ones and inadequate finance to start up a business of her own to cater to her family's needs and pay for the children’s school fees. 

With this new loan requested, she will buy more goats and pigs from far off bush markets to retail in towns. Part of the loan will be used to buy seedlings for her farm. She holds a positive view of this business succeeding because she has been in the business for long and the demand for meat is also high. With this business activity, the community will benefit from good food at all times. And there will be available meat in the market for the population and manure for gardeners in the local community.

With the profit made from this loan, she will expand her business, pay her child school fees. She will provide medication for her family and will also build her house. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of low interest rates, convenient repayment intervals and also the members are trained in marketing and management skills before the loans are disbursed. Also social life is acquired in GHAPE.

loans.use: To buy pigs and goats.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
This is Juana and she's a vendor by trade at Pasay City. She's been operating her sari-sari(variety) store business for 12 years now. Handling a business that long, she already experienced different circumstances that really tested her faith. But she remained tough, because this is her only means of income for assisting her three children who are with her.  

Sari-sari store is often seen everywhere in the Philippines, most especially along the sidewalks and streets. It is most likely a convenience store, but quite a sort of smaller than the usual and offers only limited products which are common needed such as toiletries, food, instants, beverages and other commodities. Unlike grocery stores, sari-sari stores offer products at low-cost and in a retail basis, which is really an advantage for the customers.

Now, she would like to humbly request you loan that would suffice her store with adequate quantity of grocery items to sell. All she wants is just to improve her sales to be able to earn. But that would not happen if her store is an empty display. She wants you to know that PHP 50,000 would be so much enough to help her family grow her business. 

Someday, she dreams of expanding her inventory even more. She always wanted to have a better life not just for her but also for her grand children. She wants them to finish college and be professionals in the future. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to supply her store with adequate an quantity of grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Alexandra Catherine

texts.es:
Alexandra tiene 18 años de edad, Soltera, no tiene hijos , vive en casa familar domicliada en la AV.Ruperto Baca en el Centro Poblado Nueva Arica,la cual es una zona rural, que pertenece al distrito Cayaltí, Provincia de Chiclayo, Región Lambayeque, Costa Norte de Perú.

Ella se dedica a brindar servicios de limpieza a terceros, hace 1 años,con buenas referencias personales y laborales. Solicita préstamo para activo fijo; compra y mantenimiento de herramientas de trabajo y otros gastos afines, asi cubrir de mejor forma su trabajo y poder brindar un buen servicio, lo que le permitirá generar mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Alexandra is 18 years old, single, with no children, and lives in her family's home located in the town center of Nueva Arica, which is a rural area belonging to the Cayaltí district, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Region, on the North Coast of Peru.

She makes a living by providing cleaning services to third parties, which she has done for one year, and has good personal and professional references. She is requesting a loan for fixed assets, such as the purchase and maintenance of tools for her job and other related expenses. In this way, she will complete her work in the best way and be able to provide good service, which will allow her to generate more income and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase and maintain tools for her job and other related expenses.

loans.name: Jolimel

texts.en:
Jolimel is currently managing a small barbecue business together with her husband Antonio. Being new in this kind of business, is quite a difficulty to the couple (since they started business a year ago). However, it didn't become a discouragement to them instead they worked hard in proving the people the taste of their product. 

Now, their inventory is gradually growing and they need enough capital to cater the demand of the customers. With this, Jolimel would like to acquire a PHP 9,000 loan that will be used for buying more raw ingredients for her barbecue business. This amount will serve as an additional capital for their business expansion and she really hopes that you can help her with this. This means a lot to them most especially that they will be able to gain a profit increase with this. Thus, they will be able to provide the family with better daily living, aiding the expenses and necessities. 

One day in the future, she dreams of her business growing even more and having her own stall. She wants to give her family a successful life. She also prays that her family will also grow their faith in God. 

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is comprised of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to be used for buying more raw ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Vonady is 16 years old and is 1st of the seven children in the family. Her mother Valentina a member of NWT, supports the family through her food vending business in the Philippines.

Vonady is studying bachelor of science in business administration and is currently in the 1st of this 4-year course.

Valentina is borrowing PHP 6870 to pay for tuition fees of her daughter Vonady for the first semester of the school year 2015-16.

When she graduates, Vonady plans to be gainfully employed so she could help her parents in the future.

loans.use: to pay 1st semeter tuition fees for a B.Sc. in Business Administration

loans.name: Ruth Milena

texts.es: Ruth de 29 años, reside en una urbanización en compañía de su cónyuge y sus tres hijos menores de edad.  Cuando Ruth era una niña acompañaba a su padre pescador a comercializar los pescados en las calles de su pueblo natal, con esta experiencia logró iniciar su propio negocio al trasladarse a la ciudad de Barranquilla, en donde recorre las calle de la ciudad vendiendo pescado, frutas y verduras.  Aunque es un trabajo arduo le permite aportar a la economía de su hogar.  Ruth está aplicando para  su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario santo Domingo, inversión que requiere para la compra de un mayor volumen de pescado que le permitan aumentar su ventas y una mejores utilidades que ayuden a brindarle una  excelente educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ruth, 29 years old, lives in a neighborhood with her spouse and their three young children. When Ruth was a child, she would accompany her father, a fisherman, to sell fish on the streets of her hometown. With this experience, she managed to start her own business after moving to the city of Barranquilla, where she crosses the streets of the city selling fish, fruits and vegetables.

Although it is hard work, it allows her to contribute to the household expenses. Ruth is applying for her first Kiva credit with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. The investment is needed for the purchase of a greater volume of fish, which allows her to increase her sales and improve profits, which will help her provide an excellent education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase a greater volume of fish which allows her to increase her sales and improve profits.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna and her sister run a small catering business. They live with their mother and aunt in Dzoragyugh village in the Lori region. Their catering space is not big, but Anna and her sister manage to serve a lot of guests who always prefer the delicious dishes prepared by Anna and her sister. 

Anna applied for a loan to invest in and develop her catering business. And she has been approved for a loan within the framework of the joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. 

Anna needs to both renovate the catering space and purchase food supplies. She hopes to receive lenders' support and have good cooperation with them.

loans.use: to both pay for the renovation of her catering space and purchase food supplies.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгул, 26 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей. У нее среднее образование, в качестве источника дохода для семьи Назгул начала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Начатый со стартовой суммы в 3,000 сом (KGS) бизнес на сегодня приносит около 14,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У Назгул есть 2 коровы, 10 овец. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает ячмень для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку лошади для отгона и откорма на пастбище. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, чтобы накопить средства на покупку дома.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 26 years old, married, with two children. She has completed secondary education. 

Nazgul is involved in agriculture for a living. She started her business with the seed capital of 3,000 som (KGS), and now it provides a monthly income of about 14,000 som (KGS). Nazgul owns two cows and 10 sheep. On the 1.0 ha land lot she cultivates barley for sale. 

To expand her business, Nazgul turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase a horse for fattening in the field. The borrowed money will be invested in the business, eventually in order to save enough money to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase one horse for fattening in the field

loans.name: Judith M

texts.en:
Judith is a 39-year-old woman. She is married with 3 children and lives in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a poultry project for 5 years, producing about 200 broiler birds every 6 weeks and selling them to the local residents. She started the business when she lost her job. Poultry production is a thriving business in her community. 

With the second loan she want to elevate her business  She will use the loan to purchase feeds and vaccines for her chickens. 

She volunteers in schools in her community, offering guidance and support to students through life skills education.
Thank you for supporting Judith’s business!

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds for her expanding business

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
While many people find them as useless, who would believe that there is still money in junks? Nicolas, 59 years old, still finds them as a way to generate a living.

Here is his story.

Since, trash is not well-managed in the country and just thrown anywhere along the sidewalks and riverbanks, street dwellers usually collect such things that are still recyclable from junks like copper, papers, plastics and metals. After collecting, their next destination is to the junk shop where they sell such for a corresponding price depending on the material. Usually, metals cost higher. Junk shops then stack, clean and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories.

However, stable income from this kind of business is hardly predictable. Sometimes, the revolving fund that the junk shop operators use is not enough.

This is why Nicolas is taking out a loan worth PHP 20,000 to add up for his current revolving fund and to use for improving the shop. 

With her wife, Marie, they are truly hopeful that someday their lives will get better and they will be able to renovate their house. He meets up with his co-fellowship** members to share stories of his life and business every week and where he draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

** All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to increase his current revolving fund and to use for improving the shop, where reycling of waste takes place

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bags of sachet water to sell

loans.name: Chenai

texts.en:
Chenai is 35 years old, married with one child and living in Chikomba West District in Zimbabwe.

Chenai managed to do her repayments in time and with her second loan she wishes to expand her groceries shop to poultry projects. She wants to purchase more chicks and chick feed. With the profits she makes, she wishes to  financially provide for her family by purchasing food, clothing and paying school fees for her daughter. 

She provides counseling services to young people facing challenges at a local community center. 
Thank you for supporting Chenai’s business!

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and chick feeds to increase production for school funds for her daughter.

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt: Fernando é um jovem recém casado oficialmente, pai de uma filha menor de idade,é professor,vive na casa propria com sua familia.o Fernando trabalha no estado ja a bastante tempo mas o seu salario não é suficiente para cobrir com as necessidades familiar. Sendo assim pela segunda vez o empréstimo para compra de cimento, blocos e varões de ferro para dar continuidade com os acabamentos da sua casa, sendo que o primeiro foi para dar inicio a obra. Diz que o seu maior sonho é ter uma casa condigna e uma família feliz bem como continuar a ser cliente da Hluvuku.
texts.en: Fernando is a young man who just got officially married. He's a teacher and has an underage daughter. He lives with his family in a house that he owns. Fernando has worked for the government for a long time, but his salary isn't enough to cover his family's needs. That's why he's getting a second loan in order to purchase cement, bricks and iron rods so that he can continue the finishing work on his house. The first loan was for getting the construction started. He states that his biggest dream is to have a decent home and a happy family. He also wishes to continue being a client of Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks and iron rods so he can continue the finishing work on his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more bags of water to resell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es un nombre de 58 años de edad es casado tiene una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre 6 y 35 años de edad,  esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad del departamento de Sololá.
Francisco es un hombre con mucha humildad que para obtener sus ingresos trabaja como agricultor sembrando café y banano esta labor lo realiza el desde hace veinticinco años, gracias a estas dos producciones él ha sacado adelante a su familia y para generar otros ingresos  trabaja como jornalero. Francisco con el afán de incrementar su cultivo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo para poder ajustar su dinero y así poder comprar una cuerda de terreno donde él pueda cultivar, y así poder mejorar sus ingresos  y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
El gran sueño de Francisco es poder dejarles a sus hijos una buena herencia para que ellos vivan mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 58 year old man, is married and has a beautiful family of seven children from 6 to 35 years old. This humble family lives in a community in the department of Sololá. 

Francisco is a very humble man and to obtain income he works as a farmer planting coffee and bananas. He has done this work for twenty-five years, and thanks to these two productions he has provided for his family, and to earn additional income he works as a laborer.

Francisco, in an effort to increase his cultivation, has make the decision to request a loan in order to adjust his money and be able to buy a plot of land where he can cultivate, and therefore be able to improve his income and give his family a better quality of life. Francisco's great dream is to be able to leave his children a good inheritance to that they will live much better.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land for cultivation.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es: Mateo es un hombre de 51 años, vive en la localidad de Chivay que esta ubicado en Arequipa. El vive junto a su familia, sus tres hijos y su esposa. Se dedica a la cría de animales de granja, principalmente a ganado vacuno, siempre se ha preocupado por la calidad de sus animales para poder venderlos a un mejor precio, es por eso que su ganado es orgánico. Actualmente solicita el préstamo para poder comprar pacas de alfalfa orgánica, espera que su ganado este bien alimentado pero con comida de calidad y orgánico para poder ofrecerles luego a un mejor precio. En el futuro espera poder comprar una casa para vivir cómodamente con sus hijos y sobre toda con la mujer que siempre lo ha acompañado y apoyado, su esposa llamada Alodia.
texts.en:
Mateo is a 51 year old man who lives in Chivay, which is located in Arequipa. He lives with his family - his three children and his wife. He works raising farm animals, mainly cows. He is always concerned about the quality of his animals in order to be able to sell them for a better price, and this is why his cows are organic. 
He is currently requesting a loan to buy a package of organic alfalfa for his cattle. He wants his cattle to be well fed with quality organic food so that he can sell them later for a better price.
In the future he hopes to be able to buy a house to life comfortably with his children and above everything with the woman who has always accompanied and supported him, his wife whose name is Alodia.

loans.use: to buy a package of organic alfalfa for his cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more farm produce for sale in the market to increase her income gain

loans.name: Naftalia

texts.pt: O Senhora Naftalia é mãe solteira de 3 filhos e somente um vai a escola. Ela é funcionária do Estado como auxiliar administrativo,ela precisa reabilitar sua casa mas o seu salario não é suficiente para cobrir essas despesas pelo que viu a necessidade de solicitar um emprestimo na hluvuku para comprar cimento, pedra e tinta. Este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku. O seu maior sonho é construir um estabelecimento comercial para garantir a reforma e continuar com uma ocupação que lhe possibilite uma renda para o sustento da familia.
texts.en: Naftalia is the single mother of three children, only one of whom is in school. She works for the government as an administrative assistant. She needs to repair her house, but her salary isn't enought to cover these expenses. That's why she felt the need to apply for a loan from Hluvuku in order to purchase cement, rocks and paint. This is her second loan with Hluvuku. Her biggest dream is to build a store so she can afford the repairwork. Another dream is to continue having a job that provides her with an income to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks and paint.

loans.name: Constâncio

texts.pt:
O senhor Constâncio agente de serviço num estabelecimento da saúde, tem 40 anos de idade é casado e pai de 2 filhos, 01 a estudar o outro menor de idade, sustenta ainda o seu pai e vive na casa própria.
Com o valor do crédito pretende comprar barrotes, chapas, de zinco e varões para dar a continuidade a sua obra.
Tem como sonho terminar a sua casa e comprar uma viatura para transportar pessoal.
A insuficiência de fundos e o seu maior desafio, mas diz que irá solicitar mais empréstimos para tal vai pagar pontualmente.
texts.en:
Constâncio is a service agent at a health care institution. He's 40 years old and married. He has two children, one of whom studies and the other is below school age. Constâncio also supports his father. He lives in a house that he owns.
With the amount of the loan he intends to purchase beams, zinc plates, and rods so he can continue his construction work.
His dream is to finish his house and buy a vehicle for personal transportation.
His biggest challenge is the lack of funds. However, he states that he'll apply for more loans, which is why he'll make the repayments in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to purchase beams, zinc plates, and rods.

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala is 31 years old and married and the mother of 2 kids   Kamala is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Jabrayili refugee. 

Kamala  has been raising cattle for the past  6 years. Taking care of animals requires continuous effort, but her husband helps her to raise the cattle, and she also sells cheese, yogurt, butter and milk at the market. This is the only source of income for the family. From this business her monthly profit is 150 Azn . She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into the family.
 
She has applied for a loan of 1500 AZN from Aqroinvest in order to buy more calves. She has plans of expanding the business to meet the high potential for milk in the market. This is her 2nd loan.  Kamala  appreciates your support

loans.use: to buy more calves and thus increase profits as the only source of income for the family

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store pig fattening businesses. Leonisa is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell to customers.

Leonisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Rolando Esteban

texts.es:
En el campo hay personas maravillosas, amables, trabajadoras, pujantes, personas con aspiraciones y sueños en su vida y no todos son agricultores y campesinos hay jóvenes como Rolando que se capacito y estudio para dar soporte y arreglo a los implementos tecnológicos principalmente pc, pero también arregla tables y portátiles.
A sus 19 años de edad se puede dar el lujo de ser uno de las pocas empresas en el campo que ofertan este servicio por lo tanto tiene buen volumen de clientes que acuden diariamente a solicitar sus servicios.
Rolando quiere solicitar un préstamo el motivo es que necesita abastecerse de repuesto para computadores y portátiles y el monto es en relación a que comprara en cantidades para mantener existencias ya que para comprar dichos repuestos tiene que hacer un largo desplazamiento.
Su sueño es apoyar a su madre incondicionalmente y no dejar jamás que ella pase necesidades.
texts.en:
In the countryside one can find people who are lovely, friendly and energetic. People with aspirations and dreams for their lives. Not everyone is a farmer. 

There are also young people like Rolando who trained and studied to be able to repair and provide IT support for technology, in particular computers but also laptops and tablets. 

At just 19 years of age, Rolando has the pleasure of being able to say that he has one of the few businesses in the countryside that offers this IT service. As a result Rolando has plenty of customers that seek out his services daily.    

Rolando is seeking a loan to buy a quantity of spare parts for computers and laptops so that there is a good amount in stock. In order to get these parts he needs to make a large order. 

Rolando's dream is to support his mother unconditionally and never see her go without again.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of spare parts for computers and laptops so that there is a good amount in stock.

loans.name: Calista

texts.en:
Calista is a 27-year-old single woman with one child. She lives in Mudzi district in Zimbabwe.  She got a first loan to boost her poultry and repaid it on time. 

Calista would very much like to increase her sales volume and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use the second Kiva loan to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed to increase production and her poultry sales. She hopes to provide for herself and remain financially independent with the additional profits that she will be getting from the business. 

She is a Camfed Learner Guide volunteering at schools in her community. She does counseling sessions with students and helps at the local school during sporting activities

She is looking forward to creating sustainable employment and to provide for the family.

loans.use: To expand her poultry business to become financially independent

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina, married mother of 10, is a mixed-farmer and salesperson who has access to many sellers in the food chain. To make better income for her family, Paulina makes commission on sale from helping arrange the logistics of getting farm produce from local farmers to their buyers. 
Bearing in mind that she has been doing this he business since 1978, Paulina has build a strong network of chain actors and she has good reputation.
 
Given that Paulina can arrange a sale more easily than regular farmers can, she prefers to deal with larger volumes of produce. She is seeking a loan to aggregate more produce from local farmers at fair prices and use her better understanding of the market conditions and prices to sell at a profit. 

Your loan will help Paulina’s clients to focus on production, rather than sales, as it will her family to make better incomes and uplift their livelihood.

loans.use: to buy cereal merchandise

loans.name: Ruth Evila

texts.es:
Tierna, trabajadora, humilde, amorosa y muy apegada a su familia a si es Ruth una mujer que no puso pero, no se quejó ni se inmuto por su situación económica, por el contrario salió busco una ayuda y con un pequeño monto compro surtido de calzado para vender y generar el recursos para alimentar a su familia conformada por 4 hijos. 
Ahora esta gran mujer quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de surtido de calzado de baja gama que sea asequible para personas humildes.
Apoya a Ruth un pequeño monto de dinero marcaría una gran diferencia en su manera de trabajar.
texts.en:
Ruth is tender, hardworking, humble, loving and very close to her family. She is a woman who gave no "if, and or buts", did not complain about nor did she get upset at her economic situation. On the contrary, she went out seeking help and with a small amount bought an assortment of footwear to sell and generate the resources to feed her family, which consists of 4 children.

Now this great woman wants a loan to purchase an assortment of low-end footwear is affordable for humble people. Supporting Ruth with a small amount of money would make a big difference in the way she works.

loans.use: to purchase an assortment of low-end footwear that are affordable for humble people.

loans.name: St. Kizito Technical School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Dani. He is the Principal of St. Kizito Nyendo Technical School, a mixed school in the Urban area of Nyendo in Masaka with 400 students.  School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Kizito Technical School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Charles ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Julia

texts.pt:
A senhora Julia tem 53 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 6 filhos dos quais 4 estão na sua responsabilidade e dois já maior de idade e independentes. Para além dos seus filhos, sustenta mais dois netos que frequentam o ensino primário.
Esta senhora cria frangos, tem uma capoeira com a capacidade de quinhentos pintos e com o empréstimo de 22.000,00mts vai comprar material de construção, nomeadamente: cimento blocos, varrões, estribos para ampliar a sua capoeira.
Seu sonho é melhorar as condições de casa e a sua dieta alimentar e as dificuldades que encarra neste momento são financeiras e o desafio é reembolsar o empréstimo dentro de prazo acordado
texts.en:
Julia is 53 years old and married. She has six children, four of whom are under her responsibility and two are already independent adults. Aside from her children she also supports two grandchildren who are in primary school.
This lady raises chickens. She owns a coop that can house up to five hundred chicks. With the current loan for 22,000mts she'll purchase construction supplies, namely cement, bricks, rods, and stirrups so that she can enlarge her coop.
Her dream is to improve her living conditions and her diet. The struggles she faces right now are her finances. Her challenge is repaying the loan within the agreed-upon timeframe.

loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, rods, and stirrups so she can enlarge her chicken coop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, bricks, rods and stirrups in order to build her house.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself to be honest and operates a food stall. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a nice place and her primary customers are locals. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of ingredients for making food. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of ingredients for making food
